name: Athenian Niche in Plaka | Athenian Homes
description:
"The Athenian niche in Plaka" is "The Athenian House’s in Plaka" (https://www.google.com/travel/hotels/Athenian%20House%20In%20Plaka/place/12289793705477946366?ap) youngest sibling!
They actually share the same building and main entrance door.
But apart from that they are totally independent.
If you happen to be a big group travelling together maybe you might need to rent both villas and have the whole building to yourselves!
neighborhood_overview:
•Plaka
Plaka, also known as “the neighborhood of the Gods” due to its proximity to the Acropolis and its many archaeological sites, is one of the most picturesque areas of Athens. Stroll around, enjoy the unique architecture, visit souvenir shops and shops with local products, go for a Greek coffee at cafe Melina or try out Greek cuisine dishes at tavernas like Zorbas. Everything is right at your feet!
host_about:
I am Anna your host! I am Greek, born in Istanbul where I spent my childhood. My family and I moved to Athens in 1974, where I completed high school and then got a degree in Business Administration from the University of Piraeus. I am now a real estate agent and, most importantly, a mother of 3. I am also a member of a history club. I love exploring cultures, traditions and cuisines from all over the world.
I am a very welcoming and friendly person and I get great pleasure in going out and about, continuously discovering secret corners in the lovely city of Athens with my friends and family. As a hostess, I'll be happy to share any tip you may need concerning Athenian gastronomy, nightlife and cultural events to make you feel welcome in my beautiful city.

name: Athenian Apartments - Syntagma sq. #1
description:
Experience the vibrant heartbeat of Athens from "Small family apartment-1st floor, Apt. nu.1".

This cozy abode is one of five apartments located at "Athenian Apartments" on 15 Voulis Street, right in the heart of the city.

Book now and immerse yourself in the energy of Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
There are plenty of sights to see in Athens including classic ones like Acropolis, museums, ancient remains, and "Monastiraki" flea market. You can also visit National garden, "Kalimarmaro stadium", and Temple of "Zeus". Take in the city view from the hill of "Lecabetus or "Filoppapou". Explore every street for hidden gems such as coffee shops, restaurants, and unique stores.

In the neighborhood, you will find traditional Greek tavernas, a pharmacy, banks, and public transportation. For garbage disposal, there are small cans on the street corners and a green can for general garbage and blue ones for recycling at the end of Voulis st. and Kolokotroni st. Restaurant options include Tzitzikas & mermingas and Barbadimos, both located at 12-14 Mitropoleos st. For groceries, check out BAZAAR DISCOUNT MARKET at 28 Petraki st. or 45 Mitropoleos st. Alternatively, there are grocery stores at the corner of Nikis st. and Xenofontos st. or 5 Apollonos st.
host_about: Hi travelers! I'm Nasos, the proud owner of WelcomeHost, a company dedicated to delivering exceptional short-term rental experiences. As a culture-loving adventurer, I’m passionate about providing genuine Greek hospitality. Our well-appointed apartments, located in the historic heart of Athens, are designed for comfort and quality. I look forward to hosting you and making your stay truly memorable!

name: Modern Penthouse with Parking, Terrace & BBQ
description:
You will be staying at a unique rooftop Duplex Penthouse at Koukaki area, with extra large terrace with table and chairs.
Three bedrooms apartment,with 2 full bathrooms with cabin shower and 1 wc, a big open plan living room with a seating area, a kitchen and a dining table. One of the few nocarz apartments with a Free private gated parking!
The location is exceptional, walking distance to all sightseeing, close to lots of cafes, restaurants and bars.
Great place to experience Athens!
neighborhood_overview:
Koukaki is a residential area of Athens but at the same time is located so close to the historical centre of Athens that makes it the best place to stay. With a pedestrian street full of cafes, restaurants and bards the area is full of life the whole day.
You will not need a car to visit Athens but if you have one, do not worry the apartment has its own parking place.
The metro station is 1km away, so with a short walk you will be able to take it.
Kountouriouto basketball square 1min walking distance with a playground for all ages .Such alluring spontaneity is especially felt in Koukaki , the verdant, pedestrian-friendly adjoining neighbourhood just below the Acropolis. Despite the presence of this visitor-clogged landmark that surreally pops out in the midst of an urban landscape and several museums, they remain remarkably hushed, inviting wandering and lingering” this is what Vogue wrote recently about Koukaki area. And it truly is a new, hip and friendly neighbourhood
host_about:
Welcome to MyGreekVacations! We're thrilled to have you join us in one of our unique, beautifully-designed apartments here in Athens. As passionate travelers ourselves, we know that the perfect nocarz rental is more than just a place to stay – it's an experience that you'll remember for a lifetime. 
Whether you're here for business or leisure, we're always available to provide assistance to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

name: Ma Maison Downtown Villa N°8, Indoor Heated Pool
description: At Ma Maison Downtown Villa you will discover Athens at its best. This exquisite four-level villa, spanning 3.660 square feet, offers unparalleled luxury and convenience. It has a private heated pool, elevator,2 living rooms,3 bedrooms,2 full bathrooms,1 shower room,1 WC,parking and views of Lycabettus and Technopolis. The main sites will literally be on your feet. You can move everywhere by foot while the Kerameikos metro station is just 5’ away. It would be our honor to host you. Yannis & Rena
neighborhood_overview: Gazi is ideal for discovering Athens because of its ideal location in the heart of the city. It is a very safe and vibrant neighborhood with many shops to cover every need. From cafes, restaurants, bars, music venues to theaters and museums, Gazi is the neighborhood that covers everything. At the same time, you can walk around the center of Athens as everything is within walking distance. The archaeological site of Kerameikos is 200 meters away, the Ancient Agora and Monastiraki 1.5 km away, while the Acropolis can be reached by foot in 25 minutes, following the most beautiful route through all the main sights of Athens.
host_about:
Our company  Ma Maison Y&R owns seven luxury apartments in Athens.
We are Yannis and Rena, "fellow travelers" for the last twenty years. In 2016 we decided to do something that we love very much, through nocarz. 
The Greek word "ΦΙΛΟΞΕΝΙΑ=hospitality" is of a particular importance in the Greek culture. It’s a compound word from "ΦΙΛΩ=LOVE" and "ΞΕΝΟΣ=GUEST " and refers to the act of nestling and caring of a guest by the host. It was an institution for the ancient Greeks to welcome and take care of the guests at their home. They believed particularly in the idea of hospitality and regarded it as a moral duty and a sacred rule of the gods (Xenios Zeus was the protector of the guests). They offered them bath and sleep and they greeted them with gifts. The host and the guest were linked with friendly ties, which where inherited to their descendants. 
This is our inheritance.
It will be an honor to host you.

name: Stylish Contemporary Penthouse - Hip Athens Centre
description:
Located in Kolonaki, Central Athens’ upmarket neighbourhood, our penthouse apartment enjoys an ideal position - only a few minutes walk from the iconic Syntagma square and some of the country’s most prestigious museums and art galleries.

Situated on the top (6th) floor, the apartment enjoys double exposure and natural light all day long. Recently renovated to the highest and most modern standards, it benefits from a 20 sqm equipped terrace with some views of Lycabettus hill.
host_about:
We are two professionals based in London.

Antonio is from Rome and works in the energy risk management sector. This role takes him all over the world. In his 20’s, he opened a cocktail bar in a Greek island.
 
Olivier is an environmental lawyer specialised in the low-carbon transition.  

We both love travelling and we found in LISBON & ATHENS our gem hideaways. We hope you will enjoy them too by staying at our two nocarzs.

name: Cosy Boutique Apt. next to Metro
description: Smack dab in the center of Athens, in a vibrant, multicultural area your dollar stretches further than elsewhere in the city! Here's the scoop: 1) Steps from the metro/train 2) Unique 38 sq.m. studio that feels like home 3) Quickly reach all top tourist spots like Monastiraki, Acropolis, and museums 4) Just a 2-3 minute walk to ATTIKI station for metro and train connections 5) ATTIKI also links to Piraeus Port and mainland Greece.
neighborhood_overview:
A full of life neighbourhood, yet quiet and safe. We cannot say that this is the super "WOW" neighbourhood of Athens; it is a multi cultural area with various nationalities living here, which has its own character and culture with locals, with metro and train next to you.

You have the comfort to move to any place of the city easily, in few minutes. In addition, everything you may need, is in walking distance, from super markets to bakeries and take-away, bank, ATM, gym, hairdresser's, pharmacy, all kind of restaurants and fast foods (souvlaki, sandwich etc.) all at a very reasonable cost or low budget buys, comparing to other similar areas of Athens.

There is a weekly farmers' market authentic and very interesting, which is held every Saturday morning to the afternoon -in front of our building from January to June- and to the parallel street -which is called Michail Voda, from July to December- This is a popular market with fresh products, groce
host_about:
Hi!
My name is Eleni  Leela. 
 I have  made studies in two opposed subjects.  Business Administration and Art and  Design.  However it was Art that won my heart and I am now working as an Art Critic and Painter (specialised on aquarelle on silk).
 I am always interested in a challenge. I like reading, yoga, swimming, travelling, dieting.   
I love psychology and the  study of various religions .  
I am fascinated by Hinduism but mostly by the Buddhist  philosophy which has influenced my way of living and travel often to India, Nepal and Tibet.  
It is wonderful to meet new people and talk about life.  I currently spare my time between Greece and The Netherlands where I make Art for the Museum of Contemporary Tibetan Art.  
It is wonderful that I had the possibility to be a host and being in contact with people around the world.

name: 3 apts-1 building- roof terrace-garden-views.EP125
description:
Apartment combo located in a Bauhaus building with access to a roof top terrace with the view of the Parthenon (Acropolis main monument) and an internal garden.
There is a total of 5 apts and all have access to the terrace and the garden.
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in Psirri, minutes walk away from Monastiraki and Plaka.

Monastiraki station serves the Athens International airport and the port of Piraeus.

Plaka is the heart of Athens historical city centre, where most main monuments are located.

Psirri is a place where you still find lovely artisan shops such as candle making and leather work shops. It has great restaurants, cafes and art spaces.

You will also find grocery stores, bakeries and the Athens Central Food Market, the famous Varvakios Agora.

Walking around Psirri can be deceiving as it has many old buildings and lots of street art. The street art scene has produced many outstanding artists and their work is widely photographed and admired.

The artisan shops, the residents who greet each other by their first names and the visitors create a place of unique character.
host_about:
We at Boutique Athens offer accommodation to travellers who are interested in the cultural and artistic pursuits on offer in our amazing city, Athens.
We own and manage several fully serviced, high quality apartments in the centre of the city.
We are interested in food, art, modern history and what is new and exciting.
We personally meet and greet our guests.
We provide full kitchens for cooking, a wonderful art collection and many books on Modern Greece.

name: K5. Just walk into history!
description:
Cozy, bright & spacious loft (105m2) in center of Athens, in Psirri. Everything is within walking distance: 3 mins to metro station Monastiraki (line from/to airport); 3 mins to metro station Thissio (from/to Piräus ports); 5 mins to Plaka and Acropolis.
K5 is located in the middle of the vibrant and lively artists quartier Psirri. On weekends it might be louder due to live music events almost everywhere...plenty of tavernas, cafés, bars, artists shops etc... you'll love it!
neighborhood_overview:
Psirri is a very lively, creative multicultural neighborhood. You will find small craft shops everywhere that you thought were extinct... Art shops etc... Just around the corner are small streets with numerous cafes, tavernas also with live music, bars, shops where you can stroll around a Greek island... The apartment is basically quietly located on a side street, but it can get a little louder on weekends and holidays because of live music in the neighborhood. It is not a sanatorium!
The Acropolis can be easily reached on foot in a few minutes. As many museums and attractions, Monastiraki Square, Thissio, the art market, the flea market, the large market hall Varvakio with many fresh treats, fish, meat, vegetables, spices, and much more.

neighborhood_overview: Offering the best location to stay in Athens, Greece, Estia boutique apartments provide the perfect starting point for your city excursions. Set in the historic residential areas of Metaxourgeio and Kerameikos, Estia boutique apartments offer you an abundance of places to visit and things to do in Athens. Visit the Pinacoteca, the coffee shops, local taverns and bars, take a walk on the pedestrian roads and marvel the impressive neoclassical buildings. Head to the Parthenon and the Acropolis Museum, the Temple of Olympian Zeus and the Odeon of Herodes Atticus. Step back in time at the Byzantine & Christian Museum, the Benaki Museum and the National Archeological Museum. Stroll through the ancient agora, take pictures at the Temple of Poseidon, the theatre of Dionysos, the National Gardens and Hardian’s Arch. Observe the changing of the guards at the Parliament building on Syntagma square and marvel the temple of Athena Nike. Visit the Propylaia, the Temple of Hephaistos, the Stavros Ni

name: Near Acropolis Boutique Hotel | Ederlezi Jasmine
description: Jasmine is the feisty one, the fighter, the one who never gives up and battles through hardships. This 2nd floor, 22 sq.m. room is for 2 people and is full of stylish details and a comfortable double bed, while having a separate toilet & shower feature in the room.
neighborhood_overview: Ederlezi Boutique Hotel is located in 26 Lepeniotou Str. in Psyri, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighborhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the Athens Railway “Thissio” station or the central and iconic Monastiraki Metro station. The area around it, the Historic Center of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Vasilis, but my friends call me Bill. I am an entrepreneur and escape room designer by profession and choice! I have studied Economics & Accounting in Greece. I have worked for years in Management and Human Resources in Greece’s most premium restaurant chain, constantly interacting with people and learning from them! During the last years I was part of the team that created Great Escape Rooms. Great Escape Rooms is one of the first and most successful Escape Room companies in Greece, based in Athens, but with branches in other cities in Greece and Cyprus. I love meeting new people and interacting with them!
My choice in movies and literature is classic, with murder mysteries and crime fiction being my absolute favourite! I also enjoy period pieces and my guilty pleasure is pirate movies and Greek classic films of past decades. I also love playing board games!

I have great knowledge of Athens, the places to visit, eat and drink. Athens is not just its famous ancient monuments, or the modern and stylish nightlife spots. It is the small, under-the-radar corners of a city that give it its flavour, and Athens has many of them.

The neighborhood's transformation from workshops to art spaces symbolizes Athens' own journey of reinvention. Here, the old and the new coexist harmoniously, as neoclassical buildings stand side by side with modern establishments, offering a unique urban landscape.

neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki is the most upscale and stylish neighborhood in Athens, located on the southern slopes of Mount Lycabettus. The name “Kolonaki” means “little column,” referring to a small ancient column that stands in Kolonaki Square

The area is known for its luxury shopping, with numerous high-end boutiques and designer stores. It is famous for its vibrant café culture. You’ll find many chic cafés and sophisticated restaurants where locals and visitors alike enjoy their coffee and meals.

Cultural and Historical Sites
Lycabettus Hill: This hill offers panoramic views of Athens and is a popular spot for both tourists and locals. You can take a cable car to the top or enjoy a scenic walk. Kolonaki is home to several cultural institutions, including the Museum of Cycladic Art and the Benaki Museum.

name: New Luxury Studio in the Heart of Thiseio.
description:
Located in the traditional neighbourhood of Thiseio, in the center of Athens, one of the most popular and historical places in Greece.
Renovated in 2021 this luxury apartment will provide you with everything you’ll need. The double bed will comfort you and recharge your batteries after a long day of exploring the beauties of Athens.
Just a few minutes away, in walking distance, you can find Thiseio Metro station and also, you visit all historical sites like Acropolis, Plaka and Monastiraki.
neighborhood_overview:
Every neighbourhood in Athens lucky enough to have a view of the Acropolis thinks that theirs is the best in the city. But you really can’t beat Thiseio to appreciate the majesty of the Parthenon. Walking up the footpath behind the Church of St. Marina and past the National Observatory of Athens up to Pnyx Hill (birthplace of democracy), where you’re greeted with a spectacular perspective on the entire ancient city.

While most views of Athens reveal a sun-bleached concrete jungle, from this tree-lined summit you see how the historical centre is really a green island. After a long day exploring the city, venturing up at sunset is a great way to unwind. If you ever grow tired of staring down on the Propylaea, the main entrance to the Acropolis, and the temple of Athena Nike, you can always turn around and look out towards the sea, Piraeus harbour, the ships coming to and from, and the islands that dot the horizon.
host_about:
We  believe that providing high level hospitality is not just about offering a comfortable space to stay, but also making sure that guests feel welcome and taken care of during their entire stay. 

We truly believe that hospitality is an art form, and we committed to perfecting it in every aspect of our hosting. 

We look forward to welcoming you to Athens and providing an unforgettable experience that you'll cherish for years to come!

name: Elegant, spacious aprt for 6, jacuzzi @ Kolonaki
description: Welcome to Athens! Our elegant, spacious and sunny apartment combines the luxury of a hotel suite and the comfort of a private residence. Our apartment is designed to cover every need and to provide comfort to our guests. It is located at Kolonaki, at the heart of the city. Minimal decoration and modern design in a residence that can hosts up to 6 people and it has a private terrace with open jacuzzi. Here you will live memorable moments!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located at the heart of the city, at Kolonaki, one of the most known and historic areas. Under the Lycabettus hill, Kolonaki is one of the aristocratic areas of Athens with many activities and places to visit.

We suggest you walk through the area and discover the market and the hidden galleries between the neoclassical buildings and the modern apartment buildings. Only a few meters away from our apartment is Kolonaki square where you will find in the nearby streets high-quality restaurants, small coffee places, and many stores.

Very close to our apartment you will find the pedestrian street “Voukourestiou” where are many stores with haute couture and the pedestrian street “Ermou”, the most famous marketplace of Athens. Visit the unique museum of Cycladic History that you will meet a few blocks away from Kolonaki square and the Benaki Museum which has collections from all centuries.

Of course, Lycabettus Hill is one of our suggestions

neighborhood_overview:
Ampelokipoi, situated in the heart of Athens, is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood known for its mix of residential, commercial, and cultural offerings. Here's a detailed neighborhood description:

Residential Diversity: Ampelokipoi is a densely populated area with a diverse mix of residents, including families, young professionals, students, and expatriates. The neighborhood's residential streets are lined with apartment buildings of varying architectural styles, from modern high-rises to historic buildings with ornate facades.

Cultural Attractions: Despite being primarily residential, Ampelokipoi boasts several cultural attractions that add to its charm. The Athens Concert Hall, also known as the Megaron Mousikis, is a prominent landmark in the neighborhood, hosting a variety of concerts, performances, and cultural events throughout the year. Additionally, the Goulandris Museum of Natural History and the Byzantine and Christian Museum are popular destinations fo

host_about:
Born and raised in Athens; two different generations, mother and daughter, sharing the same admire for our beautiful city and the same passion for travelling and dancing.

Anny  is a Marketing and Communication graduate and a Tourism Management postgraduate that has been working for the past five years in a travel agency in the centre of Athens.  

Emilia is a lifetime entrepreneur from her early years dedicated to different fields of expertise.

We are dedicated to provide our guests with the essence of the Authentic Greek Hospitality. We are looking forward to welcome you in our amazing historical city, a city of ancient history, breathtaking views, scenic alleys, picturesque neighborhoods, romantic sunsets, Mediterranean beaches, traditional food, art, nightlife, sunny days and warm hearts.

One of my dreams is to travel throughout the world, meet different cultures and keep filling my album of life with unique pictures of different places. However, while people are the ones that give life to the beauty of a country, I am really pleased to become a part of your Greek experience and assist you to fill your own album of life with pictures of my fascinating city. It would be an honor to assist you in anything you may need during your stay in Athens and provide you with every information you may require.

We are really happy to welcome you to our city, to make you feel like home and to share with you our passion for exploration and travelling and our love for the historical, vibrant, sunny and diverse city of Athens.

neighborhood_overview:
Extract from ''Lonely Planet''
Kolonaki is an adjective as much as a district: it best epitomises the Athenian elite. Undeniably chic, Kolonaki is where old money mixes with the nouveau-riche and wannabes. Named after a tiny obscure column in the central Plateia Kolonakiou (Kolonaki Sq), Kolonaki stretches from Syntagma to the foothills of Lykavittos Hill, and is home to consistently popular cafes, restaurants, galleries, museums, boutiques and stylish apartment blocks. The area also contains a couple of notable museums and cultural institutions, which add to the air of nobility. The leafy upper reaches of Kolonaki transition into Lykavittos Hill, the highest point in central Athens. The wooden amphitheater up here hosts regular concerts during the summer.
Morning: Watch the world go by while fuelling up with coffee on Plateia Kolonakiou or at nearby Filion. Once you’re sated, head out to three of the best museums in Athens: Museum of Cycladic Art, Byzantine & Christian Muse

I've been to many places around the world but need to admit that 2 are my favorite ones (outside Greece) Bali and Toscane Italy.
I truly believe that hospitality is not only a mater of respecting, being friendly and helping ones guests or travelers in general but also reflects how much one loves his/her home place. name: Spacious 2BDR Apt With Acropolis View In Center
description:
Sip coffee on your balcony enjoying an Acropolis view seemingly a stone’s throw away. Our two bedroom flat is the perfect base to tour all of Athens must visit sites, including the Acropolis, Acropolis Museum, historic and picturesque Plaka, the central square of Monastiraki and our charming neighborhood of Koukaki.
The flat includes a comfortable living room, full kitchen, a bathroom with bath and additional WC. This is where we lived, fell in love with Athens, and fell in love with each other.
neighborhood_overview:
Explore the Acropoli Neighborhood: Athens' Historical Heart

Nestled at the foot of the ancient Acropolis, the Acropoli neighborhood is a captivating blend of history, culture, and modernity. It's a place where the past and present coexist, offering visitors an unparalleled experience of Athens' rich heritage.

Dominating the skyline, the Acropolis is a symbol of classical civilization, featuring iconic structures like the Parthenon, the Erechtheion, and the Temple of Athena Nike. Stroll through the remnants of the Ancient Agora, once the heart of Athenian democracy, where philosophers like Socrates and Plato once walked.

The neighborhood is home to several world-class museums, including the Acropolis Museum, which houses priceless artifacts and offers a direct view of the Acropolis through its glass walls. Explore contemporary art galleries and cultural spaces that dot the area, showcasing both Greek and international artists.

From quaint tave

Welcome to the charming neighborhood of our Athens getaway! Immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of this old central neighborhood, where history meets modernity. Indulge your palate with a plethora of dining options offering diverse cuisines from around the globe.

host_about:
Hi everyone. I am Stratos Zafeiriadis

I am a husband, a father of a 3yrs old child, a host, an nocarz Community Leader in the capital of Greece, an Experience maker and a property manager in Greece (“where else” lol). 

I love Greece, its outstanding beauty and I have a dream:  to transmit to all my guests the hidden charm and all the secrets of my beloved country starting from A to Z. That’s why i am established from Athens to Zakynthos

During the summer I move to Zakynthos and here I like to express all my devotion for my island. I have created the Zante Free Walking Tour in order to widespread the beauty and history of my place. I really love this activity and I look forward to show it to you in one of the most beautiful places in the world! I’m not here to propose you just a nice accommodation. 

I always try to make your trip a lifetime memory. That’s why I could advise you places (secret or not) you will never been, places you will never imagine that exist! 

In Zakynthos also I run our family properties Alta Mare Villa Zakynthos and Alta Mare City View Luxury Apt (our new project).

During winter I move to Athens where I am proud to be the nocarz Community Leader of Athens and Attica Region.

I’d love to answer your questions and share with you my favorite spots of Athens and Zakynthos, the places where I actually live and love 

Stratos Zafeiriadis

name: Artist's spacious loft downtown
description:
In a small street, between four hotels ,is situated my apartment. It was an office building totally used now as residence from the new owners (except the ground floor).
It's a spacious loft 100m2.
An open plan area with seating area,dinning table and a fully equipped kitchen. Separated,on the back side,is the bedroom and the bathroom.
Everything in the loft,spaces ,furniture,lighting lamps and objects are designed by me and they are part of my personal collection. I m designer-lighting artist .
neighborhood_overview:
Psirri,Monastiraki and Plaka,are the oldest neighborhoods in Athens. For many years, Psirri, had lost its residential character and had become the center of craftsmanship in Athens, mostly about leather,clothing, bronze and lighting lamps.
Last years,this character changed. Many new residents (mostly artists) chose to stay here and many industrial buildings were converted into residential or hotels.
Now,walking in the small streets you will see a lot of the old activities together with stylish bars,restaurants and tavernas,cafes, vintage clothes shops, fashion hair salons, antique sale shops.
Psirri is the area of the city center were Athenians prefer to meet for a coffee or for lunch-dinner during weekend or after a shopping at Ermou str.(the most commercial street in Athens).
host_about: I am a lighting artist living and working in Athens, Greece.

host_about:
I am the founder and CEO of Sparrow.  A vacation home rental management company operating in Greece that helps property owners to lease their property with the best terms.

We offer hospitality services to homeowners and guests alike.

For us, the proper management of your property concerns both the organisation, supervision and optimisation of digital channels, as well as the organization, supervision and maintenance of your property itself. Our goal is to differentiate your listing from competition and increase your bookings and income.

At Sparrow we love tourism. We love to travel around the world, learn about new cultures, admire the beauty of new places and exchange experiences.  We are travellers ourselves, travelling in many countries and continents, and we are well aware of modern tourists’ needs. name: An elegant apartment at the heart of Athens
description: Marika apartment is elegant, peaceful and friendly. It’s the perfect home where you can rest, relax and recharge yourself before you wander in the cobblestone streets of Plaka, take a photo beside ancient monuments and enjoy the wild nightlife.
neighborhood_overview:
Marika apartment is located in a typical neighbourhood less than 2km from the centre of Athens and is situated on the ground floor of a lovely corner apartment block constructed in the 1960’s, near Megaro Mousikis metro station.

Megaro Mousikis itself is the beautiful modern concert hall of Athens which hosts many magnificent performances.

100m from the apartment is the park of St. Charalambos on the edge of the Kesariani forest which stretches up in to the mountain of Hymettus.

In the other direction the fashionable aristocratic neighbourhood of Kolonaki is just 1km away in the foothills of Lycabettus where you can either stroll or take a cable-car to the top of the hill for breathtaking views of the whole of Athens.

The Panathinaikou Stadium, where the first modern Olympics was held in 1896, is 1.5km away and opposite this are the National Gardens. 500m walk from the apartment takes you to the beginning of Vasilissis Sofias Avenue with i
host_about:
Marika lives near to Athens in the suburb of Piraeus and has travelled widely throughout Greece and many countries around the world, immersing herself in a variety of cultures by integrating with the everyday lives of the people in every region and country she visits. 

She wishes all who stay in her apartment to experience the same respect and hospitality she has received on her travels and hopes that the clean, comfortable and pleasant accommodation she provides will help to make their stay enjoyable.

neighborhood_overview:
Kerameikos Highlights

Ancient Heritage: Kerameikos, rich in history, is recognized primarily for its ancient cemetery, which played a pivotal role as Athens' most significant burial site in antiquity. The area's name derives from the local potters (kerameis) due to the abundant clay found in the vicinity, highlighting its historical connection to pottery and craftsmanship.

Archaeological Insights: The archaeological site within Kerameikos unveils a tapestry of ancient life, encompassing the expansive cemetery, remnants of the city's fortifications, and various funerary sculptures and stelae. These relics provide a window into the funerary customs, social structures, and daily routines of ancient Athenians.

description: 25m² apartment on the 3rd floor in the Psyri area featuring one double bedroom, a fully equipped bathroom and a full kitchen with electric hobs. neighborhood_overview: Psyri is a gentrified Athens neighbourhood, today known for its restaurants, bars, live music tavernas, and small number of hotels. It's central square is called "Heroes square" (plateia Iroon), because the streets leading to it carry names of heroes of the Greek War of Independence (e.g. Karaiskakis, Miaoulis). In the era of the 'old Athens' (namely, during the last quarter of the 19th century), the nickname "plateia of Heroes" was a derisive reference to 'koutsavakides' (working class men), who would use it as a hangout.

name: Dimofontas - Hub Thiseio & Gkazi
description: Dimofontas Apt is situated right in the heart of Athens, midpoint to Thiseio & Gkazi (10' walk each). Also, Petralona station is 7' away. It is a modern, bright apartment characterized by its minimal, scandy design. The green element is also dominant with a direct view to Philopapou hill. In tranquil Ano Petralona parking is hassle-free. Dimofontos st is renowned for charming strolls around its graphical houses and the historic tsipouradika that offer the oldest Greek flavors.
neighborhood_overview:
Ano Petralona originates from the Greek words of "Petra" (stone) and "Aloni" (threshing floor), since they were used to thresh grain before urbanisation. It is one of the most historical areas of Athens, where old traditional houses are located since the Asia Minor immigration. Even Dimofontos st, has its own historical significance, as it originates from ancient Greek figure of Dimofontas, son of Theseus, who fought in the Trojan war.

The area is the epitomy of the center as it's walking distance from Gkazi, Thiseio, Acropolis and also the Metro station. Thus, it combines all desires of entertainment, from party to cultural-related to local hangouts for people wanting to take a glimpse of the Greek lifestyle. Philopappou hill is opposite to the apartment and it's the perfect place for an early morning walk or late afternoon for our pet owners. It offers one of the most magnifiscent cityviews in the town.
host_about: I am a perfectionist. I try to bring the best experience to my guests by loving what I do.

description:
Independent single storey house in Petralona!
A perfect place if you want to be in the Historic Center but also avoid the horde of tourists & the busy roads.

15 min walk to ACROPOLIS(1km).

neighborhood_overview:
+++++ Overview :

The house is located in Ano Petralona, a traditional and quiet neighborhood near the city center.

On the base of Filopappou Ηill (1min from home), it’s a perfect place for relaxing walks across “old Athens”, just a breath away from the historic center and the main commercial tourist area.

You will have the chance to feel the real local urban heartbeat in one of the most beautiful Athenian neighborhoods.

You can cross Filopappou Hill and reach the Acropolis (1km) while having a delightful walk through olive trees and ancient ruins all the way!!!
The hill also offers great views of the city.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

• Philopappos Monument
• Acropolis
• Acropolis museum
• Temple of Hephaestus (Thissio)
• Ancient Agora
• Monastiraki (flea Market)

name: Ritzy 2BR Apartment in the Heart of Kolonaki
description:
Step out of your apartment and into one of the most historic areas of Athens, Kolonaki. It's a district that covers a huge area, from Syntagma to the edges of Lycabettus hill. Enjoy the lovely weather with a cup of coffee and relax in the big terrace with sunbeds! Take a break to refuel and let your senses guide you through the countless cafes and restaurants of the buzzing neighborhood of Kolonaki right around the corner!
Nearest Metro Station: Evangelismos-6 min walk. Internet up to 24Mbps.
neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki is the area that the elite of Athens used to live before many of them moved out to the suburbs. It is an area full of high end shops and ritzy cafes at the base of Mount Lykavettos.
Kolonaki is characterized by its neoclassical architecture, chic atmosphere, and vibrant cultural scene. It is a popular destination for both locals and tourists, attracting people who enjoy shopping, fine dining, and exploring art galleries and museums. The area also offers a lively nightlife with stylish bars and restaurants.
The neighborhood's central location provides easy access to other parts of Athens, contributing to its popularity as a prime residential and commercial hub. Overall, Kolonaki embodies the cosmopolitan spirit of Athens and offers a sophisticated and chic urban lifestyle for those who appreciate its elegance and amenities.
host_about:
Hi! We are UPSTREET and we would like to welcome you to your new home away from home!

Combining our genuine love for Athens with our professional knowledge, we aim to offer you the best time during your accommodation.

Even if you are traveling for a few days or for a while, our freshly renovated apartments are in central and vibrant locations, ready to provide you with the most reliable services and amenities.

Your experience is not based on luck or the choices of each owner anymore. Live only the surprises you signed up for and get to know the city like a local.

The best things might be waiting for you upstreet. Get ready and just enjoy the ride!

name: Gaia | King Interior Room | Historical Center
description: Where the comforts of home meet the local stylish influences of the central Psirri neighborhood - GAIA offers a stay like no other for travelers looking to experience real Greece, and live the local way! With our newly renovated rooms, guests are invited to immerse themselves in Athens’ culture with all necessary amenities at their disposal. Sit back on your sofa and soak up the welcoming Psirri atmosphere, in your homely King Interior Room, ideal for individuals and couples.
neighborhood_overview:
We are very fortunate at GAIA to be based in the centre of Athens’ old town, the heart of our modern-ancient capital, where guests will find the likes of the Acropolis, the ancient Roman Agora, the (modern!) central shopping area and many other sites worth visiting only a walk away! If you’re wanting to discover more of Psirri, our buzzing local neighbourhood, and its captivating energy, we recommend stepping out in the evening to explore the best eateries and bars our community (and to be honest, the city) has to offer, and all right at your doorstep! Get yourself ready for a night of authentic non-stop Greek dining and, if you’re brave enough to survive the early hours, Athens’ famous never-ending nightlife!

You’ll find us conveniently located within walking distance from Monastiraki station, and among the best local hangouts in Athens! The Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city - eclectic, lively and on-trend. Experience r
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Flat in Monastiraki with unique view of Acropolis
description: A unique apartment in the city center of Athens, just 150 metres away from Monastiraki metro station. It has a breathtaking view of Acropolis from its private balcony.  It is located, close to all main attractions and connected to the airport via metro, bus and trains. There are many supermarkets, stores, restaurants in the area easily reached on foot. All health protocols are followed. Special cleaning measures are applied against Covid 19. Netflix Disney Plus are also available via a smart TV!
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located at Monastiraki district in the historic centre of Athens. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, cafes, supermarket, stores with folklore items such as sandals, clothes, handmade, leather bags. Monastiraki is considered as the heart of local cuisine where you can taste original Greek food and buy fresh, traditional products. In addition, Monastiraki area is the best place to have a taste of Athens’ nightlife.
Psirri is also another interesting area close to the flat. All the food lovers and the fans of cocktails will find the most sophisticated bars and restaurants in Psirri. It is accessible within 5 minutes walk.
For holidaymakers who crave to combine historic visits and fun at the seaside, this flat is ideal since you have easy access to the Athenian beaches too . To get there by using the subway, you should get off at Syntagma metro station. Then, you will take the tram towards Asklipio Voulas and get off either at Edem station, or Alimos, or Paralia
host_about: I am a really sociable person and i could be characterised as a maniac traveler. I am keen on visiting and exploring the secret not only of the biggest cities but also of picturesque villages. I used to spend my summertime vacations in greece so i am a sea lover.

name: The Parthenon View in the Historical Center!
description:
The Parthenon View penthouse is close to everything, 600m. away from the Acropolis and among all the major tourist attractions!
Directly from the airport by metro with the blue line, no changing lines needed! Direct connection with the Piraeus port by metro (green line).
Enjoy the Big Terraces with the Parthenon View on every floor! PLUS: you even have access to the private roof Terrace with a 360 view! :)
Located in the lovely area of Psyri.
neighborhood_overview:
Central location with the major tourists attractions.Our mini-maisonette is located in Psyri, a colourful and vibrant neighbourhood in central Athens! It's full of fashionable bars, trendy restaurants and lovely nightlife.Spend an afternoon at nearby bars and restaurants or admiring the dazzling artwork of the Parthenon from the private Terrace. Stroll through Ermou, a must-see for vintage and montern shopping. Savour the mouth-watering greek "souvlaki" and greek local desserts from nearby shops. Whether you spend your days on a historic tour or sipping wine with your friends and beloved ones on the top floor lounge, experience old and new at Psiri neighbourhood.After a full day of sightseeing you can enjoy a relaxing break in one of the hammams scattered throught Athens.
Being so close to the Acropolis hill and the ancient Agora or market, Psiri is one of the oldest neighbourhoods of Athens. It forms part of the “Historic Triangle” that was the heart of Athens in Ancient G

Come as guests and stay as friends.
We are excited and looking forward to hosting you!

name: Hoppersgr- Amazing apt in the heart of Athens - 5
description: A very unique and aesthetically pleasing 50m2 studio, in a walking distance from the heart of Monastiraki and Acropolis. Equipped with fastWiFi, A/C, NetflixTV, double glazing, fully equipped kitchen to make your stay unforgettable! Located in a safe and vivid neighbourhood with direct access to all public transport and surrounded by local restaurants, cafes and shops. Best place to relax after a busy day of exploring beautiful Athens!
neighborhood_overview: Old and new Athens converge in Monastiraki. The metro disgorges passengers on Adrianou, a street that is the flea market's main artery but was also part of the ancient city. The city’s historical layers and the area’s traditionally diverse communities align here: look up from the square towards the Acropolis and your line of sight crosses both a mosque and a Byzantine church. Monastiraki, or ‘little Monastery’, is named after a monastic compound that once occupied the site. Today, all that’s left is the small 10th-century Pantanassa basilica on the square.

host_about:
I am the founder and CEO of Sparrow.  A vacation home rental management company operating in Greece that helps property owners to lease their property with the best terms.

We offer hospitality services to homeowners and guests alike.

For us, the proper management of your property concerns both the organisation, supervision and optimisation of digital channels, as well as the organization, supervision and maintenance of your property itself. Our goal is to differentiate your listing from competition and increase your bookings and income.

At Sparrow we love tourism. We love to travel around the world, learn about new cultures, admire the beauty of new places and exchange experiences.  We are travellers ourselves, travelling in many countries and continents, and we are well aware of modern tourists’ needs. We know what information and what services are needed, for the guest to have the best experience, have an excellent time and feel safe.

That’s why at Sparrow, our mission is to help property owners provide the real Greek hospitality and together, we can share with our guests a modern experience based on the highest standards.

description:
This small yet eclectic 1 Br Apt is newly renovated, spacious, has all you need and is literally next to everything that is worth seeing or doing! Its strategic location next to the new exceptional Goulandris Museum, which is an experience on its own, makes this place a perfect choice if you want to discover Athens easily, on foot or any means of transportation.
It’s cozy, convenient, it has a fully equipped kitchen and a living room with a sofa bed for extra guest/s.
neighborhood_overview: Pagrati is a quiet area full of beautiful parks and squares where you can spend your evenings. The area is rich in cafes, restaurants and bars were locals choose to hang out and meet their friends. It is recommended to visit the Kallimarmaro stadium, an ancient stadium entirely made of marble, where the Panathenaic Games in Ancient Greece were being held. If you are looking for an open terrace to enjoy your lunch and coffee, we would recommend Arbaroriza. You could combine it with a visit to the Goulandris museum to experience the amazing collection of famous works of art!
host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

description:
Enjoy your stay in the most central but calm condo in Acropolis.

This fully new apartment is ready to give you the most comfortable stay in the heart of Athens. The flat is located in the central and famous neighbourhood of Athens, Acropolis. You will be staying just a glimpse away from the oldest area of capital, Plaka. Every important historical attraction is approachable within a few minutes on foot. neighborhood_overview:
The flat is literally near to everything.

Acropolis metro station is only 4 min away on foot (270 m), as well as the beautiful Acropolis museum.
In just 5 min you will be at the entrance of Acropolis hill, to explore the Parthenon temple and enjoy the breathtaking view.
The ancient theatre Herodion, were the biggest concerts are held is only 10 min away on foot.
Syntagma square is located 5 min away by metro (1 station away), but if you prefer walking you can get there in under 20 min. Monastiraki square is approachable on the same time (17 min).
Plaka, Filopappou hill, ancient market, Zappio, Kallimarmaro, National Garden and many museums are close to the apartment.

Airport is less than an hour away by metro.

name: Jazzy condo near Proskopon square
description: Welcome to our colourful one-bedroom apartment in Athens! Our newly renovated 35sqm apartment offers a very cheerful, but yet cosy, space to relax and enjoy yourself. It's ideally located within just a 9-min walk to Evangelismos metro station, a 3-min walk to Proskopon square and 10min walk to Kallimarmaro stadium, the first stadium that hosted the Olympic Games. Thus, it is the absolute starting point to explore the Athens ancient culture, while enjoying the modern athenean lifestyle!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is ideally located in a quiet neighborhood, near Proskopon square, of the recently transformed Pagkrati area. Just a quick 10 to 20-minute walk to Athens downtown and all the major attractions, Pagkrati has an blatantly Athenian feel, pock-marked with vegan eateries, cool bars, and pockets of green (Alsos Pagratiou and Adritou hill) alongside Michelin restaurants, long-standing tavernas and mom-and-pop run stores. You 're love its family-friendly, safe vibe combined with an animated social scene.
Proskopon (Scouts) Square is one of the points where the heart of Pagrati beats. Although it is located in a central part of the city, sitting in one of its coffee shops or restaurants, you will enjoy a quiet and relax feeling in one of the coolest corners of the city.

name: Modern Apartment in Athens, Walk to the Metro
description:
Athens Heartbeat, a modern apartment in Athens downtown, exceptionally connected to the rest of the city due to the metro and tram stations just across the street, bus stops some meters from the entrance and the best Athenian attractions in walking distance!
Two bedrooms, one bathroom, open plan living area with seating room, kitchen and dining area and the Acropolis view from the front balcony.
Modern, beautiful, comfortable apartment with many many amenities, wi-fi, a/c & balconies.
neighborhood_overview:
Kalliroe Avenue is one central avenue of Athens that connect the south suburbs and Peiraias to the city center. The location of the apartment is one of the best you can find in Athens, since it very well connected by metro, tram and bus but at the same time only some minutes walk from most of the well-known sightseeings of Athens.

Plaka and Thissio are just twenty minutes walk through the wonderful neighborhood of Koukaki which is known as the “little Paris” of Athens. And that’s because of its classy atmosphere and elegant and artistic shops and little, friendly bars. The neighborhood has everything you may need such as super markets, shops, restaurants, bars, bakeries, pharmacies, yoga and dance studios, etc. and has great connection with tram, metro, buses and taxis.
Thanks to the cosmopolitan style of the area you will easily communicate with the locals as most of them speak English and they are friendly.
The area is also safe for all types of travellers, solo

name: Luxury Apartment with Jacuzzi Close to Acropolis
description: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place. Luxury 65 s.q.m. apartment in the center of Psyri, Athens, just 2 min. from the Monastiraki sq. and the Metro station. Having a private, amazing balcony with Jacuzzi and a feel of Acropolis view. It Is the ideal choice for every kind of traveler in Athens, who wants to stay in the heart of vibrant Psyri, while being close to all major sights and nightlife spots!
neighborhood_overview: Living Stone Zircon is located in Psyri, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighborhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the central and iconic “Monastiraki” Metro station or the Athens Railway “Thissio” station. The area around it, the Historic Centre of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Giannis, an entrepreneur and a coffee shop owner. I really like meeting new people from all over the world while travelling or, even better, having them visit Athens and hosting them! I am energetic and forward-thinking (or so my friends and colleagues say about me), a physical as well as intellectual person. I enjoy football and alternative sports, but also reading good books and of course activities like puzzles and escape rooms, things I do for a living!
I have travelled all over Europe and Africa and I consider Paris and Budapest my favourite destinations, places of history but also modern and cosmopolitan, having many things to see and do.
Films and TV shows about historic events and murder mysteries are my favorite and recently I got infatuated with Money Heist (“La casa de Papel”). while my literature of choice is mainly classic and timeless. I could not imagine myself as I am today without having read “Around the World in 80 Days” in my childhood!
I enjoy Mediterranean and Greek traditional cuisine, but I would like to taste every culinary tradition the world has to offer.
As for a life moto? “You can learn more for a person by playing with him/her for an hour than by a year-long conversation”, by Greek philosopher Plato.

name: Apartment Near Acropolis | Ederlezi Flora
description: Dedicated to her sisters yet versatile, Flora is the eldest. neighborhood_overview: Ederlezi Boutique Hotel is located in 26 Lepeniotou Str. in Psyri, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighborhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the Athens Railway “Thissio” station or the central and iconic Monastiraki Metro station. The area around it, the Historic Center of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Vasilis, but my friends call me Bill. I am an entrepreneur and escape room designer by profession and choice! I have studied Economics & Accounting in Greece. I have worked for years in Management and Human Resources in Greece’s most premium restaurant chain, constantly interacting with people and learning from them! During the last years I was part of the team that created Great Escape Rooms. Great Escape Rooms is one of the first and most successful Escape Room companies in Greece, based in Athens, but with branches in other cities in Greece and Cyprus. I love meeting new people and interacting with them!
My choice in movies and literature is classic, with murder mysteries and crime fiction being my absolute favourite! I also enjoy period pieces and my guilty pleasure is pirate movies and Greek classic films of past decades. I also love playing board games!

I have great knowledge of Athens, the places to visit, eat and drink. Athens is not just its famous ancient monuments, or the modern and stylish nightlife spots. It is the small, under-the-radar corners of a city that give it its flavour, and Athens has many of them.

neighborhood_overview:
Monastiraki, a lively and eclectic neighborhood in the heart of Athens, is a captivating blend of history, culture, and vibrant energy. Named after the Monastiraki Square, which translates to "Little Monastery," this area is a mosaic of ancient ruins, traditional markets, and modern cafes.

At the heart of Monastiraki is the bustling square, a dynamic meeting point where locals and visitors converge. Surrounded by a mix of neoclassical buildings and traditional Greek architecture, the square is a gateway to the historic Plaka district and the iconic Acropolis.

The Monastiraki Flea Market, a kaleidoscope of colors and aromas, is a major draw. Here, you can wander through narrow cobblestone streets lined with antique shops, boutiques, and stalls selling everything from handmade crafts to vintage treasures. It's a haven for those seeking unique souvenirs and a taste of Athens' artisanal offerings.

neighborhood_overview:
The area:

Located in the upscale neighborhood of Kolonaki, this area is one of Athens’ most prestigious and sought-after districts, known for its elegant streets, neoclassical buildings, and vibrant cultural scene. Kolonaki is a hub of luxury shopping, dining, and entertainment, offering an array of high-end boutiques, trendy cafes, fine dining restaurants, and chic bars. It is also home to several art galleries and museums, such as the Benaki Museum and the Museum of Cycladic Art, providing a rich cultural experience right at your doorstep. The nearby Mount Lycabettus, a notable highlight, offers breathtaking panoramic views of Athens and the Acropolis, especially at sunset, and is accessible either by a scenic hike or a funicular ride.

neighborhood_overview:
Discover the charm of Ano Petralona, an extraordinary neighborhood in Athens that offers a delightful blend of history, authenticity, and proximity to major attractions.

Nestled in the heart of the city, Ano Petralona boasts a distinct local atmosphere, with its picturesque streets lined with cozy cafes, traditional taverns, and vibrant markets. Its close proximity to renowned sites like the Acropolis and Plaka makes it an ideal base for exploring Athens' iconic landmarks.

Immerse yourself in the neighborhood's rich history by visiting the captivating Petralona Cave, while indulging in delicious Greek cuisine and experiencing the genuine warmth of the locals.

Ano Petralona promises an unforgettable Athenian experience.

name: Cozy Apartment in Local Athina
description:
The apartment is a brand new 2 bedroom apartment of 60 sqm with a fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and balcony with stunning views of Acropolis and Lycabettus Hill. It has Air conditioners, 24/7 hot water, and fast Internet. It is located in Neos Kosmos, a local neighborhood with convenient transportation and facilities. You will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place.
With a maximum capacity of 5 guests, it's the perfect choice for a worry-free Athens experience.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the lively and diverse neighborhood of Athina, Athens. This local neighborhood offers a unique blend of residential charm and urban vibrancy. You'll find a wide range of shops, supermarkets, and local markets nearby. Many of Athens' popular attractions and landmarks are easily accessible. You'll have the opportunity to explore historical sites like the Acropolis, the Ancient Agora, and the Temple of Olympia Zeus, all within a short distance from the apartment. On Saturdays, the streets nearby come alive with the bustling market activity. Vendors set up their stalls, offering a wide array of goods and products. You can expect to find an assortment of fresh produce, locally sourced fruits and vegetables, aromatic herbs, and an abundance of colorful flowers.

name: Beautiful Spacious Luxury Apartment, Prime Central Athens
description:
Beautiful large newly-renovated 2 bedroom 2 bathroom (one en suite) apartment, 110m2 on fourth floor (elevator) with balcony lounge view on Lycabettus. Central Athens in prime Pagrati, a short walk to the main sights, amenities and metro (airport line).

Tastefully furnished and decorated with original art, independent central heating & AC for year-round comfort, mosquito screens. Large dining area, cable TV & Netflix, kitchen with top appliances including washer/dryer.

A home away from home!
neighborhood_overview:
This home is set in the upmarket, hip and safe area of Pangrati, surrounded by great cafés, restaurants, tavernas, bars, and shops. It is a short stroll to a lovely park, while the main Athens sites, museums, and shopping areas are within easy reach.

All our guests comment that while the apartment is so close to everything that they want to visit, they really appreciate that they are living in a traditional yet hip neighborhood and that they experience real Athens life throughout their stay!
host_about:
I and my mother Yanna and our co-host Nina love to provide our guests with a true home experience during their stay, where they can enjoy good things and happy times in a great space. I myself often travel for work and for pleasure and consider it important to stay somewhere that feels right, and we try to create this same feeling for our guests at our own condo apartments in Athens.

We're always available before and during your stay for any queries that you might have, and we'll do our best to make sure that you have a great experience during your time with us.

I was born, grew up and studied in Dublin and London before working for many years in finance, based mainly in London and latterly in Zurich including extensive work travel. Since mid-2020 I am based in Athens.

name: Deluxe Suite Aethra - 2 Mazi Suites
description: In the heart of Plaka – where ancient history converges with the city’s vibrant contemporary lifestyle – 2 Mazi Suites offer stellar accommodations to discerning travellers who want to experience Athens to its fullest.
neighborhood_overview:
With an enviable location in the heart of the historic neighbourhood of Plaka, you’ll be in the midst of everything that Athens has to offer. All landmarks and attractions are just minutes away on foot – and there is an unlimited choice of cafes, restaurants, shopping and nightlife in and around this charming area.
The emblematic Parthenon and the iconic Odeon of Herodes Atticus, which has been staging musical and theatrical performances for two full millennia, are less than 10 minutes away.
Zappeion, a Neoclassical masterpiece hosting all sorts of exhibitions and events, is just 500 meters away, and so are the National Gardens of Athens – a great place to walk, run or just enjoy your coffee and drink amid luscious trees and flowers.
The posh Kolonaki area, with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is about 1.5 Km frοm your doorstep.
host_about: An innovator with a sterling 50-year track record in the fields of hospitality and tourism, Hellas Elements curates extraordinary experiences by capturing and translating the (quint) essence of Greece into unforgettable moments. From exceptional accommodations in iconic destinations on the islands and the mainland to bespoke concierge services, we enrich your stays with uniquely crafted elements to create memorable journeys.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Kolonaki is one of the most prestigious and central areas of Athens. It is characterized by luxury, rich architecture and culture. It is known for its impressive neoclassical buildings, luxury residences, sophisticated boutiques and sophisticated restaurants and cafes. The area also offers rich shopping possibilities, with many stores with international and domestic brands. In addition, the neighborhood of Kolonaki is known for its lively nightlife, with trendy bars and clubs offering unique entertainment experiences. In addition, the neighborhood has an excellent transport connection, as well as easy access to parks and recreational areas. Overall, Kolonaki is one of the most desirable and developed areas to live in Athens.

description: Welcome to our Fancy philosopher Apartment in Kolonaki. Featuring 3 bedrooms with private bathrooms, a large living room, a fully equipped kitchen & a small WC, this spacious & bright apartment is ideal for couples, families with kids as well as for large groups of friends. Painted in pastel colors & decorated with modern furniture, Fancy Philosopher combines elegance with comfort. Experience the Greek capital from the heart of the city center & observe life in a local Athenian neighborhood .
neighborhood_overview:
This is a wonderful part of downtown Athens that offers proximity to some of the most important landmarks of the world, as well as great options for dining or meeting with business partners and friends. Everything you need, from supermarkets, bakeries and grocery stores to bustling cafes and bars, modern eateries, fancy restaurants and chic shopping, is within fast and easy walking distance. Plus, bus and metro connections are excellent, if you want to venture beyond the city center – every corner of which, is accessible by foot, when you feel like taking a leisurely stroll.

Highlights

Kolonaki square – the beating heart of Athens’ most prestigious neighborhood – is a mere 5-minute walk away and so are the area’s high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical center are less than 20 mins by foot while Syntagma square is at 1 km. Lycabettus hill, a verdant oasis in the midst of the ci

Welcome to MyGreekVacations! We're thrilled to have you join us in one of our unique, beautifully-designed apartments here in Athens. neighborhood_overview: Koukaki is a charming and vibrant neighborhood in the heart of Athens, just south of the Acropolis. It's known for its relaxed, local atmosphere combined with a trendy, up-and-coming vibe. You'll find a mix of traditional tavernas, modern cafes, and stylish bars, offering everything from authentic Greek cuisine to international flavors. The streets are lined with colorful buildings, small shops, and local businesses, creating a lively and welcoming environment. Despite its central location, Koukaki maintains a friendly, neighborhood feel, making it a great place to experience authentic Athenian life. It's also incredibly convenient for sightseeing, with the Acropolis Museum and other major attractions within easy walking distance. Plus, excellent public transport connections make exploring the rest of Athens a breeze.

neighborhood_overview:
Makrygianni or Makriyanni is a neighborhood of Athens, Greece. Also known as Acropolis, it is located in the south side of Acropolis and bounded between the avenues Dionysiou Areopagitou and Syngrou. The district is named after Ioannis Makrygiannis, Greek general of the Greek War of Independence, who used to own a house and fields in the area. Opposite the house of Ioannis Makrygiannis a military hospital was built – known as Weiler Building after the architect who designed it.This building was later used as gendarmerie headquarters and a violent battle took place there during the Greek civil war, in 1944. In the Makrygianni's neighbourhood is located the new Acropolis Museum that was inaugurated in 2009. Makrygianni is a densely populated area - already congested by the 1960s and 1970s - but remains a relatively expensive neighborhood due to its proximity to the Acropolis ruins.
The neighborhood is served by two metro stations and one urban rail-way stop:
--the Acropolis m

Hey,
we are Lila and George and we are looking forward hosting you! 
I (Lila)  am   a software engineer whereas George teaches  ancient Greek in high school. I adore  jazz,  mystery novels, interior design and of course travels.
(my favorite  jazz artists are Louis Armstrong, Art Tatum, Miles Davis, Stephan Grappelli and my favorite mystery authors are  George Simenon and Andrea Camilleri ). I dream to visit Prague, Bergen, NY, Egypt, St.Petersburg, Cuba, Peking and many other places....
George loves Plato,Socrates, Maria Callas, Nana Mouskouri and the french singer Dalida. He dreams to visit Egypt, St.Petersburg, Ethiopia, Peru and the Greek island of Milos !!
We all adore home made pizza!  When our kids were young we used to prepare it    every Sunday.  It was and remains our family's ritual !
When we travel as a family,  we are looking  for  a warm ambiance, amenities to live (and eat) on a budget, BUT without any compromises in the elegance and style. Quite difficult!
So, we are  happy that nocarz came into the scene and  we are glad to offer other  families (or couples, or friends )  what we would like to enjoy during our  travels abroad. The reviews we got, up to now,  show  that we have achieved this goal! It would be nice to meet you guys !

name: Beautiful Apartment in Koukaki 10min to Acropolis
description: Cozy, stylish and artistic, this fully furnished Terpsikhore apartment at Muse Residence is located at one of the friendliest yet classic neighborhoods of Athens right at the footsteps of Acropolis and Filoppapou Hill and just a breath away from the most picturesque and historical sights and Plaka. Excellent public transport links to Metro, busses and trolleys can get you anywhere around the city, airport and Pireas port.
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy a wonderful stay at the classic neighborhood of Athens and meet the best sides of the city!
The neighborhood is quiet with friendly residents and classic, art deco buildings, artistic cafes, bars and family owned tavernas serving home cooked food, tiny stores with design clothes and accessories or locally produced delicacies. Right next door you will find a nice gallery café, while the supermarket, the bakery, the liquor store and the pharmacy are just a few meters away.

The trolley stop is right next-door and will take you directly to the Metro Fix station if you want to avoid walking for 10 minutes.
Within 10 minutes walking distance you arrive at the famous Acropolis museum, the Parthenon, Syntagma square, Plaka, Thisio, the National Museum of Modern Art that just opened and all the famous historical spots of the city.
Just around the corner you will, also, find a little square with nice cafés, snack bars and trendy cocktail bars for your night out
host_about:
Welcome to MyGreekVacations! We're thrilled to have you join us in one of our unique, beautifully-designed apartments here in Athens. neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in Psirri, minutes walk away from Monastiraki and Plaka. Monastiraki station serves the Athens International airport and the port of Piraeus. Plaka is the heart of Athens historical city centre, where most main monuments are located. Psirri is a place where you still find lovely artisan shops such as candle making and leather work shops. It has great restaurants, cafes, art spaces and an outdoor cinema where you can enjoy films in the original language. You will also find grocery stores, bakeries and the Athens Central Food Market, the famous Varvakios Agora Walking around Psirri can be deceiving as it has many old buildings and lots of street art. The street art scene has produced many outstanding artists and their work is widely photographed and admired. The artisan shops, the residents who greet each other by their first names and the visitors create a place of unique character.

Discover the Charm of Monastiraki, Athens:

Nestled in the heart of Athens, Monastiraki blends ancient allure with modern energy, offering a treasure trove of experiences.

Ancient Marvels:
Explore Monastiraki's cobbled streets and iconic square, surrounded by the Ancient Agora and echoes of ancient Greek philosophers. Visit the Acropolis, a symbol of classical Greece, and the Museum of the Ancient Agora for a deeper dive into history.

Monuments and Museums:
Delve into the past at the Acropolis and marvel at the Parthenon's brilliance. Discover the Museum of the Ancient Agora's artifacts, bringing ancient Athenian life to light.

Lively Bazaars and Markets:
Indulge your senses in Monastiraki's bustling markets, where vibrant street art meets antique treasures in the Flea Market.

Gastronomic Delights:
Savor Greek cuisine in tavernas and cafes lining narrow streets. From traditional souvlaki to delectable pastries, M

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is centrally located in Koukaki, “one of the top 5 must-visit neighborhoods” in Athens as decreed by nocarz. The Acropolis and all the main attractions such as Plaka and Thiseio are nearby – it’s just a 15-minute walk to the Acropolis and a 12min walk to the Acropolis Museum. At the same time, the quaint neighbourhood of Mets and the Temple of Olympian Zeus can be easily accessed on foot.

The “Syggrou Fix” station with metro, bus and tram connections, is 550 meters away from your doorstep which makes moving around in whichever direction quick and easy. The hip and happening pedestrianized streets of Koukaki are brimming with drinking and dining options. Take a stroll and discover traditional meze restaurants (tapas), sophisticated Greek dining places, and wine and cocktail bars. With hipster spots and more authentic options available, you can take your pick as your mood strikes.

Bakeries, grocery shops, supermarkets, hairdressers, arts and crafts sh
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome you to one of our nocarz apartments in Athens, our goal is to ensure that you have a five-star experience in staying with us. 

We are part of a local fun and exciting hospitality group called MyGreekVacations managing more than 100+ beautifully designed custom-made apartments inspired by our travels and our stays in nocarzs around the world. The experience of meeting so many lovely people along the way is something we particularly enjoy, and the city of Athens is a hub where you can always find things to experience, see and do and we can’t get enough of it.

Our priority is to create a comfortable, relaxing and “home away from home” experience for our guests, a “workation” atmosphere for those who wish to combine business with leisure and to always be readily available and provide as much info and assistance as possible; all the things we value when traveling somewhere new ourselves.

Our home is your home! We treat our guests like lifelong friends and we love to spoil them during their visits.

We hope to see you soon.

name: The Place
description:
The space
It's a cosy penthouse apartment with a terrace overlooking Filopappou hill.
The apartment is recently and fully renovated and equipped with all the amenities: Tastefully selected furnishing, comfortable bed, and functional and modern kitchen for you to prepare your snacks or morning meals, air conditioning, hairdryer, wardrobe, free Wi-Fi, and fresh linen and towels.
Guest access
The guests can use the balcony with a view on filopappou hill
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in one of the central areas of Athens - Koukaki.
Koukaki has been voted among nocarz's "16 hottest neighborhoods to travel to in 2016"!!!

Koukaki is a vibrant neighborhood under the Acropolis Hill with many restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. You can also find everything you need just a minute away from the apartment: supermarket, grocery shops, bakeries, hairdressers, dry cleaning facilities, coffee shops and restaurants.

It is also a quiet and safe area, just a walking distance from Historical Center, Acropolis, Plaka and metro stations. Whether you are interested in shopping, the arts, culture, historical sites, or want to explore Athens's night scene, you will be able to walk EVERYWHERE from the apartment.
