neighborhood_overview:
The Acropolis is the most popular district of Athens. There is the rock of the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum and in the neighborhood there are many restaurants, bars, cafes and shops. A few meters away is the Plaka and Anafiotika. Monuments,restaurants,cafe bars, taverna, shopping, bakery, banks are at walking distance.
This elegant apartment is located 4 minutes walking distance from Acropolis Museum, 5 minutes walking distance from Plaka, 2 minutes walking distance from Modern art Museum.
Take a walk to Plaka, Anafiotika, Adrianou Street, Herodion theatre, Dionysiou Areopagitou street, Monastiraki, Thissio, to the ancient market of Athens, Temple of Olympion Zeus, National Garden, Syntagma square, Ermou street, Parliament. Everywhere by feet !
Walk a minute and get to the tram, taxi, bus for a walk to the sea.

Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The Diplomat’s ABR  Trikoupi 95
Situated in the historic street of Charilaou Trikoupi 95,

The spaces apart from the 21 comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy  spectacular views over the city of Athens, and one of the most prized landmarks –  the Lycabettus hill from morning till night

The Diplomat’s  ABR Trikoupi 95 has been fully transformed into a place that welcomes business travellers, couples, families and friends, who seek an urban sanctuary in the heart of modern Athens
 

Should you require any additional help or information during your stay with us, please do not hesitate to contact our Lobby Manager, at the lobby of our premises or the support telephone line of Athens Boutique Residence.  For emergency matters you may contact the building supervisor, who is located at the ground floor next to the main entrance.  

May I take this opportunity to thank you for having chosen the Athens Boutique Residence and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,


Your Athens Boutique Residence Team

name: Zeus by Heloni Apartments
description:
Our modern apartment is perfectly located 5' walk from the metro station & the new Archeological Museum, making it thus the perfect spot for eager adventurers. With all kinds of tourist attractions, fun hotspots, coffee shops and restaurants nearby, you are bound to get the most out of your stay!

5 is literally the magic number - 5 minutes to get to the Acropolis, to Plaka, Thissio, Hadrian's Arch, to eat, to drink, to shop | The ideal place for maximum experience with minimum effort!
neighborhood_overview: Andrea Sygrou Avenue is one of the most central streets in the center of Athens. It borders neighborhoods such as Koukaki and the historic center of Plaka. The apartment is located between the "Acropolis" and "Sygrou Fix" metro stations, offering easy access to/from the airport as well as your transportation within the city. The bus stops leading to the beaches are also a few meters away from the apartment. The historic center of Plaka, just a few minutes away, takes you back to ancient Greek times, with cobbled pavements and architecture from a different era. There you will find the entrance to the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum, the famous pedestrian street of Dionysios Areopagitos, various Museums and Art Exhibitions, as well as many souvenir shops, cafes and restaurants.
host_about:
Heloni is an ancient Greek word that translates into tortoise. This philosophy focuses on the sense of security and comfort that the turtle feels within its shell. 
Through the idea of the "Virtual hotel," we provide apartments that, although distant from a traditional reception, manage to ensure a comfortable stay. This approach allows guests to enjoy their desired privacy, creating an environment that enhances their travel experience.

The Acropolis surrounding area is the most popular part of the city for people visiting Athens.

The studio is close to the Acropolis and its museum, but also to Plaka etc. This gives our guests the opportunity to explore as much of Athens historic center as possible in a very short amount of time.

There are also many Koukaki shops, cafés, restaurants and several other options at your fingertips. Therefore, you can get a general sense of life in Athens by just having a look around.

Last but not least, the studio is connected (through subway) to the airport and Piraeus port. This makes it easy to both reach and travel to other destinations from it.

name: Ninas Athens Rooms: DAPHNE
description: The property is located in Monastiraki, just a 2-minute walk from the "Monastiraki" metro station! In this stunning, historic area, in the heart of Athens! Pole of attraction for Athenians, tourists and not only! The huge market, the sights categorize the area into one of the most beautiful areas of Athens. An area special but also special!
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of the Athenian centre, Monastiraki is a unique blend of rhythms, eras and cultures, vibrant and always dynamic – yet steadily dedicated to commerce and the meeting of people. If we stand in the center of Monastiraki Square and make a 360-degree turn on the spot, we can see the history of Athens in just a few square meters. Recently renovated, the Square was paved with mosaic blocks of marble, stone and carved cast iron, symbolizing the “flows” and the diversity of the Mediterranean peoples.
The Tzistarakis Mosque (1759) was named after the Ottoman Voivode of the city Mustafa Aga Tzistarakis. It was also known as the Lower Fountain Mosque from the nearby fountain, which was fed by Eridanus. Its use as a handicraft museum begins after its first repair in 1915 and since 1975 it houses a remarkable collection of pottery from Greece, Cyprus, Ottoman and modern Turkey. name: Charming Delphi Residence in Kolonaki, Athens
description: Welcome to Delphi, a 1-bedroom apartment in the heart of Skoufa Street, Kolonaki. You'll find yourself surrounded by trendy boutiques, cafes, and art galleries, creating an energetic urban atmosphere. This centrally located gem boasts modern amenities and a stylish interior, providing a comfortable and elegant living space. With easy access to public transportation and major landmarks, this residence offers an unmatched urban living experience in one of Athens' most sought-after neighborhoods.
neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki is a chic and upscale neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. Nestled at the foot of Mount Lycabettus, this elegant district is known for its affluent atmosphere, fashionable boutiques, art galleries, and cosmopolitan vibe. Its picturesque streets and squares exude an air of sophistication, making it a favorite destination for locals and tourists alike.

Local Attractions:
Mount Lycabettus: Rising majestically over Kolonaki, Mount Lycabettus offers panoramic views of Athens. Visitors can hike or take a funicular to the summit, where they'll find a charming chapel and a delightful open-air theater.

Benaki Museum: This renowned museum showcases an extensive collection of Greek art and historical artifacts. Housed in a beautiful neoclassical mansion, it's a cultural treasure trove worth exploring.

neighborhood_overview: Ilisia is a vibrant, residential neighborhood in central Athens, known for its mix of leafy streets, quiet atmosphere, and proximity to major landmarks. It's home to a mix of modern apartments and traditional buildings, offering a more relaxed pace compared to the city's bustling center. The area is popular with students and young professionals due to its closeness to the National Technical University of Athens and several cultural institutions. While not as touristy as some other parts of Athens, Ilisia boasts cozy cafes, local tavernas, and green spaces like the Ilisia Park, making it a charming and convenient spot for both residents and visitors.

neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. It’s in the graffitied backstreets and café-lined squares, the factories converted into galleries, bars hidden in arcades, and secret co

name: A33: Stylish 2-BDR APT W/ Private Patio Near Metro
description: Step into comfort of this brand-new 4th-floor apartment, part of an autonomous building designed with meticulous attention to detail. Enjoy the privacy of a whole floor to yourself, 2 bedrooms, a kitchen, a cozy living room with a sofa & an electric fireplace plus a serene patio. neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the historic heart of Athens, Petralona is a district steeped in tradition and culture, its name echoing tales from a bygone era. Derived from the Greek words 'Petrina Alonia,' which elegantly translates to 'stone threshing floors,' this area once resonated with the rhythmic pulse of grain threshing, long before the touch of urban sophistication graced its soil.

Beyond its storied threshing floors, Petralona wore another moniker with pride - Katsikadika. A tribute to the goat herders who roamed its terrains, they were more than just keepers; they were the heart of community life, generously offering fresh milk to its inhabitants, weaving tales of camaraderie.

Our residence is majestically poised in what many affectionately refer to as 'Petralona' or 'Petralona.' This enclave is not just geographically elevated, but stands a cut above the rest in terms of the sheer richness of experiences it offers. At every corner, tantalizing culinary adventures beckon

### The Neighborhood

Nestled in the heart of Kolonaki, one of Athens' most prestigious and cosmopolitan neighborhoods, this charming apartment is a gateway to an upscale, vibrant lifestyle. Known for its elegance, Kolonaki offers a perfect blend of Parisian-style streets, high-end boutiques, chic cafés, and some of the city's finest restaurants. Enjoy leisurely strolls through tree-lined avenues, indulge in people-watching from stylish coffee shops, and dive into Athens' cultural scene with nearby art galleries and museums just steps away from the property.

Kolonaki boasts excellent access to main attractions like Syntagma Square, the historical Plaka district, and the iconic Acropolis—all within walking distance or a short metro ride away. The property is just a 7-minute walk to the closest metro station, making it seamless to explore the city's historical landmarks or trek to the vibrant Monastiraki market.

neighborhood_overview: Pagrati is a district of the eastern part of the Municipality of Athens, which extends east of Vasilissis Sofias Avenue, a short distance from the historic centre of Athens. The main attraction of the Pangrati area is the Panathinaiko Stadium. The National Gallery, the Goulandris Foundation's Museum of Contemporary Art and the National Research Foundation are located in the wider area of the district, while the Athens Conservatory, the Byzantine Museum, the Officers' Club and the War Museum are a short distance away. Pagrati developed with the centre of the area being Evtychidou Street (where the apartment is located), where its residents and other Athenians used to hang out and Ymittou Street, where mainly residents of the surrounding refugee districts of Vyronas and Kaisariani used to hang out. Pagrati thus became the centre of the south-eastern areas of Athens, which met the needs of the residents of the surrounding areas for shopping, entertainment and services. An important commer

neighborhood_overview:
The Area:

Located in the heart of Athens, the Makrigianni neighborhood is a prime destination for visitors seeking to immerse themselves in the rich history and vibrant culture of Greece's capital. This area is renowned for its close proximity to some of Athens' most iconic landmarks, making it an ideal base for both tourists and business travelers. Just a short stroll away lies the Acropolis, the ancient citadel that houses the Parthenon, Erechtheion, and the Temple of Athena Nike. The nearby Acropolis Museum, a modern architectural marvel, offers an extensive collection of artifacts and provides deep insights into the ancient world.

Makrigianni is also known for its charming streets lined with neoclassical buildings, quaint cafes, and traditional Greek tavernas. The vibrant Plaka district, with its labyrinthine alleys, shops, and restaurants, is just a few minutes' walk away, offering a delightful blend of the old and new. description: An ideal spot to relax and enjoy the city, this apartment will ensure you want to return to the city of Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
Ermou street is one of the most famous shopping streets in Athens, Greece. It is located in the heart of the city, very close to Syntagma Square, Plaka and the Acropolis. The apartment is in a prime location, as it is right in the center of the action. The neighborhood around Ermou street is very lively and bustling, with lots of shops, cafes, restaurants, and other businesses. The area is also a popular tourist destination, so it can be quite busy at times.
The buildings in the area are a mix of modern and historic architecture, with some dating back to the 19th century. The street itself is pedestrianized, which makes it a great place for strolling and window shopping.
Syntagma Square is just a short walk from Ermou street, and it is one of the most important public spaces in Athens. It is surrounded by government buildings, hotels, and restaurants, and is a hub for transportation in the city.

name: No12-4 Theo Homeybee Exarcheia
description:
Hello Homey!

Cute and cosy 4th-floor private room in 5 rooms apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers and loving couples as well.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
Mavili Square is full of life even late after midnight. It has many bars ...the classic canteen for hungry night owls the everest 24h open...higher behind the stadium of Panathinaikos the cosmopolitan Baltazar.
By day outside the cafes in Mavili square has very beautiful cafes and restaurants on the other end of Soutsos to Alexandra (Agora, Pierre cafe, Jonas, dos puertas....) and Attica bakeries
At 150 meters from the apartment on Dimitriou Soutsou street has two supermarkets ...to Alexandras a My Market and to Mavili Square a super Cretan.
At 5 minutes on foot there is a Leroy Merlin store...as well as the Concert Hall where it often has remarkable events.
Nearby is the hill of Lycabettus with the homonymous theater and the fantastic view of the whole of Athens (a must see). The tour of Lycabettus is also ideal for jogging or walks.

name: Modern Apartment with Lycabettus & Acropolis views
description:
This sizeable and stylish three-bedroom apartment welcomes savvy travelers
who wish to stay in the midst of things. With easy access to all landmarks and attractions, it’s also close to the city’s pulse. Facilities include a private balcony with city views, big Smart TVs and a fully equipped plan kitchen – everything you need when you are travelling with family and friends.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a wonderful part of downtown Athens that offers proximity to some of the most important landmarks of the world, as well as great options for dining or meeting with business partners and friends. The area is best explored on foot – everything you need, from bustling cafes and bars to quaint tavernas, modern eateries and chic shopping, is just around the corner. Plus, bus and metro connections are excellent, when you want to venture beyond the limits of the city center – every corner of which, is literally accessible by foot.

Kallimarmaron, the only stadium in the world made entirely from marble is about 1 km away. The striking renovated National Portrait gallery is at 1,1 km. Acropolis and the historical center are also some 25 minutes’ walk away. The posh Kolonaki area with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is about 1,5 Km from your doorstep, and Syntagma square at 2km.

Next to Kallimarmaron, the leafy hill of Arditou, is an oasis of trees with p
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome you to one of our nocarz apartments in Athens, our goal is to ensure that you have a five-star experience in staying with us. 

We are part of a local fun and exciting hospitality group called MyGreekVacations managing more than 100+ beautifully designed custom-made apartments inspired by our travels and our stays in nocarzs around the world. The experience of meeting so many lovely people along the way is something we particularly enjoy, and the city of Athens is a hub where you can always find things to experience, see and do and we can’t get enough of it.

Our priority is to create a comfortable, relaxing and “home away from home” experience for our guests, a “workation” atmosphere for those who wish to combine business with leisure and to always be readily available and provide as much info and assistance as possible; all the things we value when traveling somewhere new ourselves.

Our home is your home! We treat our guests like lifelong friends and we love to spoil them during their visits.

We hope to see you soon.

neighborhood_overview: Psiri-Monastiraki is a vibrant neighborhood in the heart of Athens, Greece. Known for its lively atmosphere, colorful streets, and eclectic mix of traditional and modern architecture, this area is a popular destination for both tourists and locals alike. Psiri-Monastiraki is home to a wide variety of restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops, offering a diverse range of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The neighborhood is also known for its historical landmarks, including the Monastiraki Flea Market and the ancient Agora, as well as its street art and graffiti scene. Overall, Psiri-Monastiraki is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to experience the vibrant culture and energy of Athens.
host_about:

I'm excited to share my love of Athens with guests from all over the world. Whether you're looking for recommendations on the best local restaurants or the must-see sights in the city, I'm always happy to help.

My cozy studio flat is the perfect base for exploring Athens. With a charming view of the Acropolis and an unbeatable central location in the lively neighborhood of Psiri, you'll be just steps away from the best that the city has to offer.

I believe in being a friendly and accommodating host, while also respecting your privacy and space. So if you're looking for a welcoming and comfortable place to stay during your time in Athens, I'd be honored to host you. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions - I'm always happy to chat!"

Architecture is modest- typical Greek residential area, but really very safe (even at night!) and easy connected with centre. Syntagma is 10 min by trolleybus, 20 min by walk, or 5 min by taxi (5-6 euros- if you are asked more, then you have an dishonest driver)
Very easy route to and from AIRPORT (bus X95 to Syntagma and then 5 eur Taxi) and ship port- instructions provided in itinerary.
It is comfortably near the centre, walking distance to the tourist are is 10 min (First Olympic Stadium) the Acropolis is further another 10min - the walk to city from Olympic stadium goes between Zeus temple and Zapio/National Gardens- so it is a fantas

name: Luxury Penthouse in prime central Athens Thissio
description: Breakfast by the acropolis? Markets for midday? This is all a stone throw away in this stunning Thissio apartment. Live comfortably with 2 large bedrooms and 3 beds. Forget fighting for the bathroom, as there are two fully renovated modern bathrooms. Soak in the atmosphere of this historic and prestigious suburb with a cup of coffee or a cheeky drink on the large wrap-around balcony or chill out in the spacious, stylish lounge room. Or simply stay in and enjoy the full kitchen and dining room.
neighborhood_overview:
Thissio is a hugely popular premier suburb frequented by both locals and tourists. Beautifully restored neoclassical homes and many architectural landmarks make Thiseio a cultural, picturesque, distinguished and peaceful neighbourhood. There are numerous small and friendly boutique shops, restaurants, cafés all set in a quiet enclave. As one of the entertainment centers of the city of Athens, Thiseio is rich in history and culture. It has museums, galleries, a synagogue, exhibition centers and open-air theatres from which an amazing view of the lush surroundings can be enjoyed.
Thissio train station is within 5 minutes walk. Monastiraki is also within 5-6 minutes walk. The city of Athens is literally at your feet ready to explore!
host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

neighborhood_overview:
Kypseli used to be the upscale neighborhood of Athens, which had in its premises many art galleries, historic cafés and restaurants, as well as the houses of some of the most prominent families in the city. It was the Upper East Side of Athens ;)

After the 80’s the demographics changed and Kypseli kept its vintage character, its nice people and cute little cafés.

While walking during the daytime you can meet a variety of people, from businessmen to students.

Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka, Monastiraki flea market, as well as Syntagma square and all the upbeat Athens neighborhoods are easily reachable by public transportation.

Upon arrival, we provide you with tailor-made recommendations. Enjoy “Athens by night while being minutes from home ;)

neighborhood_overview:
Despite the large numbers of transients Exarchia attracts, this jumble of pre-war townhouses and ageing post-war apartment buildings preserves a strong sense of community and tradition, with publishing houses, bookbinders, the city’s liveliest farmers’ market, rembetiko tavernas, punk boutiques, old-fashioned coffee houses, bars, a self-managed park, the "National Archaeological Museum" and delightful "Epigraphic Museum", all within its boundaries.
Built into the slopes of Lycabettus Hill, Neapoli, the city’s second oldest neighbourhood after Plaka, acts as a buffer zone between Kolonaki, disdained by Exarchia’s denizens as the bastion of the bourgeoisie.

neighborhood_overview: The historic center of Athens, including Plaka, Monastiraki, Thissio and Syntagma, is one of the most picturesque and popular areas of the city. Here you can find the Acropolis of Athens. Along the famous Dionysiou Areopagitou Street, you can find the Acropolis Museum and the Conservatory of Herodes Atticus. In addition, there are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars, which are all ideal for spending the weekend amongst local Athenians. The area is served by all three lines of the urban rail network.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: Welcome to our modern fully renovated Cronus Apartment in Olympus residence in Pagrati. This apartment has 3 bedrooms, a beautiful living room, Smart TVs (Netflix) to every room, reliable Wi-Fi and a fully equipped kitchen with a dining table! Free gym and laundry room for common use.
neighborhood_overview:
Kallimarmaron, the only stadium in the world made entirely from marble is just 500 meters away. Acropolis and the historical center are also some minutes’ walk away. Plaka and the Acropolis Museum are at 1,8 Km away and the posh Kolonaki area with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is just 1 Km from your doorstep, and so is Syndagma square.

Next to Kallimarmaron, the leafy hill of Arditou, is an oasis of trees with plenty of beautiful paths for hiking and running. The National Garden of Athens, a great place to walk, run or just enjoy your coffee or drink amid luscious trees and flowers, Is at your fingertips too. Zappeio, a Neoclassical architectural gem is just 400m away - make sure to check out if there are any events running while you are in Athens!

Supermarkets and pharmacists are a few meters away. Sports amenities, including an Olympic size swimming pool and tennis courts are just around the corner as well, making this an amazing neighborhood to live
host_about:
Welcome to MyGreekVacations! We're thrilled to have you join us in one of our unique, beautifully-designed apartments here in Athens. As passionate travelers ourselves, we know that the perfect nocarz rental is more than just a place to stay – it's an experience that you'll remember for a lifetime. 
Whether you're here for business or leisure, we're always available to provide assistance to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

name: Cozy ,stylish central apartment
description: Apartment 72sq.m  on the 5th floor of a new building just twenty minutes walk from the historical center of Athens, in a safe area, Plato's Academy .It’s between two metro stations (blue and red line). There is a bedroom with a double bed, a living room with comfortable sofas, a 40-inch TV, free WiFi, (internet speed up to 50 Mbps) a fully equipped kitchen, a bathroom with always hot water , washing machine, and a large balcony full of grown plants where you can relax,eat even work !
neighborhood_overview:
What i like the most in my neighborhood is the silence during the night time.
It’s a lovely family area and you can have all the shops you need like super markets,bakery,barbershop all in 5 minutes.There is also a big park very close where academy of Plato was built and there still some ancient rocks from that monument . Also at the same street where the apartment is ,there is a local tavern with nice food and at the weekends you can hear greek live music (without microphones) which is really nice and there is also a traditional cafe just across the building .The neighborhood is absolutely safe !

name: Relaxing Studio in Exarchia with Gym & Laundry
description:
Welcome to My Greek Vacations City Apartments!
Perfect for work or play trips, this elegant 1-bedroom apartment is nestled in the posh Kolonaki area. It's conveniently situated near the famous Lycabettus Hill and the lively Neapolis neighborhood. The spacious apartment includes modern amenities like a fully equipped kitchen, Wi-Fi, Tv, and air conditioning. This stylish retreat offers the ideal blend of comfort and convenience for your stay in Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a wonderful part of downtown Athens that offers proximity to some of the most important landmarks of the world, as well as great options for dining or meeting with business partners and friends. Everything you need, from supermarkets, bakeries and grocery stores to bustling cafes and bars, modern eateries, fancy restaurants and chic shopping, is within fast and easy walking distance. Plus, bus and metro connections are excellent, if you want to venture beyond the city center – every corner of which, is accessible by foot, when you feel like taking a leisurely stroll.

Highlights:
Kolonaki Square – the beating heart of Athens’ most prestigious neighbourhood – is less than 10 minutes walk away and so are the area’s high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical centre are some 30 mins on foot while Syntagma Square is about 1 km. Lycabettus Hill, a verdant oasis in the middle of the cit

name: The blue house - Stylish & cozy studio_6
description:
Discover unparalleled comfort in our fully renovated studio in Ano Petralona, Athens. Every detail of this chic space reflects modern elegance. Nestled in a historic district, it offers a tranquil escape with easy access to the charm of local markets and the vibrant Athenian atmosphere. Your stay in this stylish studio promises an authentic experience in the heart of Athens.
Guests can also enjoy our amazing rooftop with sitting areas and outdoor shower.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to your home away from home in the enchanting neighborhood of Ano Petralona, Athens! Our short-term rental beckons you to a cozy haven where modern comfort meets timeless charm. Nestled in the heart of this historic district, the location offers a quintessential Athenian experience.

Perched amidst the cobbled streets of Ano Petralona, our rental is a stone's throw away from the vibrant pulse of the Petralona Market. Immerse yourself in the local rhythm as you explore this bustling market, filled with the colors and flavors of authentic Greek life. From fresh produce to artisanal crafts, every corner tells a story of tradition and community.

The neighborhood itself is a tapestry of history and contemporary flair. Take leisurely strolls through its winding streets, discovering hidden gems, quaint cafes, and welcoming tavernas serving up the best of Greek cuisine. name: Stylish apartment near Katechaki
description:
The apartment is located near the Katechaki Metro station. It is less than 4 minutes on foot.
Syntagma square is 4 kilometers away and you can be there in less than 15 minutes while Akropolis is 4,5 kilometers away and it will take you a couple more minutes to get there.
neighborhood_overview:
The location of the house provides a variety of places to get to. Right next to the house are a couple of cafes in which you can relax and spend your afternoon. You can also find some greek traditional restaurants and try the amazing souvlaki our country is well known for. The neighborhood has plenty of parks to go for a walk. Also, in a 2 minutes walk from the house you can find a summer cinema.
If you want to have a drink or go dancing, Panormou street will provide you with plenty of choices and it is just 12 minutes away.
host_about:
My name is Aris and I am currently studying Economics in Athens. I have spent all my life here and I enjoy every little detail of this city. 
A few months ago, I decided to renovate a house with the help of my father and join the nocarz community.
I am always happy to meet with my guests and provide them with all the information they need as well as some “local” tips about what’s going on in the city.

description: Standard Plus  Apartments: Elevate your stay at Trikoupi 95 with our Standard Plus Apartments, ranging from 30.00m² to 35.00m² in size. host_about:
Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The Diplomat’s ABR  Trikoupi 95
Situated in the historic street of Charilaou Trikoupi 95,

The spaces apart from the 21 comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy  spectacular views over the city of Athens, and one of the most prized landmarks –  the Lycabettus hill from morning till night

The Diplomat’s  ABR Trikoupi 95 has been fully transformed into a place that welcomes business travellers, couples, families and friends, who seek an urban sanctuary in the heart of modern Athens

description: Escape to charming Thissio in Athens and experience contemporary living in our stylish nocarz apartment. With modern architecture, unique artwork, and a fully equipped kitchen, indulge in comfort. The spacious bathroom and balcony with stunning views provide the perfect retreat. Explore Athens' rich history and culture with the Acropolis and other sites within walking distance. Book your stay today for luxury living and a memorable experience in the heart of Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the charming and sophisticated neighborhood of Thissio, our apartment is perfectly situated near the peaceful and scenic pedestrian street of Dionysiou Areopagitou. This delightful street leads straight to the iconic Acropolis, just a short distance away.

Thissio is an ideal neighborhood for families, with many supermarkets and pharmacies conveniently located nearby. Immerse yourself in the historic charm of the area, surrounded by some of the best sites and attractions Athens has to offer.

Experience the ancient Roman Agora or the modern central shopping district, or simply soak up the local ambiance. At night, the neighborhood comes alive with some of the best restaurants just a short walk away. Enjoy authentic Greek cuisine, followed by a night out in Athens' vibrant and never-ending nightlife.

Thissio is a magical blend of old and new, with charming streets leading to delightful surprises and colorful corners. Discover artisanal shops, vi
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

This cozy 20 m2 studio is on the 3rd floor of a purpose designed apartment building with small flats. It is located on Mavromichali Street, near Alexandras avenue in the Neapolis district of downtown Athens.
A typical Athenian residential neighborhood, where everything can be found within a few minutes' range from the property: Super market is at 2 min walk, on the same street, as well as 2 small traditional Greek tavernas.

At 5 min walking distance, οn Kallidromiou street, guests can visit the weekly Saturday street food market (laiki), one of the best in Athens, selling fresh fruit & vegetables, as well as a variety of local food products, sold directly from the producers and farmers.

In the summer, there are 2 open-air cinemas in the neighborhood at 2-3 min walking distance.

neighborhood_overview: Syntagma Square has literally been the very heart of Athens ever since the city became the capital of the modern Greek state, and it’s the perfect central location for sightseeing. It is the place where most major events of the last two centuries have taken place. Right next to the parliament building and Syntagma Square lies Greece’s National Garden which, together with the Zappeion Hall Garden, includes 24 hectares full of rare kinds of flowers and other plants, as well as trees. Birds of all kinds are frequent visitors to this stunning oasis of green in the middle of Athens, making it perfect for sightseeing and birdwatching. Less than one kilometer away from Syntagma Square is the bustling Monastiraki area. This is a flea market area in the old town of Athens, full of tourist shops selling souvenirs and Greek delicacies. neighborhood_overview:
Victoria Neighbourhood is one of the oldest in downtown Athens. It got its name from the homonym Square, in the heart of the neighborhood. The Square was named after Queen Victoria, in her honor, the year 1864. Victoria Square and the surrounding area is full of coffee shops, restaurants, and places serving fast food, which are usually full of students from nearby Universities and Private Schools.

From Victoria Metro Station you can take line 1 which connects the area with all of Athens, Piraeus (Direct connection to the Port) and the Airport (Line 3). There is one stop away from Metro line 2 (Acropolis) and two stops away from Metro line 3 (Monastiraki - Airport).

Within 5-10 minutes walk (depending on walking) are the National Archaeological Museum, Larissa Railway Station (Intercity and Suburban Network, Metro Station Larissa Station - metro line 2), and the KTEL of the Prefecture of Attica. The neighborhood is an area for your stay in Athens. Access to it is e

As a passionate traveler, but also as a Greek woman I have adopted the element of hospitality from an early age. I enjoy meeting pleasant people from all around the world. I like to help and serve them, making their accommodation more comfortable for as long as they stay in my country.

name: What A View! Acropolis Penthouse Private Terrace
description:
Just 10 minutes walk from the Acropolis entrance this apartment is ideal for those who seek Tranquility, Style, Comfort with an Amazing View in the heart of lively Athens.

An exclusive apartment with a big private terrace on the top floor of an upscale contemporary residential building surrounded by nature and antiquities.

Preserved at the back yard of the building is a part of the Long Walls dated from mid 5th century BC (check Walk the Wall app for more info).
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at the Makrygianni - Gargaretta one of the top neighborhoods to live in the city. It's an elegant upscale downtown quarter, where old Athens meets modern Athens. Just a short walk to all major archaeological sites, museums and all public transport and just minutes away from the coast and the Athenian Riviera.

The apartment is at
* 30/40 minutes from the airport by taxi/car or around 75/90 minutes by metro/bus.
(exact info on how to arrive from the airport is available after booking is confirmed)
* 20 minutes from the port of Piraeus by taxi.
* 10 minutes from the Acropolis entrance and Plaka.
* 7 minutes walk from Acropolis metro station, the New Acropolis Museum and the Odeon of Herodes Atticus.
* At 5 minutes walking distance a network of pedestrian streets( Dionysiou Areopagitou Apostolou Pavlou, Ermou, Adrianou, etc) leads you to visit Thission, the Ancient Agora, the Keramikos Cemetery, Gazi, and more.
*The
host_about:
Born and raised in downtown Athens I studied architecture and cultural management.

host_about:
Born and raised in Athens; two different generations, mother and daughter, sharing the same admire for our beautiful city and the same passion for travelling and dancing.

Anny  is a Marketing and Communication graduate and a Tourism Management postgraduate that has been working for the past five years in a travel agency in the centre of Athens.  

Emilia is a lifetime entrepreneur from her early years dedicated to different fields of expertise.

We are dedicated to provide our guests with the essence of the Authentic Greek Hospitality. We are looking forward to welcome you in our amazing historical city, a city of ancient history, breathtaking views, scenic alleys, picturesque neighborhoods, romantic sunsets, Mediterranean beaches, traditional food, art, nightlife, sunny days and warm hearts.

One of my dreams is to travel throughout the world, meet different cultures and keep filling my album of life with unique pictures of different places. However, while people are the ones that give life to the beauty of a country, I am really pleased to become a part of your Greek experience and assist you to fill your own album of life with pictures of my fascinating city. It would be an honor to assist you in anything you may need during your stay in Athens and provide you with every information you may require.

We are really happy to welcome you to our city, to make you feel like home and to share with you our passion for exploration and travelling and our love for the historical, vibrant, sunny and diverse city of Athens.

name: Beautiful loft in 20' walk from Acropolis
description:
Fully renovated luminous loft is just in 20 minutes’ walk from Acropolis & Acropolis Museum.
Located on the 7th floor, it has a spacious furnished terrace with the panoramic views to Philopappou Hill and Hymettos mountains.
The loft offers everything you need to enjoy a short-term or a long-term stays in Athens: fully equipped kitchen, big dining table which can be used also as a working deck, comfortable soft chairs, dishwasher, cloth washer & dryer, queen size bed with anatomic mattress
neighborhood_overview:
Considered as one of the safest and the coolest neighborhoods in Athens, Koukaki is a place that has it all.
From vibrant coffee places and bars to minimal restaurants and taverns, it offers a variety of choices.
Its stylish shops, the proximity to the Acropolis Museum and the local archeological sites, as well as the laid back vibe make it one of the best non-touristy neighborhoods in Athens.

When you find yourself strolling around its neighborhoods, you will discover both neoclassical and modern houses, as well as shops with strong local color.

A walk on Philopappou Hill is also highly recommended to see ancient monuments and find viewpoints that will allow you to enjoy the urban landscape from a distance.

The closest beach is Mpati beach, just in 7,7 km from the apartment. Kalamaki beach is in 9,7 km.

neighborhood_overview: Koukaki, a neighborhood in Athens, Greece, boasts a prime location near the iconic Acropolis, blending ancient history with modern charm. Its cobbled streets, traditional Greek houses adorned with bougainvillea, and the Acropolis Museum's modern architecture create a picturesque backdrop. The neighborhood's culinary scene features authentic Greek cuisine, while its nightlife offers bars, cafes, and live music. Koukaki's community spirit is exemplified by its friendly locals and cultural events. Exploring the neighborhood, visitors can also discover Philopappos Hill, a historical site with panoramic views. Koukaki is a captivating destination, seamlessly fusing the past and present, inviting travelers to experience Greece's heart and soul.

description:
Enjoy Athens at its best. 2+2 bed cozy apartment right in the heart of the city's hottest place.Just around the corner of Ermou, the main pedestrian street of Athens. name: Athenian house of 1920
description:
Neoclassical classy apartment 145 m2, in the center of Athens:High carved ceilings, two bedrooms with double beds, wifi,kitchen, emergency supplies,desk for laptop,air
conditioning,hangers,TV,washing machine,high-fidelity sound system, 24-hour hot water,autonomous central heating,fireplace,iron,hair dryer, shampoo.
Only 5 mins walk from Victoria metro station,6 mins walk from Attiki metro station, 2 mins walk to bus/trolley stations,10 mins walk from the National Archeological Museum.
neighborhood_overview:
The area is a typical downtown Athens neighborhood with strong multicultural elements. Living here you have a better sense of how Athenians live.In the same time It is a fairly quiet neighborhood and the street, where the house is located, is also small and hardly noisy.
All points for essentials, all kinds of shops, supermarkets, groceries,bakeries,pharmacies, and banks are not more than a hundred meters away.Also,there are two open markets operating (one every Wednesday and the other every Saturday).
You can find there fresh fruit, fish and vegetables.
The house is very close to Victoria Square and St. Panteleimon Square. Furthermore, it is about 5-6 minute walk away from the largest public park in Athens, “Pedion tou Areos”.
host_about: I was born and live in Athens. I like to travel and this has formed a significant part of my personality Living in the city center, I know well almost everything about the city-including many small secrets. I feel happy when I can help people from other countries understand better the feeling and the style of the city and Greece. Except Greek, I speak English, also my partners speaks English, French, Russian, Greek, Bulgarian. Me and our management team called 'Beemyguest" we are trying always the best for our guests. To be their stay in Greece unforgettable.

neighborhood_overview: A formerly low-profile neighborhood at the foot of the Acropolis, home to several service stations and body shops in the past, Koukaki has evolved over the last year in the hottest fun spot in the city, as new hangouts with an alternative character open one after the other. The tour begins from the “Bell Ray” (88, Falirou Str.), which is housed in an old service station that turned into an all-day industrial space, with large windows, tasty snacks, and lovely cocktails, where you’ll find it hard to get a table. The wine bar “Boheme Bourgeois” (36, Anastasiou Zinni Str.) prefers wines from the Greek vineyard, which come with cheeses and cold cuts. Right next door to it (34, A. Zinni Str.), you’ll find the “I Fabrika tou Efrosinou”, namely the factory of Efrosinos – the patron saint of cooks – with plenty of meze dishes and stews. At the “Monsieur Barbu” (59, Falirou Str.) and the “Hops” (10, Drakou Str.) nice, juicy burgers take centre stage, while the “Lotte” (2, Tsami Karatasou Str.)
host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

name: Athens historical center OFFER
description:
In one of the most beautiful neighborhoods of Athens and next to the historic center it is a fully renovated apartment.
The block of flats is an example of architecture in the first Olympic Games. Famous Greek actors have stayed in this building.
We tried to keep the style of the last century so that guests can experience the Athenian atmosphere of that era.
Staying in this apartment will be for you a wonderful journey in time but also the history of Greece.
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance from the historical centre of Athens. Five minutes from the Acropolis museum and Parthenon. Next door to The Panathenaic Stadium, a classical cultural and touristic monument of Greece and one of the most significant monuments not only for Athens, but for the whole Greece.

It is one of our city’s most popular touristic attractions and one of Athens’ landmarks.


Its rich history is directly connected to the Modern Olympic Games as from their revival in 1896 until the Athens Olympic Games in 2004. It is also the place from where the Olympic flame sets up its journey to the cities of the Olympic Games, both Winter, Summer and Youth.

5 minutes from Greek Parliament and National Garden

Near to super markets and a perfect square with coffee shops and traditional Greek taverns.
host_about: Love traveling. Love to meet new people!!!

Psyri, a hip neighborhood, used to have in its premises the majority of the leather traders and craftsmen till the mid 80s’. Now, it has repositioned itself into a vibrant area full of stylish bars, traditional cafes and restaurants.

host_about:
Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The spaces apart from the comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy the view of the city of Athens and the green park of Strefi.

Furthermore, in order to make your stay even better, we have prepared a welcome book, that you will find in your apartment, which includes useful information for the building and the city, interesting places that you may visit and are on a walking distance from our area, as well as other matters that could make your visit in Athens more comfortable. . 

Should you require any additional help or information during your stay with us, please do not hesitate to contact our Lobby Manager, at the lobby of our premises or the support telephone line of Athens Boutique Residence.  For emergency matters you may contact the building supervisor, who is located at the ground floor next to the main entrance.  

May I take this opportunity to thank you for having chosen the Athens Boutique Residence and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,


Your Athens Boutique Residence Team

name: Standard Double by 33 Solonos
description: Our room can comfortably accommodate 2 guests and offers city views. It features a queen-size bed. The linens in this suite are dressed in comforting and distinct icy grey hues. In the bathroom, aside from the double glass door shower, guests will find a range of branded products, a hairdryer, and a flat iron. There’s also a minibar and a flat-screen TV. The room features a fully equipped kitchenette, an Espresso bar, and a safety deposit box. All bedrooms come with free Wi-Fi.
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication.

neighborhood_overview:
Monastiraki, a lively and eclectic neighborhood in the heart of Athens, is a captivating blend of history, culture, and vibrant energy. Named after the Monastiraki Square, which translates to "Little Monastery," this area is a mosaic of ancient ruins, traditional markets, and modern cafes.

At the heart of Monastiraki is the bustling square, a dynamic meeting point where locals and visitors converge. Surrounded by a mix of neoclassical buildings and traditional Greek architecture, the square is a gateway to the historic Plaka district and the iconic Acropolis.

The Monastiraki Flea Market, a kaleidoscope of colors and aromas, is a major draw. Here, you can wander through narrow cobblestone streets lined with antique shops, boutiques, and stalls selling everything from handmade crafts to vintage treasures. It's a haven for those seeking unique souvenirs and a taste of Athens' artisanal offerings.

name: Afrodite's Mansion in Plaka by JJ Hospitality
description: A delightful 4-storey townhouse in the heart of Plaka. This property sleeps up to 12 people in comfort and boasts a large roof terrace with Acropolis view for unforgettable evenings. On one of the quietest streets in Plaka, it is still close to the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum, all the main ancient sites, and central Syntagma Square. A jewel of a property, not to be missed if you value location and heritage for your vacation rental.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the centre of Plaka in a super quiet pedestrian side-street, yet just feet away from some of the most famous sites in Plaka. For example the Acropolis museum is about 3 minutes walk away, and the entrance to the site itself is about 12 minutes walk. Aso nearby are the Temple of Zeus, Ancient Agora and Tower of the Winds. There are some lovely nearby restaurants (Daphne's is a classic choice) and bars (don't miss the famous Vrettos bar!). You can easily explore the nearby neighborhoods around Syntagma, Monastiraki, Kolonaki and Makrigianni - the house is in the between them all! \
host_about:
Hello there! We are JJ Hospitality, a vacation rental company started by a couple of guys who are passionate about travelling in this beautiful country. All the properties you see here have been hand selected by us, and we have even spent the night as guests ourselves to ensure they meet our standards. We do our best to ensure you have a delightful, exciting and trouble free vacation when visiting Greece.
A few words about us: John C is an architect turned hotelier, and Ioannis (Greek name for John) is a finance guru who also has prior experience in the high-end tourism sector. Together we make JJ Hospitality, purveyors of exclusive holiday rentals! Check us out on jjhospitality.net for more info.
Happy travels:)

neighborhood_overview:
PURE ATHENS!
My place is at one of the best neighborhoods of the historic center. Feel very welcome at Psyri, the greatest neighborhood of the historic center. Forget about public transportation! Walking around and then return to rest within 5', then outside again!
The Psyri neighborhood is next to Monastiraki, Thisio and Gazi nbrhds.
The apartment is centrally located on the main pedestrian road in a very nice and SAFE area.
There is great nightlife with a lot of nice small bars and good vibrant. There are a lot of fair-price restaurants and a great local bakery around the corner. The area is of the liveliest ones in Athens. In my opinion in the greatest neighborhood in Athens.
If you are a tango lover, ask me where to find the best Milonga and Practica in Athens (3' minutes on foot). You are definitely on the tango side of Athens!
Come to feel todays Athens!

description:
This is a special, luxurious, spacious one-bedroom apartment, at the foothills of famous Lycabettus Hill. Just 10 min.walk from the cosmopolitan Kolonaki area, yet at a quiet & safe neighborhood. Lycabettus is considered one of the most elite areas in Athens, and Prime Minister's residence is just a few meters away.

Public transportation, bus & metro, is accessible in a few min. walk, making it easy to plan your visit.

name: “Art Base” Comfort & Relaxation in Athens
description:
A cute and cozy luxury apartment in Central Athens, (Fully Renovated in 2017). A very comfortable apartment 50 m2, in the Market of ''Sepolia'' area of Athens.
The house is very close to Metro station of Attiki, just 500 meter away, where pass lines 1 (Kifissia - Piraeus: Green line) and 2 (Anthoupoli - Elliniko: Red line). Using Line 1, you arrive in Monastiraki and Thissio (Plaka area) within 4 minutes, and using Line 2, you will reach Syntagma Square or the Acropolis Station in 5 minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
Sepolia is a safe and quiet neighbourhood just a few minutes away from the downtown. The apartment is in the heart of the Market of Sepolia area . The two main streets where crossing the apartment’s road are: “Dyraxiou street” and “Avlonos street”

Just 50 meters from the apartment you will meet a big Super market, mini markets, pharmacies, banks-ATMs, coffee shops, bakeries, butcher shops, fast food restaurants, restaurants with traditional Greek food, souvlaki restaurants, candy stores, etc...
The main Market’s road of Sepolia, named “Dyraxiou street” and this road ends in the main church of Sepolia, the “Saint Meletios” Church.

The super Market is just 50 meters away from the apartment. This is in the road “Avlonos 16”, where is crossing with the apartment.
(look around for the A.B. Vasilopoulos Super Market)

name: Central & Comfortable, 2BR apt
description: Our apartment is cozy and modern. It’s located close to Acropolis and Syntagma Square and only 3 min walk time from Metro (Neos Kosmos), which is only two stops away from Acropolis station. You can use the Tram, which is right next to the Metro, to explore the coastal neighborhoods of Athens. It is ideal for families, couples, or friends who prefer a quiet, relaxing apartment with everything you might need for a pleasant stay. The flat can comfortably accommodate up to 6 guests
neighborhood_overview:
Neos Kosmos is a quiet, safe, and authentic Athenian neighborhood mostly consisting of residences and local shops. The area near the neighborhood becomes especially vibrant every Saturday morning with an open-air market nearby. You can find that day many market stalls with fresh vegetables, fruits, and fish from around Greece and shop like a local. A supermarket is only 50m away from the apartment. The area also offers a variety of shops and services that are necessary for your daily needs. (pharmacies, banks, bakeries, etc.)

More information:
A neighborhood guide is provided upon your arrival.

name: Artemis by Heloni Apartments
description: Apartment Artemis is the apartment you have all dreamed about. In between the new Grand Hyatt and Athenaeum Palace on Syggrou Avenue, Apartment Artemis connects the   culture city center with the magnificent Athenian coastline. With your own personal roof garden and a marvelous view of the Acropolis, you will have a hard time leaving this apartment! The three bedrooms, two bathrooms, and spacious open plan living area provide the perfect setting for overlooking Athens and the Acropolis.
neighborhood_overview: Neos Kosmos is one of the most central areas of the city. The location is close enough to the main tourist attractions without being in the busy center all the time. Neos Kosmos  area is both lively and quiet, leaving plenty of options. The center of the area is a 10-minute walk away and the accommodation is easily accessible by bus, metro and tram. There is a wide variety of cafes and restaurants. At the same time, just a 15-20 minute walk away, you will find yourself in the Koukaki area, where there are plenty of options for all tastes.
host_about:
Heloni is an ancient Greek word that translates into tortoise. This philosophy focuses on the sense of security and comfort that the turtle feels within its shell. 
Through the idea of the "Virtual hotel," we provide apartments that, although distant from a traditional reception, manage to ensure a comfortable stay. This approach allows guests to enjoy their desired privacy, creating an environment that enhances their travel experience.

name: The Athens Museum Penthouse 120sqm Lycabettus View
description: At “Athens Museum Penthouse'' you will feel like home. This is a 120 m² downtown freshly renovated lux penthouse with a patio 40m² and with unique view to some of the most historical buildings of Athens, The National Archaeological Museum (1889) & Villa Ypatia (1908). The site is situated 400m from Victoria metro and 2 min walk to the Museum. All rooms are air-conditioned. You will need about 10 min to Acropolis. New!! see our disinfection measures for Covid 19 at the Space Sector.
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby Attractions:
Appealing to outdoor and cultural interests alike, the Athens city-center provides sightseeing for everyone. Among the largest in Greece, the adjacent Park (pedion Areos) includes a network of walking and jogging paths. Take in the park's calm, green surroundings, and then explore the city's many renowned historic treasures. Walk easily to the National Archaeological Museum, Villa Ypatia and Hellenic Motor Museum, and take a brief metro ride to Syntagma Square and the famed Acropolis.

1)National Archaeological Museum is a must-see. A few words for The National Archaeological Museum: The building of the National Archaeological Museum, which is a preserved monument on its own, was founded in 1866 and was based on plans by the architects Ludwig Lange and Panagiotis Kalsos. The final shaping of the façade was supervised by Ernest Ziller, who was responsible until 1889, when the western wing was completed. Ernst Moritz Theodor Ziller ( 22 June 1837, Serko
host_about:
Hello,
I am Stella " happy traveler" for the last forty years. We decided to do something that we love very much, through nocarz.
The Greek word "ΦΙΛΟΞΕΝΙΑ=hospitality" is of particular importance in the Greek culture. It’s a compound word from "ΦΙΛΩ=LOVE" and "ΞΕΝΟΣ=GUEST " and refers to the act of nesting and caring for a guest by the host. It was an institution for the ancient Greeks to welcome and take care of the guests at their home. They believed particularly in the idea of hospitality and regarded it as a moral duty and a sacred rule of the gods (Xenios Zeus was the protector of the guests). They offered them bath and sleep and they greeted them with gifts. The host and the guest were linked with friendly ties, which where inherited to their descendants.
This is our inheritance! 
We will be more than glad to host you in our home.

name: The Heart of Plaka
description: Aesthetic and cozy apartment located in the heart of the famous neighbourhood of Plaka, under the Hill of Acropolis. The apartment lies in a triangle's centre of the most populat spots in Athens. 1. Acropolis Metro Station is 200 meters and the well-known pedestrian street named Dionisiou Aeropagitou. 2. Syntagma Square is also really close (approx. 800 meters). 3. Monastiraki Square is only 15 minutes away. Let us note that the apartment was restored recently (June 2018).
neighborhood_overview:
The location is ideal due to the tranquility of the street combined with the vibrance of the historical and commercial centre of Athens. It is sure that you will feel secure. You will have almost everything you need to see in a very short distance. Syntagma Square, Monastiraki Square and Acropolis, three of the main popular spots in the city are in walking distance.

neighborhood_overview: Ilisia is an area at the central part of Athens, with easy access to the metro station ‘’Megaro Moussikis’’ within 6 minutes walking distance. The Syntagma metro and the famous Syntagma square is only 2,4km away and you can go there by metro in 2 stops, by bus, or even walk. For the art lovers, you will have the opportunity to visit the National Art Gallery which is located just a few steps from the house. For the nature lovers, the well-kept, green and sunny Ilision Park is located less than 300m. away and a walk there will be very relaxing for you. The well-known Michalakopoulou street in front of the apartment, in general has many different nightlife spots to offer as well as a variety of shops, supermarkets and pharmacies for your everyday needs. The Lycabettus Hill is quite close and is one of the tallest and prettiest spots to admire the Acropolis Hill and Athens’ panoramic view. You can walk there or use the funicular. neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in Psirri, minutes walk away from Monastiraki and Plaka. Monastiraki station serves the Athens International airport and the port of Piraeus.
Plaka is the heart of Athens historical city centre, where most main monuments are located. Psirri is a place where you still find lovely artisan shops such as candle making and leather work shops. It has great restaurants, cafes, art spaces and an outdoor cinema where you can enjoy films in the original language. Y
ou will also find grocery stores, bakeries and the Athens Central Food Market, the famous Varvakios Agora Walking around Psirri can be deceiving as it has many old buildings and lots of street art.
The street art scene has produced many outstanding artists and their work is widely photographed and admired. The artisan shops, the residents who greet each other by their first names and the visitors create a place of unique character.
host_about:
We at Boutique Athens offer accommodation to travellers who are interested in the cultural and artistic pursuits on offer in our amazing city, Athens.
We own and manage several fully serviced, high quality apartments in the centre of the city.
We are interested in food, art, modern history and what is new and exciting.
We personally meet and greet our guests.
We provide full kitchens for cooking, a wonderful art collection and many books on Modern Greece.

neighborhood_overview:
Athens Color Cube Luxury Apartments are located in the heart of Athens’ Historic Centre, at Aiolou street. 250m from Monastiraki Metro Station. Aiolou Street is the epicentre of the Commercial Triangle of Athens, one of the most historic neighbourhoods. Important buildings and monuments of Athens’ architectural and cultural heritage are to be found here, along with long-standing local commercial businesses and the City’s bustling night life activity. Every street and corner of this neighbourhood is part of this city’s lively history. Based on the Color Cube Apartments you can walk to Acropolis/ Partheonon and Plaka, visit the Monastiraki flea market or the Syntagma square and the National Gardens.
150m away from the Color Cube Apartments, Aiolou street reaches the major Athenian archaeological area, at the foothills of Acropolis, where landmarks classical Greece’s antiquities can be found, such as the ancient Agora & Library, wind tower and ancient galleries where famous Greek phi

'Athens Color Cube' is a project which proves that architecture can thrive, while providing a pleasant, modern and luxurious hospitality gateway in the very center of Athens:

	We like clean lines, spotless surfaces and emphasis on modern minimalism which promotes a comfortable stay 
	We love convenience, technology and smart home
	We enjoy being the city epicenter, linking our ancient vicinity, to our modern apartments
	We appreciate the communication with our guests. 

We are proud to present the six modern and sophisticated apartments of 'Athens Color Cube' project, located in the most convenient pedestrian street at the heart of historic Athens.

name: Unforgettable holidays two steps from Acropolis 6
description: 40m² apartment on the 4th floor in the Psyri area featuring one double bedroom, a double sofa bed in the living room (extra sheets included in the wardrobe), a fully equipped bathroom, a full kitchen with electric hobs, and a lovely balcony. neighborhood_overview: Psyri is a gentrified Athens neighbourhood, today known for its restaurants, bars, live music tavernas, and small number of hotels. It's central square is called "Heroes square" (plateia Iroon), because the streets leading to it carry names of heroes of the Greek War of Independence (e.g. Karaiskakis, Miaoulis). In the era of the 'old Athens' (namely, during the last quarter of the 19th century), the nickname "plateia of Heroes" was a derisive reference to 'koutsavakides' (working class men), who would use it as a hangout.

neighborhood_overview: Petralona is a charming neighborhood in Athens, known for its blend of traditional character and contemporary vibes. Nestled between the city center and the Piraeus port, this area offers a delightful mix of authentic tavernas, cozy cafes, and trendy bars. Its picturesque streets showcase a unique combination of neoclassical and modern architecture, while street art adds a touch of urban flair. Petralona is well-connected with public transportation, making it easy to explore Athens' top attractions, yet it maintains a peaceful, local atmosphere, perfect for a relaxed stay.

Enjoy the intense experience to leave in one of the most interesting, artistic and bohemian neighbourhoods of the world. Let us introduce you to the true greek culture, music and food, have a taste of the famous greek hospitality.
neighborhood_overview: Exarcheia is one of the most exciting and historic neighbourhoods u can possibly visit. Multicultural yet traditional, the area is a landmark of  modern Athens. Full of night life and people of all ages, the area is home for more than 100 bars, bistros and restaraunts.

name: Absolute Athens VI
description:
Absolute Athens VI is a property located in Athens near Acropolis Museum. Situated less than 1 km from Odeum of Herodes Atticus, the property provides a terrace.

The apartment includes 1 bedroom and a kitchen with a dishwasher and an oven. The property also has 1 bathroom with a shower.

Filopappos Hill is a 16-minute walk from the apartment, while Temple of Olympion Zeus is 1.5 km from the property. Elefthérios Venizélos Airport is 34 km away.
neighborhood_overview: Absolute Athens VI is a property located in the center of Athens ,in an old neighborhood, near the Acropolis Museum. The accommodation is less than 1km away. from the Conservatory of Herod of Atticus, the Archaeological site of the Acropolis and near the Museum of Modern Art. At a distance of 120 meters there is a metro stop, Sygrou - Fix - Drakou Street exit. In the surrounding area there are restaurants, cafes and a super market.

name: 5* Penthouse Acropolis View Loft downtown Athens
description:
A great, 80m2, fully renovated Penthouse Loft full of sun light during the day and magnificent night views!
On the 5th (top) floor with view from Lycabettus hill to Acropolis, Kerameikos cemetery, Philopappos ancient hill and National Observatory of Athens!

Forbes has named Kerameikos in Athens City, one of the coolest and most beautiful neighbourhoods in the World.

5 min from Gazi square!
neighborhood_overview:
Gazi and Kerameikos are the hippest areas in the center of Athens!

Forbes has named Kerameikos in Athens City, one of the coolest and most beautiful neighbourhoods in the World!!

This hub is filled with an array of exciting restaurants, tavernas, and street food joints, not to mention it’s now one of the trendiest places in Athens to grab a drink. The neighborhood’s profile is being noticed worldwide amongst foodies, coffee connoisseurs, and cocktail lovers as you are bound to find some of the best souvlaki, espresso, and martini here!

Only just a 10-min walk from Athens’ buzzing historic centre!

Bars, restaurants, art spaces, street art, theatres and concert venues can be found a few blocks away to suit any taste and preference. It is quite diverse area!
host_about: We are a couple based in Athens, Greece, living& working between Athens & Santorini. We like calm, green, our dogs & our Maya! Teo, an engineer who used to work in the music& Anna, an economist in fashion.
