name: Cozy & Elegant Flat w/ Balcony, 10’ from Acropolis
description: Welcome to our centrally located gem in the heart of Athens! Nestled on the 1st floor (USA 2nd floor) of a well-maintained building with elevator, this recently refurbished 50sqm 1-bedroom flat offers the perfect blend of convenient location, comfort, and authentic Athenian living. Located in the hip and safe Koukaki area, just a 10-minute stroll from the iconic Acropolis Museum & a mere 6 mins from the "Syngrou-Fix" metro station, our space is ideal for both business and leisure guests alike.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is primely located at a safe neighbourhood (Koukaki area) in the very heart of Athens. It is right next to "Plateia Olympiou" and within 10-minutes walking distance from the Acropolis Museum, the Dionysiou Areopagitou pedestrian-only street and Plaka.

The area is very popular with both locals and tourists since it is quite lively and with a large variety of leisure options, including top awarded as well as value-for-money restaurants/bars. In fact, based on the votes of 40 million travellers from 150 different countries, Koukaki was ranked 5th on nocarz’s global list of the “Up-and-Coming Neighborhoods" to visit!

The closest metro station "Syngrou-Fix" is around a 6-minute walk, while Filopappou Hill is a pleasant 5-minute stroll away. The two famous pedestrian-only streets of Koukaki (Olympiou -- 1 min away and Drakou -- 5 mins away) are perfect for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing or working.

neighborhood_overview: In the shadow of the Acropolis is the neighborhood of Plaka. Our apartment is located in the heart of Athens,  just 300 m from Syntagma Square. On one side there is the bustling city center with many shops, restaurants and nightlife and on the other side, there is the historical Plaka, ancient ruins and temples through the quiet pedestrian streets leading to Acropolis.

name: Private room in Pangrati apartment (Room B, 392)
description: If you are looking for a place to stay long-term or short-term, I am sure the room will fit your needs. The apartment is in a key location, close to the center but also far enough to avoid the intense car sounds and grey of the city. It's a 15 minutes walk away from the Syntagma metro station and a 10 minutes walk from Euagelismos metro station. There are a lot of green spaces close to the apartment, like a park which is next to it, the hill of Kalimarmaro Stadium and also the National Garden.
neighborhood_overview: Pangrati has become very trendy the past few years. There are more and more places opening the past year so feel free to ask if you are looking for something in particular.
host_about:
Hello!
My name is Orfeas Voutsinos-Frantzis.
I am a PhD student at the Agricultural University of Athens. I study the plant "cichorium spinosum" in different agricultural systems, from organic open field to vertical farms. I also am the co-founder of the Dutch-based startup "Farmvent" (Website hidden by nocarz)  that focuses on vertical farming solutions.

I will be staying in the same apartment as you will.
There are 3 bedrooms in the apartment and I stay in one of them. You might meet another nocarz guest staying at the other room at the time of your stay.

I honestly enjoy meeting you guys. It's like doing erasmus from home in a way. I met a lot of interesting people throughout the years I've been doing nocarz and I became good friends with some of you. I apologize in advance  in case we meet in period where I am undergoing a lot of work-related pressure and I am not that socially active. I do enjoy when people enjoy the environment of the apartment.

I look forward to meeting you

name: Athenian Apartments - Syntagma sq. #5
description: "Syntagma Family apartment" is one of the five apartments in the building at "15 Voulis st." of "Athenian apartments". They are all in the heart of the city. Feel the beat, enjoy it!
neighborhood_overview:
There are plenty of sights to see in Athens including classic ones like Acropolis, museums, ancient remains, and "Monastiraki" flea market. You can also visit National garden, "Kalimarmaro stadium", and Temple of "Zeus". Take in the city view from the hill of "Lecabetus or "Filoppapou". Explore every street for hidden gems such as coffee shops, restaurants, and unique stores.

In the neighborhood, you will find traditional Greek tavernas, a pharmacy, banks, and public transportation. For garbage disposal, there are small cans on the street corners and a green can for general garbage and blue ones for recycling at the end of Voulis st. and Kolokotroni st. Restaurant options include Tzitzikas & mermingas and Barbadimos, both located at 12-14 Mitropoleos st. For groceries, check out BAZAAR DISCOUNT MARKET at 28 Petraki st. or 45 Mitropoleos st. Alternatively, there are grocery stores at the corner of Nikis st. and Xenofontos st. or 5 Apollonos st.

I look forward to hosting you and making your stay truly memorable!

The floor-to-ceiling windows exaggerate the connection of the guests with the city and its special contrast of modern urbanism and historic landscapes in City's Art & Shopping hub Monastiraki.
neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. name: Olala Alexandras Apartment | 15min. History Museum
description: Located in the heart of the city, Olala Alexandras Apartment is a modern accommodation in Athens that’s the perfect haven for families and travellers seeking a comfortable and convenient stay. This apartment boasts a centric location, placing you within easy reach of the city’s most iconic attractions and vibrant neighbourhoods.
neighborhood_overview: The surrounding neighbourhood offers a wealth of attractions and conveniences. Immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of Athens as you explore the city's renowned landmarks. The majestic Acropolis of Athens is a mere 19-minute drive away, where you can marvel at its iconic structures and breathtaking views. For art enthusiasts, the Benaki Museum is just a 9-minute drive, housing an impressive collection of Greek art spanning centuries. The Temple of Olympian Zeus, a monumental temple of the ancient world, is a short 13-minute drive from your doorstep. And for those seeking to delve deeper into Greece's fascinating past, the National Archaeological Museum is only an 8-minute drive away, offering an extensive collection of artefacts. Whether you seek the excitement of the city or a peaceful retreat after a day of exploration, this apartment promises to be the perfect haven for your memorable stay.
host_about:
Welcome to Olala Homes, where modern design and comfort come together to create the ultimate experience. With over 100,000 satisfied guests, we know how to provide a seamless and enjoyable digital experience for your stay.

Our worldwide accommodations range from stylish studios to luxurious villas, all designed with attention to detail to provide the ultimate comfort and care. Every Olala Homes property includes fast Wi-Fi, a Nespresso coffee machine, and amenities for families with children (where applicable). Because we know these little touches help make your stay truly special.

And - no more waiting in long lines to check-in! Our smart lock system allows you to self check-in at any time, giving you the freedom to arrive at your convenience and start enjoying your trip right away.

Join the Olala Homes experience and discover more than just a place to stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Petralona, nestled on the fringes of the historic heart of Athens, is a neighborhood that effortlessly marries the charm of old Athens with a gentle touch of modern bohemia. Known for its meandering streets adorned with neoclassical buildings, Petralona exudes an air of time-honored grace, making it a favorite among both locals and visitors seeking a more laid-back experience of the Greek capital.

Atmospheric Streets
The streets of Petralona are a mosaic of quaint tavernas, vintage shops, and artisanal bakeries, each telling its own story of the neighborhood's rich history and vibrant present. The area is divided into two sections, Ano (Upper) Petralona and Kato (Lower) Petralona, with the boundary often marked by the train tracks that gently slice through the area. neighborhood_overview:
The apartment's location is probably the best in Athens.

The neighborhood is Thission, a residential area, the most appealing of all for visitors as much as for Athenians, in the heart of the historic centre. It combines the characteristics of the mid-19th century through the neoclassical residencies (which are being continuously renovated) with the proximity to the most important archaeological sites through pedestrian streets and some of the most beautiful walks in any European capital.

It also offers several ultra-hip surrounding areas to eat, shop and walk around. A large choice of cafes, traditional taverns, and restaurants as well as local craft or fashion shops, offer visitors the option to spend time in the neighborhood if they please to acquire the inside knowledge of Athens!

The A.U.R.A. Gracious Apartment is a 10-15 minutes’ walk to the most important attractions but outside the touristy mass or city noise so even me, although the owner, a

name: Design Studio in Psirri
description:
Mezzanine studio for two.
The studio is located in the center of the vivid neighborhood of Psirri, in a small road next to the small taverns with live music and the bars!
For sightseeing, it is in 10 min. distance of the Acropolis and it's museum!
neighborhood_overview:
Psirri is a very special neighborhood.
In the beginning of the century, poor families from the aegean islands used to come here for work and built small houses. There is still a community of Naxos' people with small restaurants with live music and their traditional products such as cheese, seafood and goat's meat.
Another community of Psirri were the leather workers, making shoes and leather accessories, so there are still many manufacturers where you can buy or even order your own leather goods. These people worked in big industrial buildings built in Psirri during the '60s and '70s.
And last but most importantly, Psirri is surrounded by archeological sites The Acropolis, the Ancient Agora, the Cemetery of Keramikos. All in 3-10 minutes walk.
So, there is not only one way to describe Psirri. The diversity of it's character is what makes it so special and interesting.
host_about: My name is Claire, I am a conservator of works of art and my partner, Manolis, is a musician. We live in the most vivid and art centered area of Athens, full of street art, cafes and restaurants but still next to classical antiquities of the Acropolis, the Ancient Market and the Keramikos.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Athens, K23 Color Suites offers guests a convenient and stylish place to stay while exploring the city. The complex is located just 5 minutes from the Omonoia metro station, making it easy to get around and see the sights. Its central location also puts it within easy reach of many cultural attractions, including the Acropolis, the National Archaeological Museum, the Ancient Roman marketplace, and the historic neighborhood of Plaka.
In addition to its cultural offerings, the location of K23 Color Suites is also ideal for business travelers, with the Athens International Airport and Piraeus Port just 35 km away. neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in an ideal base in order to explore the Historic center of Athens.
In a 15 minutes walking distance you can visit the ruins of the official cemetery of the city, the "Demosion Sema", where Pericles delivered his funeral oration - the "Epitaphios logos" - in memory of the deceased Athenians in the first year of the Peloponnesian War (431 BC). The finds from the excavations of Kerameikos are exhibited in the Museum of Kerameikos and the National Archaeological Museum. The most important monuments of the site are:

• The Pompeion. A spacious building with a peristyle courtyard, used for the preparation of festival processions.

• The grave circle with the funerary stelae, among them the renowned stele of Hegeso (410 BC) and the marble bull in the plot of Dionysios of Kollytos (345 - 338 B.C.).

• Also it’s close to Gkazi. A neighborhood that offers a wide selection of nightlife, satisfying all preferences and tastes. Numerous ba

description: Diamond Home 6 is a unique place for your short stay in Athens! neighborhood_overview:
Our area belongs to the city of Athens, but at the same time, it looks like a suburb, as it is a quiet and safe residential area with a lot of green and buildings separated one from the other. We are 800 meters away from metro station PANORMOU (check that station on the map), where you can find a lot of amusement centers. We are 200 meters away from a small supermarket, open 24 hours every day.

From the main avenue called Kifissias towards our building, you walk 260 meters. During that walking, the road inclines 15 meters. This is the only uphill you will meet while coming from the metro station. See one of our last photos to get the image.

The neighborhood is located in a strategic spot, since you can reach almost all important places of Attiki, in approximately 30 minutes or less: 30 min to the Airport by metro or car, 30 min to the Beach by car, 20-30 min to Northern Suburbs by bus, 5 min to Athens Historical Center by metro (totally 15 min from the house).

Acropolis Cozy House: the name says it all. Here's a house, located right underneath the sacred rock of Acropolis, in the heart of Plaka, the oldest neighborhood of Athens. Earthly colors, wood and unique pieces of art, make up an ideal house for a small family or three people, with two bedrooms and 1.5 baths, on three different levels.

At first you'll be drawn to this house for three simple reasons: location, location, location! It's within walking distance of almost everything you will want to visit in Athens.

The Ground floor of the house consists of the living room, an open plan kitchen and a W.C. Right outside, there is the patio with comfortable sitting and also a rather unique feature: an outside bar. Here, along with your drink, you can enjoy great views of the surrounding city and the neighboring hill of Lycabettus.

The First floor consists of a spacious master bedroom with a queen size bed. A wooden staircase leads upstairs to the attic, where

neighborhood_overview:
Pagrati is a vibrant and lively neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. Known for its eclectic mix of old-world charm and modern conveniences, Pagrati is the perfect location for travelers who want to experience the best of both worlds.

One of the most notable features of Pagrati is its wide variety of cafes, restaurants, and bars. Whether you're in the mood for traditional Greek cuisine or international fare, you're sure to find something to suit your taste buds. The neighborhood is also home to several trendy bars and nightclubs, making it a popular destination for young adults looking to experience Athens' nightlife.

In addition to its lively dining and entertainment scene, Pagrati is also conveniently located near public transportation. The neighborhood has a metro station and a bus stop within walking distance, making it easy to explore all that Athens has to offer. From Pagrati, you can easily access popular tourist destinations such as the Acro

name: Acropolis Studio, a small apartment in a loft

neighborhood_overview:
Ano Petralona is a tranquil and beautiful quarter at the foot of the Philopappou Hill -also called the Hill of the Muses- next to the busy Thission district on the west side of the Acropolis.
The distance to Omonia Square –the capital’s heterogeneous “hub”- is 1,000 meters, via Piraeus Street. The same distance separates our neighborhood from the picturesque Plaka and the Acropolis. Our central square Platia Mercouri, at the beginning of Kallisthenous Street, is a meeting point for the locals with its traditional tavernas and bohemian café hangouts and is said to be the place to be. Multicolored bougainvilleas adorn the streets of Ano Petralona, especially the charming Troon Street.

name: Contemporary & Comfy Apt next to Acropolis Museum
neighborhood_overview:
Within 5 minutes’ walk is the main entrance of the Acropolis Temple, Parthenon, Kalimarmaron Stadium and Plaka.
The Acropolis Museum is an archaeological museum focused on the findings of the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens. The museum was built to house every artifact found on the rock and on the surrounding slopes, from the Greek Bronze Age to Roman and Byzantine Greece.
In the shadow of the Acropolis and its ancient temples, hillside Plaka has a village feel, with narrow cobblestone streets lined with tiny shops selling jewelry, clothes and local ceramics. Sidewalk cafes and family-run tavernas stay open until late, and Cine Paris shows classic movies al fresco. Nearby, the whitewashed homes of the Anafiotika neighborhood give the small enclave a Greek-island vibe.
The nearest airport is Eleftherios Venizelos Airport.

name: Acropolis Signature Residence

neighborhood_overview: Acropolis Designers Penthouse is located at Veikou 37 avenue, which is a stone’s throw away from all the major historical attractions. The Acropolis Metro Station is 150 meters away, and other public transportation stops are within 50 meters away. Acropolis historical monument is 500 meters away, and The New Acropolis Museum is 150 meters away as well as the Herodion venue and ancient Theater of Dionysus. Next to the City View, you can find the Ancient Agora, Temple of Zeus, and other historical and cultural monuments. All shops such as bakery, supermarket, grocery store, and variety of small typical Greek taverns and cozy cafes are within walking distance. Within walking distance from the suite are other major landmarks such as Syntagma Square, Plaka area, Monastiraki market as well as the major city’s shopping hotspots.

name: Lemon Tree Studio Apartment, Mets
description: A sunny studio on the ground floor of a renovated old Athenian house built in the early 30’s located in a beautiful pedestrian street in one of the most quiet and extremely safe residential district of Athens. The apartment is on the ground floor autonomous with a shady garden yard ideal for the hot Greek summer days and nights. Ideal for couples, families up to 4 (two adults, a child and a baby up to 2 years old) who want to be close to the main sightseeings and the city centre.
neighborhood_overview:
Mets is a scenic neighborhood to the east of the Acropolis opposite the Zappeion and the National Garden just a few minutes’ walk from the major Athens attractions: 10-minute walk from The Acropolis Museum and Plaka, 2-minute walk from Panathenaic Stadium and the Temple of Olympic Zeus, 15 minutes from Syntagma square and the Parliament and 5 minutes from the Prime Minister’s and the Presidential residence.
Our neighborhood is like a well hidden village full of neoclassical style houses dating from the 19th early 20th century. Just next to the Panahenaic Stadium where the first modern Olympic Games were held in 1896, Mets is also home to many Greek artists, actors and writers. Here you will have the chance to get a taste of old Athens with tiled roofs charming courtyards but also steep steps. In the neighborhood you can enjoy a discrete but elegant nightlife. Here you can find the most famous Athens’ jazz club and the unique restaurant awarded with 3 Michelin’s stars as well as tr
host_about:
Hi! I’m Dimitris and I live just upstairs from the studio with my wife Magda and our 6 year old son George. I have a degree in history (O.U.) and I’m a former antiquity and art conservator but I work at the HR department of a well-known Greek journal. Since I have relatives in Italy I can also speak some Italian too. My wife is a language teacher (French and English) and we both share a great love for movies, history and literature. I also love to play Basketball and board games.   
We also like travelling and we would be delighted to assist you in any way in order to have a pleasant stay here in Athens. Don’t hesitate to call us for any information you might need and we are looking forward to meeting you.

name: Radiant 2BR Suite with Eclectic Decor
description: At the Encantador Hotel you will have all the luxury, attention and disposition that this exquisite place can offer to make your stay always pleasant and unforgettable in beautiful Athens. It brings unique suites in its style and design like this divine 2BR Suite, full of vibrant colors that illuminate the whole place.
neighborhood_overview:
The cutting-edge hotel enjoys a privileged and ideal location in the historic heart of the city, next to Athens City Hall, within walking distance of the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum, the ancient city of Plaka and most of the attractions and sights of Athens.

Let yourself be seduced and let your curiosity lead you to important moments in history in this ancient place, such as:

The Acropolis: The Athenians always considered the Acropolis hill as a holly place. It has been inhabited since Mycenaean times, and increasingly majestic temples were built on it, ending with the great constructions pioneered by Pericles.

The Parthenon: The star of the Acropolis of Athens is undoubtedly the Parthenon. Despite having been sacked to the ground and being in a permanent state of rehabilitation, its imposing silhouette continues to dominate the Greek capital from the top.

Ancient Greece: Ancient Greece is considered the foundation of European culture.

David.

host_about:
Dreamin Athens is a company of Unique apartments in the heart of Athens but not only that. 
   We have hosted thousands of guests from all around the world since 2015 and we are committed to keep on doing our best, to help them experience the most hospitable homes and our unique Greek hospitality.
   We organize customized tours so they can experience all aspects of pleasures that Greece has to offer them, from ancient history and sites till the modern cuisine, nightlife, shopping and natural beauties. Feel free to ask any help or suggestions from our team that will love to enrich your trip with local secrets and advices that will make your stay unforgettable.

name: K58 Lux Flat/Monastiraki metro/Acropolis/Jacuzzi
description: Enjoy a unique experience at this centrally-located place. This stylish apartment of 44sqm. is located only 300m from Monastiraki square and subway station, 700m from Syntagma square and 1500m from Acropolis. The apartment is located right in the heart of Athens, in a safe and vibrant area. It has direct access to the airport with Monastiraki subway station. A renovated flat, equipped with queen-size bed, safety door/lock, Smart TV, WiFi, kitchen and a Jacuzzi.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in one of the most vibrant neighborhoods of Athens. Monastiraki is the heart of the touristic Athens. There are many hotels, bars, restaurants, and shops around the area. The Acropolis and the Acropolis museum are only 1.5 km away and easily accessible via subway or by foot. Syntagma square, where the Greek Parliament is located is 0.7 km away. Visitors can reach Syntagma square by walking up the pedestrian street of Ermou, one of the most commercial streets of Athens. Thissio is only 0.8 km away and so is Plaka the old historical neighborhood of Athens. Plaka is known as the "Neighborhood of Gods" and is located around the northern and eastern slopes of the Acropolis. Plaka is built on top of the residential areas of the ancient town of Athens under the Acropolis and has beautiful neoclassical buildings and small streets to wander around. Visitors will be fascinated by the beauty of the architecture, the elegance, and the well-preserved gardens.

host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

name: History Meets Modernity Acropolis Apartment Studio
description:
Just 10 minutes walk from the Acropolis entrance a unique private space for a comfortable and stylish stay at an Athenian contemporary building.

For those seeking an authentic and cozy place to stay where history meets modernity.

Preserved at the back yard of the building is a part of the Long Walls dated from mid 5th century BC (check Walk the Wall app for more info) and at the ground floor, sculptor's Theodoros studio where a selection of his works from the '50s to '10s is in display.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in an elegant, upscale downtown corner at the Acropolis foothills where old Athens meets modern Athens. A friendly neighborhood of the historical center just minutes away from the coast. A variety of restaurants and coffee shops are just around the corner while busy Ermou Street with retail, restaurants and bars is within walking distance. Major archaeological sites, museums and cultural centers are nearby too.
host_about:
Born and raised in downtown Athens I studied architecture and cultural management.
I love to travel and explore authentic new places. My happy place includes good food and the company of friends and family.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Nikos, living and working in Athens for almost all my life, except of a period when I was working for a multinational firm and been living and working in many European countries.

I am married to Kiriaki and we have 2 sons.

I own and manage many apartments in the very inner center circle of Athens (some of them beside the Metro, in 30-50m) and a few others in the larger Athens. 
All of them are either brand new or recently fully renovated. 
Depending on the apartment, they dispose free private Parking, extraordinary views of the city, Smart TVs, Satellite TV connection (1200 free channels), etc. They all beautifully decorated and dispose fully equipped (for long stays) kitchens, 42-50" LED TVs, Home Cinema, DVD collection, WiFi internet, A/C in all rooms, outdoor space (terrace, balcony, patio).
 
What I love mostly in my work is to meet different people & cultures from all over the world and to share our experience of life. 
What a wonderful feeling is when my guests thank me after having spent some unforgettable time in one of my apartments in this great city - Athens.
I wouldn't exchange this for the world.

I'll be very happy to host you in one of my apartments and provide you with all necessary information and tips on what you "must see", where and how to go, where to eat (and where not...!!) and so make your life easy and save a lot of your vacation time.

I can organize your transports inside/out of Athens (with VIP vehicles), starting from your pick-up from/to the airport, then a tour around the sites of Athens or a short daily escape to the larger Attica or your trip to Delphi, Mycenae, Epidaurus, Ancient Olympia, etc. 

Don't hesitate to contact me for further information (...no charge...!!).

Area Description:
Close to Thiseio and the Acropolis but safely removed from their tourist traps, Petralona blends old-school charm, artistic vibes and boho haunts. Like many parts of the downtown, this too, seems kind of disorganized and chaotic, with a haphazard mix of different architectural styles and lots of graffiti.

But then again this is where its allure lays – in true Athenian style. Amid the whole scruffy setting there are alternative-chic joints – from traditional taverns with a twist, to experimental places featuring theater and gigs, Thai and French restaurants and trend-setting bars. Launched by a swarm of young creatives who’ve recently relocated in the area, these eye-catching spots are responsible for the area’s renaissance - Petralona is often dubbed the “New Gazi”.

It still retains though a distinctly local character and feel, without being over-commercialized or pretentious like its fabled neighbor. Petralona is also conveniently positio

But then again this is where its allure lays – in true Athenian style. Amid the whole scruffy setting there are alternative-chic joints – from traditional taverns with a twist, to experimental places featuring theater and gigs, Thai and French restaurants and trend-setting bars. description: The property is located in Monastiraki, just a 2-minute walk from the "Monastiraki" metro station! In this stunning, historic area, in the heart of Athens! Pole of attraction for Athenians, tourists and not only! The huge market, the sights categorize the area into one of the most beautiful areas of Athens. An area special but also special!
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of the Athenian centre, Monastiraki is a unique blend of rhythms, eras and cultures, vibrant and always dynamic – yet steadily dedicated to commerce and the meeting of people. If we stand in the center of Monastiraki Square and make a 360-degree turn on the spot, we can see the history of Athens in just a few square meters. Recently renovated, the Square was paved with mosaic blocks of marble, stone and carved cast iron, symbolizing the “flows” and the diversity of the Mediterranean peoples.
The Tzistarakis Mosque (1759) was named after the Ottoman Voivode of the city Mustafa Aga Tzistarakis. It was also known as the Lower Fountain Mosque from the nearby fountain, which was fed by Eridanus. Its use as a handicraft museum begins after its first repair in 1915 and since 1975 it houses a remarkable collection of pottery from Greece, Cyprus, Ottoman and modern Turkey. Inside there is information and photos about the works and artists, but also the historical importance of

Welcome to our lovely underground one-bedroom apartment in Athens with its own private terrace to relax! Our newly renovated 44sqm apartment offers a very cozy space to relax and enjoy yourself. It's located within the hustle and bustle of the recently transformed Pagkrati area, just a quick 20-minute walk to Athens downtown and all the major attractions. You are going to love its family-friendly, safe vibe combined with an animated social scene.
neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is ideally located in a quiet neighborhood of the recently transformed Pagkrati area. Just a quick 20-minute walk to Athens downtown and all the major attractions, Pagkrati has an blatantly Athenian feel, pock-marked with vegan eateries, cool bars, and pockets of green (Alsos Pagratiou and Adritou hill) alongside Michelin restaurants, long-standing tavernas and mom-and-pop run stores. You 're love its family-friendly, safe vibe combined with an animated social scene.

name: Athens Central Apartment 5’ to Metro station
description:
This beautiful apartment 130m2 is in the best location in Athens , close to center and nightlife. 2,5 kilometers to Acropolis, 100 m from Larisis station metro and the central train station which connects with national airport and all the Greece major cities. 110 m2, in front of the historical Pantazopoulou square.
The position of the apt allows our visitors easy access to all ancient sites and other interesting tourist attractions, such as the Acropolis, the Parthenon & the Plaka Area.

Near the Archaeological Museum (10' on foot).
29 km from E. Venizelos airport
12 km from the Olympic Stadium
12 km from the port of Piraeus
3 km from the Interurban bus terminals.

name: Spacious One Bedroom Apartment in Central Athens
description:
Spacious, newly renovated one bedroom cozy apartment. 3 minute walk to Agios Nikolaos metro station, and another 10 minute metro journey to Monastiraki.

Agios Nikolaos is a vibrant residential and commercial area with an eclectic range of eateries. It is a 10 minute trip from the heart of Athens, balancing quick access and tranquil sleeps at night. Highlights include the 19th-century Agios Nikolaos Church, and Lela Karagianni's House, former home of a World War II resistance leader.
neighborhood_overview: Agios Nikolaos is a vibrant residential and commercial area with an eclectic range of eateries. The main Archanon throughway is a busy, tree-lined avenue featuring a wide range of stores and cafes. Highlights include the 19th-century Agios Nikolaos Church, the Byzantine Cathedral of the Holy Trinity, and Lela Karagianni's House, former home of a World War II resistance leader.

name: Tranquil Loft | Contemporary haven in city center
description: Make yourself at home in this stylish retreat, a hidden gem right in the heart of Athens’ historical centre! Unwind amidst bright and chic hideaway, a newly renovated studio featuring industrial design and all the facilities you could need, whether for a short city break or a longer stay. Perfect for city lovers, remote workers and those who wish to get away from the hustle and bustle - all whilst enjoying a central location; this designer apartment provides an idyllic space.
neighborhood_overview:
Getting Around
The loft is located 550 meters from Monastiraki Square metro station and 400 meters from Thissio metro station.
Ermou central shopping street is just 400 meters away and there are more than 300 restaurants and bars within a 500-metre range of the apartment. There are more than 6 parking lots available just 20 - 50 meters away, which means there is enough space for the many people visiting the area, tourists and locals alike.

All the main archaeological sites in the city center range from 300 meters to 1.5 km away, so we strongly recommend you visit them on foot, so that you’ll also get to experience Psirri’s magnetic atmosphere and what it means to live the local way!
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

neighborhood_overview: The area is a cultural must visit neighbourhood in Greece. name: Charming Apartment In Athens' Historic Center
description:
Welcome to our spacious apartment in Athens' vibrant heart. Ideal for groups, families, or couples, it offers cozy comfort just steps from the Acropolis.

Enjoy free Wi-Fi, air conditioning, and a washing machine. Perfect for long stays or weekend getaways, explore the city's rich history from your perfect home base
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is on Athens' historic center. The apartment is at a pedestrian street, which makes it very quiet even if it's at the heart of Athens. The neighborhood is very popular for both locals and tourists and is full of restaurants and coffee shops. Is situated inside the Athenian commercial center, offering many options for shopping, barhopping and wandering around.

As you exit the apartment, you practically find yourself in waking distance from every attraction of the city:

- Monastiraki, where is the flea market and a folk bazaar where you can wonder all day for shopping and coffee is 600m away. It is situated at the bottom of Acropolis' hill and next to the ancient market and the ancient ruins of Athens and Plaka neighborhood.
- Syntagma Square, which is the main square of Athens with the parliament and the changing of the guards (Evzones) is 800m away.
- Ermou street, which is the main Athenian commercial street is 300m away.

Upo
host_about:

neighborhood_overview:
Exarcheia has an edgy alternative vibe, its streets decorated with politically charged murals and lined with anarchist bookshops and stores selling rare vinyl and vintage guitars. Bars and clubs host live music, including rebetika (Greek blues), jazz and punk acts.
Shady Valtetsiou street has a village feel, with low-key Mediterranean and veggie-friendly eateries alongside cozy tavernas and traditional coffee shops.
Ermou the most popular commercial road of Athens and Kolonaki the most prestigious shopping area is just a breath away. Pedion tou Areos park is just a few meters away. The area is pleasantly bursting during the day but peaceful at night ensuring you get a well-deserved rest.

Ideal for business travelers’ or families, the apartment will offer you a comfortable stay combining the absolute urban lifestyle with a homey atmosphere.

neighborhood_overview:
Pagrati is a neighborhood in Central Athens. Ιts frontage runs from Vasilissis Sofias Avenue along to Vasileos Konstantinou Avenue and Vassileos Alexandrou Avenue, just a few minutes walk from the National Gardens. One of the most important landmarks of Pangrati is the Panathinaiko Stadium that hosted the first modern Olympic Games in 1896.
Modern office spaces and boutique clothing stores collide with decades-old cafés and restaurants that double. Ιt is home to a number of Athens’ best natural spots including running trails that overlook the city, as Alsos Park. In recent years, has given enough interest, creating an opportunity for daring restaurants, bars and art galleries to swoop in, breathing new life into Pangrati.

neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently nestled on the foot of Philopappos hill and only a few minutes away from the magnificent Acropolis, Koukaki’s prime location is one of the reasons the neighborhood has turned into a hotspot for both locals and travelers.

It offers the ideal combination of being very close to all the monuments in the historical center of Athens, while at the same time retaining a traditional character, reminiscent of what Athens looked like years ago.

Deemed as one of the world’s “hottest” districts by numerous major tourism industry leaders, the scenic community is seeing more and more travelers walking its charming streets every year. And its elegant architecture, spirited nightlife, and beguiling aura of authenticity have done no less than astonish every single visitor.

name: Retro-design apt. with balcony next to Acropolis!
description:
Located in Thissio, a neighborhood full of charm, flair and gastronomic proposals, just a few meters from Acropolis, this renovated and fully equipped apt offers the ultimate authentic hospitality in a city with heady history and edginess.
Ideal for vistors, remote workers and students. Internet @100MBps!
For >1 week electricity up to 50kwh/week is included->5h/day a/c & normal use of rest devices. Extra electricity@0.5€/kWh.
Breakfast essentials are provided to prepare on your own.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood of Thission is one of the most interesting areas in Athens with picturesque family houses, high quality gastronomy places and several cultural attractions. It offers a dive into Athenian life, while being ideally located and easily connected to the most important places of interest of the historic centre.
Acropolis and Parthenon and all main historical-cultural attraction are within walking distance through the magnificent Filopappou Hill.
The same applies also for Kerameikos-Gazi and Koukaki, two of the most vivid areas in modern Athens, away from the crowded touristic spots.
host_about: I am an engineer in my mid 30's, living and working in Athens. When i have free time, i like doing sports, travelling, reading books and most of all playing with my daughter.

name: Maison7 - Acropolis
description: Maison7 is ideally set in the historical centre of Athens in the most vibrant district, Psirri. Lavish rooms fully equipped for a pleasant high-end stay.
neighborhood_overview: Maison7 is located at  Navarchou Apostoli 7 in Psirri, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighbourhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the central and iconic “Monastiraki” Metro station or the Athens Railway “Thissio” station. The area around it, the Historic Centre of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Giannis, an entrepreneur and a coffee shop owner. I really like meeting new people from all over the world while travelling or, even better, having them visit Athens and hosting them! I am energetic and forward-thinking (or so my friends and colleagues say about me), a physical as well as intellectual person. I enjoy football and alternative sports, but also reading good books and of course activities like puzzles and escape rooms, things I do for a living!
I have travelled all over Europe and Africa and I consider Paris and Budapest my favourite destinations, places of history but also modern and cosmopolitan, having many things to see and do.
Films and TV shows about historic events and murder mysteries are my favorite and recently I got infatuated with Money Heist (“La casa de Papel”). while my literature of choice is mainly classic and timeless. I could not imagine myself as I am today without having read “Around the World in 80 Days” in my childhood!
I enjoy Mediterranean and Greek traditional cuisine, but I would like to taste every culinary tradition the world has to offer.
As for a life moto? “You can learn more for a person by playing with him/her for an hour than by a year-long conversation”, by Greek philosopher Plato.

name: A13 Pristine & Sunny 30m2 flat near Syntagma sq
description: A 30m2 sunny disinfected suite in the center of the city with a smart layout and all comforts a contemporary flat should have. You are invited you to treat yourself to relaxing moments in the sunny balcony or walks in the friendly neighborhood, bringing you to cute local shops & rustic pedestrian streets. This beautiful suite is a 5-minute walk from Syntagma and Monastiraki square, and a 15-minute walk from the Parthenon & all Archeological sites. Let yourself feel @ home here!
neighborhood_overview:
Be ready for the historical triangle of the center of Athens. Always full of surprises bars, restaurants and bistros which pop up in every corner, shops either brand new or which stands there for more of 50 years and all these under the shadow of Parthenon which stands just 1klm away from your place.

The pristine apartment is near to bakeries, supermarkets as well as plenty of shops and the central market of Athens. Picturesque pedestrisn streets like the one of Eolou or Adrianou in just 5 or 10 minutes walk. In general the area being the commercial and touristic center of Athens has a lot to offer and for every budget and taste as well as the whole 5 city center of this multifarious metropolis.

Let us help you to discover your Athens!
host_about:
First came our fascination to meet people around the globe, exchange stories and see our city in different ways through their  eyes.

This fueled a desire to create pristine suites right at the heart of Athens and yet far enough from the hustle and bustle, so one can collect themselves and reflect on the experiences collected in this multifarious city lying under the shadow of the Parthenon.

Let us be your host!

name: Welcome to your cozy apartment away from home! !
description: Welcome to our bright, sunny, quaint, and humble abode!  A warm peaceful clean apartment situated in a lively friendly neighborhood.  Close to shops, restaurants and outdoor farmers markets.  A short cab or bus ride to downtown Athens and the Acropolis.
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is in a prime downtown location, close to many shops and services including grocery stores, restaurants, drug store, fast food delivery, hair salons, & outdoor farmers markets, plus a convenience store next door. It's also a short bus ride or 5 euro cab ride to the ancient center of Monsateraki , Plaka and the base of the Acropolis.
3 sets of bed and bath linens provided in drawer under bed and in storage under sofa bed and chaise. Hot water breaker to be turned on 15 minutes prior to use and must be turned off once hot water is being used.
One of the hostess's lives in the building if guests have any questions.
host_about: Hello !  My wife and I live in Toronto and I have a beautiful, cozy apartment in downtown Athens that’s close to many major sites.  It's in a great location with lots to do close by, public transportation, restaurants, pharmacy, grocery & convenience store withing walking distance.

name: Hidesign Athens Art Loft  with Acropolis view
description:
An artistic, spacious and bright 171sqm Penthouse, filed with natural light from 12 meters of city view windows. As it is located on the 6th floor of a building, in the heart of the historical centre of Athens, this loft has a stunning view of the Acropolis, Lycabettus Hill and all over the city.
Museums, restaurants, bars, shops etc are accessible within walking distance.

Enjoy the luxury, comfort and elegance while staying in our residence.
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the benefits of the central location. Many museums and galleries are just a few minutes away. Restaurants, bars, cafes, supermarkets are located near the apartment.
host_about:
Hidesign Athens Apartments & Villas was created fifteen years ago, when we decided to expand the services of our architecture office and combine our skills and passion to offer accommodation to people seeking to explore Greece. 

Our aim is to provide you with a unique home rental experience that combines the comforts of a luxury hotel and upscale hospitality in a family context.

A team member will always welcome you and be at your disposal for advice and suggestions that only a local can provide.

name: Ermou Monastiraki View Lycabettus
description: “Ermou Monastiraki View Lycabettus” 46m2 Deluxe suite is located at Ermou, the most famous pedestrian str of Athens, next to Acropolis and Plaka, provides comfortable stay looking at the Lycabettus Hill, offering all the amenities to you for living the ultimate experience. Fully renovated in December 2019, with stylish furniture, king size bed and luxurious bathrooms are ideal for your short/long stay in Athens. Free Wifi/Netflix. Located on the 6th floor, easily accessible by two elevators.
neighborhood_overview:
★Area★

The Deluxe suite is just a two-minutes walk away from the Monastiraki metro station which is a big convenience because from there you can easily access other areas of the city including many of its most important historic and cultural sites.

The suite itself is right in the heart of the hip and once bohemian Psyrri, one of the oldest quarters of Athens which has experienced a resurgence in popularity and gentrification in recent years. It's a very trendy neighborhood buzzing with live music, cafes, bars, gallery spaces, theatres, cute tavernas, and vibrant nightlife. Small artisans' shops and high-end boutiques are scattered throughout the maze of streets. You won't lack for things to do or see within a few minutes of the apartment. (Lord Byron penned his poem "Maid of Athens" during his stay in this neighborhood.)

The main attraction in Psyrri is the Kerameikos ancient cemetery, which includes part of the Themistoclean Wall and the Sacred Gate.

name: Central Bliss Suite A1
description: Welcome to our sleek and stylish apartment, perfect for travelers seeking a comfortable and contemporary stay in the city. This beautifully designed space combines modern amenities with minimalist aesthetics to create a serene and inviting atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview:
Syntagma, located at the very heart of Athens, is a neighborhood that beautifully encapsulates the essence of the city, blending historical significance with modern vibrancy. Here’s an overall look at what makes Syntagma a prime destination for visitors.

Ermou Street, starting at Syntagma Square, is a shopper’s paradise with a mix of luxury boutiques and popular retail chains. The area is also known for its diverse dining options, from traditional Greek tavernas to chic international restaurants and cafes.

The National Garden, adjacent to the square, provides a lush retreat with walking paths and serene spots. The nearby Zappeion Hall and garden offer additional green spaces and host cultural events.

Syntagma is the perfect base in Athens, offering rich history, cultural attractions, excellent shopping and dining, beautiful parks, and a lively nightlife. Its central location and vibrant atmosphere make it ideal for both short visits and extended stays

name: Wonderful sunlit apt in the center close to subway
description: My place is a five minute walk to the famous metro station "Megaro", the famous Athens Music Hall, in the center of Athens. neighborhood_overview:
Our place is in a neighborhood called 'Ilisia'. It's a wonderful and safe neighborhood both in the center but without noise across from a very nice park called Syngrou Park.

There are several major hotels in the vicinity (Crowne Plaza, Hilton, Best Western, Divani Caravel, etc), great restaurants, bakeries, as well as several convenience stores and small supermarkets.

Check out family tavern "Ta Skalakia" which is literally around the corner.
Restaurant 'Vlassis' is also nice and affordable.
'The Bakers' is a short 6-minute walk away but worth trying out.

Plenty of upscale restaurants near Hilton.

name: Spacious and modern flat at Koukaki near Acropolis
description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place.
Well renovated and furnished, this 3bdr flat on the 2nd floor promises to make you relax and enjoy Athens all day while coming back to a cozy environment, with good amenities for your comfort!
It's a step away from the Acropolis, just 10min walking. The metro and tram station of Syggrou Fix is just 2 minutes walking from the flat and many restaurants and cafes nearby will make you feel at ease :)
neighborhood_overview:
Koukaki holds a special place among Athens’ inner-city neighbourhoods. Wedged between the ancient glory of the Acropolis hill and the rumbling traffic of Syngrou Avenue, it’s a district of intriguing contradictions. A blend of cultural kudos, green oases and interesting architecture that happily accommodates both the locals who live here and the tourists who love it, without sacrificing its true self. As one of the most rapidly-evolving pockets of central Athens, cool Koukaki combines intimacy with authenticity.

Neos Kosmos is another very interesting area nearby, residential yet busy and close to everything! The metro and tram station, the modern art museum and so much more!
host_about:
TopHouzzing’s story is simple yet exciting! We are Maria & Alex, the founders, both engineers. So we were already working together in the design & construction sector, so we  dealt with properties all the time. We are both into details, both love doing something right from scratch.

While we were traveling to new places and meeting old friends / making new ones, we felt what a rental should feel like, what it should offer guests like ourselves. Lots were missing, especially the simple little things that makes a visitor feel right at home -away from home. We then decided to start a rentals & real estate management company. It was July 2015 and we named it TopHouzzing Properties - the mission was simply to offer truly top accommodation to our guests. Starting then with a couple of our own properties, refurbished completely, we embarked on a great journey. 

Today the company manages close to 100 properties and growing steadily, mostly in Athens but also in mainland Greece and islands, flats, villas and so on. TopHouzzing  also offers consulting & real estate, design & construction and other professional services in its portfolio.

Hard work and our passion paid off. Our success is clearly stated not only in the many owners that trust us with their properties but even more in the hundreds 5-star reviews from guests from all over the world,  leading us to have a record of 14 consecutive quarters-since the company’s inception- SuperHost status on nocarz!

We take very good care of our guests and so do we with owners. You see, we both think as guests & owners ourselves. We are waiting anxiously to host you or to manage your property, in both cases you are in good hands with us.

neighborhood_overview:
Indulge in the Athenian lush lifestyle right in the heart of city´s coolest area.

Your flat is located in a pre-war building completely renovated in 2023 at a quiet street of the iconic Exarchia area. Just a five minute walk from Omonoia and Panepistimiou metro stations there is not much that hasn´t been already said about Exarchia. Still managing to elude the mainstream touristic city map, this area claims one of the most important parts of Athens´ modern history and culture. The humble neighborhood of the mid 19th century evolved to an area much favored by the newly emerging middle class at the time and for more than 150 years now, it has been the melting pot for cultural, artistic and political ideas, with an innovative city lifestyle only to be experienced in this area.

name: Wild at Heart Αpartment with Hammam Thisio Αrea
description: Welcome to your Athenian home away from home! This newly renovated 1-bedroom apartment blends modern amenities with charm, providing a cozy sanctuary in the vibrant Thissio district.
neighborhood_overview: Thissio, nestled in the heart of Athens, is a captivating neighborhood renowned for its seamless blend of ancient charm and vibrant street life. Framed by the majestic backdrop of the Acropolis, Thissio is a picturesque tapestry of neoclassical architecture, leafy promenades, and lively squares. Visitors can wander through the bustling open-air markets, discover hidden gems in quaint boutiques, or indulge in the culinary delights of traditional tavernas and trendy cafes. The area is steeped in history, with easy access to iconic landmarks such as the ancient Agora and the Temple of Hephaestus.

name: Fab studio at ABIRA's
description:
Abira's Athens, located at the vibrant Neapoli neighborhood - right between Kolonaki and Exarchia - offers brand new and fully equipped serviced apartments leaving you worry-free to explore every corner of the city’s sites.

The central location is ideal for discovering Athens, while enjoying quiet and peaceful moments in a highly functional apartment designed for comfortable and pleasant visits.
neighborhood_overview:
Come and discover the hip neighborhoods of Exarchia and Kolonaki!
Exarchia is known to be the artsy neighborhood of Athens - many artists live and work here and this gives a good vibe to the area. Kolonaki, on the other hand, is an upscale and stylish neighborhood ideal for shopping and fine dining. There are countless cozy bars and restaurants in the surrounding streets while the central location of theses areas makes them the most convenient places to discover true Athens!

The neighborhoods of Kolonaki and Exarchia are ideal for those who want to really experience Athens like a local, being away from heavily crowded touristic areas but still in the city center. Well-suited for couples and friends who want to explore the diverse center of the city, as well as students attending seminars or professionals on business trips.

Within 250 meters (3 minutes walk) from Ariba's you can find supermarkets, laundromats and ATMs.
host_about: Me (Zack) and Tanya live in Athens with our 5 yr old son. We love traveling and vacationing within Greece and abroad - we lived in the US and UK in the past. On weekends, you will find us at our summer home at lovely Lavrio.

name: Stylish Studio Apartment
description:
The apartment is situated in Kolonaki at the heart of Athens. Newly renovated, fully equipped, and located in a lovely and quiet neighborhood. The nearest metro station that connects directly to the airport is Evangelismos and is just 450m walking distance.

It is situated on the second floor of the building, but because the area is uphill, we have made our own private entrance from the side street above. Therefore, no elevator is needed, with direct access to the apartment floor.
neighborhood_overview: Although Kolonaki is regarded as the most glamorous and quite areas in Athens, is located in walking distance from most attractions, museums, shops and places to be explored. The main attraction would be ofcourse the Lycabettus, cable car. Is just 2 minutes away, and the view is just breathtaking. About 50 meters away is Patriarchou Ioakeim street, a beautiful road full of shops and bars that takes you to Kolonaki Square. From there National Garden, Monastiraki, Ermou Street, and even Acropolis is few minutes by foot. We always recommend to walk, and explore Athens center by foot. And don't forget, Kolonaki is probably one of the safest areas in Athens. No matter what time you want to go out, even late night or early morning is as safe as mid day.

name: Modern City center apartment with Acropolis view!
description:
85sqm apartment, 1st floor, completely rebuilt within 2018 with a clear Acropolis (Parthenon) view from the Living Room. Fully equipped and of high aesthetics.
From the metro, any prominent sights, will be reached with ease. Located in the historical center of Athens, 6 to 13 min walk from three (3) train stations (Line 1-Monastiraki, Thissio & Omonia) and two (2) metro stations (Line 3-Monastiraki & Kerameikos).

I really hope you can give my home a try and see you soon! Glad to host you!
neighborhood_overview:
The building is next to the historical center of Athens. On foot you can go almost everywhere of Athens' center. Acropolis (Parthenon) is roughly 20 min walk. All restaurants, bars and activities are from 5 to 20 min walk. Examples: A) Monastiraki and Syntagma area are the most beautiful and representative places in Athens, with most sightseeings accumulated around and literally hundreds of nice restaurants, bars, clubs, live music halls etc
B) Around Metro Station "Kerameikos" of Line 3 (5 min walk) are also numerous bars and restaurants. This is a more "artistic" area of Athens but can match all expectations.
Just drop me a message and tell me the purpose of your visit (work, sightseeing, fan, etc) and we can make excellent suggestions.

Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The Diplomat’s ABR  Trikoupi 95
Situated in the historic street of Charilaou Trikoupi 95,

The spaces apart from the 21 comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy  spectacular views over the city of Athens, and one of the most prized landmarks –  the Lycabettus hill from morning till night

The Diplomat’s  ABR Trikoupi 95 has been fully transformed into a place that welcomes business travellers, couples, families and friends, who seek an urban sanctuary in the heart of modern Athens
 

Should you require any additional help or information during your stay with us, please do not hesitate to contact our Lobby Manager, at the lobby of our premises or the support telephone line of Athens Boutique Residence.  For emergency matters you may contact the building supervisor, who is located at the ground floor next to the main entrance.  

May I take this opportunity to thank you for having chosen the Athens Boutique Residence and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,


Your Athens Boutique Residence Team

name: Excellent “value for money” in this Renov 1br
description:
Welcome to your sanctuary in the heart of Athens, a renovated 1 Br apartment nestled in the vibrant Kerameikos neighborhood. An excellent value for money choice for your stay! Step into a cocoon of serenity, where every corner is a white cloud of comfort, coziness, and pure pleasure.
Our meticulous attention to detail ensures that everything is soothing to the eye.
host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

name: Raise Boutique room 23 in the center of Athens
description: Brand new fully renovated hotel style rooms at Psiri area in the center of Athens.
neighborhood_overview: Psirri is an old neighbourhood of Athens located north-west of Monastiraki. The area consists of many old houses most of which were deserted and ruined. However, over the years, Psiri has changed a lot. Some of the neoclassical buildings have been restored and a lot of trendy bars and shops have opened. Today, it attracts many young Athenians who enjoy the blend of traditional and modern character of the area. Narrow streets which are bordered with picturesque taverns and cozy cafes and bars as well as nice shops with cheap products. Restaurants with live Greek music receive a great number of people, especially during the weekends. Psiri is not so popular among tourists but it is an excellent choice for a night out in the centre of Athens. It is found really close to Monastiraki and Plaka.

name: The Little Prince in heart of Plaka, by JJ Hospitality
description: A tiny and very cute studio house in the center of Plaka in the heart of the ancient monuments. Locations don't get better than this, it's actually nestled between Hadrian's Library, the Tower of Winds and the Stoa of Attalos. You can see them from your front door! A few paces away from Monastiraki metro station and within reach of the bars and restaurants of Athens historical center. This is a great value option for those looking for the best center location in town.
neighborhood_overview: You are located in perhaps the best spot in the city - no seriously! It is nestled in the old, timeless quarter of Plaka, a few paces from the Stoa of Attalos and the ancient Agora and the flea markets of Monastiraki and the historical street of Andrianou with loads of restaurants and bars. A few minutes walk to the east are the splendid Temple of Thesion. The Acropolis and the Acropolis museum are 15min walk. There are also some great shopping, eating and entertainment opportunities in the neighborhood, from ultra exclusive to no-frills, you will find what you are looking for!

name: Penthouse With Magical Acropolis View & Jacuzzi!
description: Discover luxury in our top-floor Athens penthouse, located in the safe, lively Thisseio area, just steps from the Acropolis. neighborhood_overview:
Step into the heart of history and culture in our chic and cozy apartment in the sought-after Thissio neighborhood of Athens. The location couldn't be more perfect - walk out the door and be immediately surrounded by world-renowned archeological sites, charming cafes, delicious restaurants, and trendy boutiques.

Just 4 minutes away by foot, visit the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum and the Ancient Agora, all within walking distance. The Thissio metro station is also just 4 minutes away, making it easy to explore the rest of the city.
Take in the sights and sounds of the city on the main cobblestone pedestrian road of the Acropolis (Apostolou Pavlou) which is just 50 meters away, or stroll down to Dyonisiou Aeropagitou in less than 10 minutes.

Experience the magic of the open-air rooftop cinema, Cine Thision, voted as one of the top ten open cinemas in the world, all while taking in the Acropolis view. Ermou and Monastiraki, the commercial and touristic market

name: Acropolis Golden Suites|Penthouse Maisonette byGHH
description: Acropolis Golden Suites Apartment is a part of a brand new building  (completed in 2020), located in the heart of Athens. You can see the magnificent view while you are enjoying your private jacuzzi! It is close all the major archaeological sites everything by walking distance such as the Acropolis museum and the Acropolis metro station, the "Plaka" area which is the most ancient part of the city, the Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium and a lot more you can explore by yourself!
neighborhood_overview:
Acropolis is actually one of the most picturesque neighbourhoods in Athens. The long pedestrian street passes (Apostolou Pavlou st) in front of the Acropolis, Herodeion Theatre, the New Acropolis Museum and finally reaches the Hadrian Arch. It is also known as Makrigianni quarter in Athens, where the statue of Makrigiannis lies, the hero of the Greek Revolution, that is found at the beginning of this street, in a small round square.

Its architectural beauty and its historical significance, make this quarter popular among tourists and a favorite spot of the Athenians to stroll around on a Sunday morning, under the Holy Rock. It borders with the picturesque neighborhood of Plaka from one side and the region of Koukaki on the other. The most famous sights in Athens are found within a walking distance from the Acropolis, explaining the reason why most of the visitors stay close to the city center. Also, Acropolis can be easily accessed by metro (Acropolis Metro Station), bus or
host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

name: Calliope by Heloni Apartments
description: Welcome to our luxurious apartment, ideally suited for accommodating six people. It is located near the iconic Odeon of Herodes. Large windows grace the walls, framing breathtaking views of the majestic Acropolis. The apartment features three well-designed bedrooms, each with its own bathroom. The fully equipped kitchen provides all the amenities to dine in. For those seeking a touch of serenity and a breathtaking panoramic view of the Acropolis, the shared rooftop terrace awaits.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the most ideal location of Athens as in just a few minutes you can find yourself in the archaeological site of the Acropolis and the Museum. You can walk or have a drink on Dionysiou Areopagitou Street, which is a pedestrian street, next to the southern slope of the Acropolis. You can also enjoy a beautiful walk on the hill of Filoppapos, which is very close by and takes its name from the monument on top of it.
host_about:
Heloni is an ancient Greek word that translates into tortoise. This philosophy focuses on the sense of security and comfort that the turtle feels within its shell. 
Through the idea of the "Virtual hotel," we provide apartments that, although distant from a traditional reception, manage to ensure a comfortable stay. This approach allows guests to enjoy their desired privacy, creating an environment that enhances their travel experience.

name: Penthouse of light @Koukaki
description: A very spacious, modern apartment with 45sqm terrace and window walls that submerge the living room in natural light. Set in a central yet calm neighborhood of Athens, the apartment is in walking distance of all the main actions of the city. Penthouse of light @Koukaki is a great choice for groups and families looking for roomy, homely space in a friendly, central area of the city.
neighborhood_overview: Adjacent to The Acropolis and the city historical center with all these world famous ancient treasures, Koukaki is a unique area of Athens. Full of life, with lots of restaurants, bars, cafes, bistrots, markets and definitely one of the most favorite areas of artists and young people, was recently distinguished by nocarz as the no 5 of the areas that have soared in popularity worldwide. Avoiding the hustle and bustle of the city center, Koukaki offers the experience of a traditional Athenian neighborhood together with the proximity to the most important attractions of the city. Parthenon, Acropolis Museum, Dionysus Theater and Plaka are only some of the destinations that make this area the perfect starting point, while Drakou and Olympiou, two pedestrian streets, make it a fantastic place for a wander. Also Philopappou hill, gives you the opportunity of your morning jogging, or an alternative walk through the pine trees and the most amazing photos of Acropolis.
host_about: I was born and raised in Athens and I feel I'm so blessed to live in this country. I'm a mechanical engineer. I love to travel but I also love to host travelers. I like music, photography, movies and sports.

host_about:
Hello, we are two brothers in our 30s, Yannis and Taxiarhis (Tax)! 

We grew up in Athens before spending our 20s in the UK and France studying & working (and doing lots of travelling along the way!). Our favorite destinations include the US, Thailand, India and Spain.

name: Luxury Penthouse in the Center with Acropolis View
description: This one-bedroom apartment is designed for travelers who seek an immersive stay in Athens. A short stroll away from all landmarks and attractions, it’s in the midst of the city’s historic center. The boho-chic, premises sport elegant furnishings and a balcony with Acropolis views, while facilities include Smart TVs and two elegant bathrooms– everything you need for a most memorable experience.
neighborhood_overview:
With an enviable location near Syntagma square, in the midst of the historic neighborhood of Plaka, the flat sits in the most central and vibrant area of Athens, just minutes away from all the major city landmarks. There is much history, art and an unlimited choice of cafes, restaurants, shopping and nightlife in and around this neighborhood.
The emblematic Acropolis and the iconic Odeon of Herodes Atticus that has been staging musical and theatrical performances for two full millennia, are at 1 km.
The National Garden of Athens – a great place to walk, run or just enjoy your coffee and drink amid luscious trees and flowers – is just 450 meters away and Zappeion, a Neoclassical masterpiece that hosts all sorts of exhibitions and events at 900 meters.
The posh Kolonaki area with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is less than 1,5 Km from your doorstep.

Whether you're here for business or leisure, we're always available to provide assistance to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

neighborhood_overview:
Psiri is a vibrant neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. Once a working-class area, it has transformed into a trendy and lively district that attracts a diverse crowd of locals and tourists alike. The streets of Psiri are lined with colorful graffiti murals, trendy cafes, and tavernas serving traditional Greek food. The area is particularly well-known for its nightlife, with numerous bars and clubs staying open late into the night. Psiri's central location makes it an ideal base for exploring Athens. It's just a short walk from popular tourist sites like the Acropolis, the Ancient Agora, and the Plaka neighborhood, as well as the city's main shopping and business districts.

Overall, Psiri is a bustling, eclectic neighborhood with a unique charm that visitors to Athens won't want to miss.
