name: Central comfortable apartment
description:
Central, comfortable, newly renovated apartment, 6 minutes/450 meters from Metro station Panormou, in the vivid area of Ambelokipi, a safe and full of life district, just minutes away from the heart of town.
"Centro" is fully furnished, with one bedroom with a queen-sized bed, a spacious and cozy living room with a comfy sofa-bed, a dining table/working station, a brand new bathroom, a fully-equipped kitchen, wi-fi/smart TV and Netflix.
The apartment can accommodate comfortably up to 3 persons.
neighborhood_overview:
“Ambelokipi” means vineyards. Not that you will see today any in the area, as Ambelokipi is now part of the Athens downtown area, just a few metro stations away from most of the major archaeological sites of the city - Syntagma, Plaka, Monastiraki, Acropolis and Thiseio.
The area is packed with life - cinemas, theatres, bars, cafes, restaurants and many places of interest.
Panormou, a vivid, lively, 24/7 awake street, and the metro station with the same name, are a 450 meters-6 minutes walk from the apartment. You can find there all kinds of Greek and ethnic food, tavernas, traditional ouzo meze, souvlaki, home cooked food places, music bars, coffee shops and take away food corners.
Should you have fully explored everything there, Mavili square is also a few minutes further away, a triangle square siding Kifisias Avenue. Briki, a tiny local bar is especially loved by locals, along with Kyrios bar. The square has cosmopolitan vibes and many more bars and food places ope

name: Art Pantheon Deluxe Suite • Acropolis area
description: A remarkable Suite in a historic building at the famous neighborhood of Plaka, in the heart of Athens. Located in probably the best location in the city, you are minutes walk away from the mighty Acropolis and all the major sites. The building was also renovated by Queen Frederica of Greece herself. Experience the best Athens has to offer in terms of its heritage and great hospitality. Art Pantheon is decorated by renowned photographer Papadimitriou with some of his most prominent work.
neighborhood_overview: You are located in perhaps the best spot in the city - no seriously! It is nestled in the old, timeless quarter of Plaka, a few paces from the Acropolis Museum and the grand Dionysiou Areopagitou promenade which leads past the (still function) ancient theatre of Herodion Atticus, up to the Acropolis itself. A few minutes walk to the east are the splendid Temple of Zeus and Hadrians Arch, with the beautiful Olympic Stadium in the near distance. There are also some great shopping, eating and entertainment opportunities in the neighborhood, from ultra exclusive to no-frills, you will find what you are looking for!
host_about:
Hello there! We are Roula and Andreas, mother and son who envisioned Art Pantheon, a 19th century neoclassical Townhouse which combines vintage with modern décor and offers high hotel-class accommodation and services for our unique guests. We do our best to ensure you have a delightful, exciting and trouble free accommodation when visiting Athens and we look forward to making wonderful new friendships with people around the globe! 
A few words about us: Roula is passionate about design, decoration and style and Andreas is a sports teacher turned hotelier. 
Check our own website as well for more information. Happy travels :)

neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. It’s in the graffitied backstreets and café-lined squares, the factories converted into galleries, bars hidden in arcades, and secret co

description: Once in a while you are lucky enough to discover a kind of space that's in the heart of Athens yet feels like a world away. This serene penthouse, located on Ermou street was made to entertain. Designed to comfortably host 4 people it features majestic views of the Acropolis while being just 5 min away from Athens's major attractions. Imagine drinking a glass of wine overlooking the Acropolis hill in front of your firepit. You have arrived...
neighborhood_overview:
Ermou is a vibrant neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. It is known for its lively atmosphere, charming streets, and great shopping opportunities. The area is filled with a mix of local shops, trendy boutiques, and popular international brands, making it a popular destination for both locals and tourists.

The main street in Ermou is a pedestrian zone, lined with a variety of shops, cafes, and restaurants. Here, visitors can find everything from high-end fashion to traditional Greek souvenirs. The area is also home to several historical landmarks, including the Church of Panaghia Kapnikarea, which dates back to the 11th century.

The neighborhood is easily accessible by public transportation, with several metro stations and bus stops nearby. It is also within walking distance of several other popular tourist attractions, including the Acropolis, Monastiraki Square, and Syntagma Square.

name: Zeus - Luxenia Suites
description: Located on a quiet street in one of the oldest areas of Athens - Plaka, with the famous Zappeion and the Temple of Zeus at the door, the Luxenia Suites® suites provide the perfect getaway for all those looking for a luxurious and worry-free stay!
neighborhood_overview: Plaka is a district in the center of Athens below the Acropolis. It borders to the south with the district of Makrigianni, to the east with the area of the Temple of Olympian Zeus and Zappeion, to the north with the commercial center of Athens and to the west with Monastiraki. It has been characterized as a traditional settlement. Plaka is one of the few districts of the city -if not the only one- which has been continuously inhabited since antiquity and was, among other things, the center of Ancient Athens. The direct connection of the area with the glorious past of Ancient Athens, which becomes obvious to the visitor from the dozens of monuments scattered in it have made it known -and not unfairly- as the "Quarter of the Gods".

Your excellent stay is our commitment.

Hope to host you soon!

description: Stay in the heart of Athens in this recently renovated, stylish one-bedroom apartment in Kolonaki. Just 3 minutes from the Evangelismos metro station, this suite offers a panoramic city view, modern decor, and a private balcony. neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki is one of Athens' most upscale and vibrant neighborhoods, offering a mix of history, culture, fashion, and a lively social scene. If you're a tourist visiting this area, here are some must-see places and activities to enjoy:

1. Museums & Cultural Attractions:
- Benaki Museum: A short walk from Kolonaki, this museum offers a stunning collection of Greek art and artifacts, ranging from antiquity to modern times. The exhibits showcase everything from Byzantine icons to contemporary art.
- Museum of Cycladic Art: Dedicated to ancient Aegean cultures, this museum displays remarkable Cycladic marble figurines, pottery, and more. It’s a must-visit for those interested in ancient history and art.
- Byzantine and Christian Museum: Located nearby, this museum features religious art from the Byzantine era, including mosaics, icons, and manuscripts. It offers a deep dive into Greece’s Christian heritage.

name: Calm underground studio with private terrace
description: Welcome to our lovely underground studio apartment in Athens! With brand new appliances, a queen size bed, and its own private terrace, it provides a wonderful setting to unwind and enjoy yourself. It is located near a park, in a typical Athenian neighbourhood, close to the city centre! With only 5 min walk from the bleu metro line, which connects the airport to the harbor, it is the ideal starting point to explore the entire metropolitan area.
neighborhood_overview: Our own neighbourhood, Ilisia, located near the city center, is a classic densely populated working-class Athenean district. It is named after the Ilissos river, which rises near Kaisariani on the slopes of Mount Hymettus, and which, although Athens' historic river, is barely noticeable except in heavy rain! Ilissia also has the "Ilision" pine park, which is only 1 minute walk from the apartment, and lush "Brazil" and "Madrid" squares with plenty of greenery. Several bus and tram lines, as well as the "Megaro Moussikis" metro station, serve the area!

neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood
Metaxourgeio is a quiet multicultural neighbourhood downtown. It is surrounded by hotels, restaurants, cafes and many cultural points of interest such as the Agios Konstantinos Church, The National Theatre, The National Archeological Museum, The Omonoia Square, Athinas Commercial street , Kerameikos tombs, Thission ans Psiri Areas and finally Acropolis Area one of the most impressive cultural heritage sites worldwide.

After a long period of abandonment in the late 20th century, the area is acquiring a reputation as an artistic and fashionable neighbourhood due to the opening of many art galleries, museums, and trendy restaurants and cafes.
The heart of the neighbourhood is Avdi Square, which draws residents and visitors with its open space, greenery, periodic festivals and gatherings, and adjacent restaurants, theatres and art galleries.

Plato's Academy studio is located at Metaxourgeio, a typical downtown Athens neighborhood, very close to the Historical center of Athens and to Plato's Academy (one of the most famous philosophical schools of ancient Athens) , which it was named after.
It is an ideal place for business people or city travellers as it is situated close to sites worth visiting, such as museums (the National Archaeological Museum, the Museum of the Greek Children's Art e.t.c.) , archaeological sites (the Akropolis, the Erehtheio, the Ifaistos' temple, Plato's Academy, the Ancient Market ), central squares (Omonoia, Syntagma, Monastiraki), cultural centers, theaters and several other places , ideal for a stroll, shopping, a meal, or some entertainment (such as Ermou Str. , Gazi-Technopolis, Plaka).
The nearest metro station is the Metaxourgeio station (redline) but our place is also located near many bus and trolley stations that can provide you with access to just about everywhere within

name: Gaia |Deluxe Room with balcony | Historical Center
description: Where the comforts of home meet the local stylish influences of the central Psirri neighborhood - GAIA offers a stay like no other for travelers looking to experience real Greece, and live the local way! With our newly renovated rooms, guests are invited to immerse themselves in Athens’ culture with all necessary amenities at their disposal. Take in the electrifying Psirri atmosphere from your balcony and enjoy a relaxing evening in your spacious Deluxe Double Room.
neighborhood_overview:
In a central area of Athens, Gaia Rooms & Apartments is 300 m from Ermou Street-Shopping Area. Popular points of interest nearby include Monastiraki Flea Market and Monastiraki Square. Free WiFi is available and Ancient Agora of Athens is 400 m away.
Roman Agora is 601 m from Gaia Rooms & Apartments. The nearest airport is Elefthérios Venizélos Airport, 12 mi from the accommodations.
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
The area:

Welcome to Athens, the vibrant capital city of Greece located in the region of Attica. Athens is a city steeped in rich history and culture, offering a myriad of attractions and experiences to visitors from around the world. Known as the birthplace of democracy and the cradle of Western civilization, this ancient city is a treasure trove of archaeological wonders, magnificent landmarks, and a lively contemporary scene.

One of the highlights of Athens is its extensive public transportation system, which allows visitors to explore the city and its surrounding areas with ease. The Athens Metro is the fastest and most convenient mode of transportation, consisting of three lines that connect to tram lines, bus routes, and the suburban railway. The metro operates from 5 am to midnight, with extended hours on weekends, ensuring easy access to key areas and attractions. Line 1, also known as ISAP, is an overground train that connects the northern suburb of Kifis

host_about:
Kalimera (=Good Morning)! I am Alexandros, an ex-financier who turned into an entrepreneur.

I grew up in Athens, Greece, an awesome and vibrant city, where I studied Civil Engineering at NTUA. I was always keen on music, a passion which I flipped into DJing, yeap!!! Following my graduation I wanted to see the world and study abroad, so I attended Columbia University in NYC for my second Masters degree. The 2008 crash sent me directly to Germany where I started my career in banking.

After some years in corporate environments I decided to follow my real love, which is creating things from scratch, so I quit my job and alongside with my brother, George, we began a hospitality start-up.

We provide unique furnished apartments by offering personalized services!

It is so awesome to be an explorer and we believe that if you do not travel is like reading only the cover of the book. Hence,  t-r-a-v-e-l  :)

We hope to enjoy your staying with us!!!!

Keep it real,
Alexandros.

name: Gorgeous penthouse at ABIRA's
description:
Abira's Athens, located at the vibrant Neapoli neighborhood - right between Kolonaki and Exarchia - offers brand new and fully equipped serviced apartments leaving you worry-free to explore every corner of the city’s sites.

The central location is ideal for discovering Athens, while enjoying quiet and peaceful moments in a highly functional apartment designed for comfortable and pleasant visits.
neighborhood_overview:
Come and discover the hip neighborhoods of Exarchia and Kolonaki!
Exarchia is known to be the artsy neighborhood of Athens - many artists live and work here and this gives a good vibe to the area. Kolonaki, on the other hand, is an upscale and stylish neighborhood ideal for shopping and fine dining. There are countless cozy bars and restaurants in the surrounding streets while the central location of theses areas makes them the most convenient places to discover true Athens!

The neighborhoods of Kolonaki and Exarchia are ideal for those who want to really experience Athens like a local, being away from heavily crowded touristic areas but still in the city center. Well-suited for couples and friends who want to explore the diverse center of the city, as well as students attending seminars or professionals on business trips.

Within 250 meters (3 minutes walk) from Ariba's you can find supermarkets, laundromats and ATMs.
host_about: Me (Zack) and Tanya live in Athens with our 5 yr old son. We love traveling and vacationing within Greece and abroad - we lived in the US and UK in the past. On weekends, you will find us at our summer home at lovely Lavrio.

name: Newly Renovated Studio in Kolonaki Athens
description: Newly renovated, nicely decorated studio-apartment situated within an apartment building with up to date appliances at Kolonaki-Deksameni. It is close to Evagelismos & Syntagma metro stations, Plaka, Acropolis. A great location for business or pleasure.
neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki
Kolonaki-Dexameni is an area away from the noise but conveniently located close to museums, high-end boutiques and the mainstream night life of Athens.
Kolonaki is a wealthy and up market district. As one of the capital's leading shopping areas, it includes a number of high-end boutiques from young adult to casual fashion to prestigious haute couture from Greek and international designers. One of its main shopping streets, Voukourestiou Street, is now known for its jewellery.

Lycabettus hill
The hill is a tourist destination and can be ascended by the Lycabettus Funicular, a funicular railway which climbs the hill from a lower terminus at Kolonaki (The railway station can be found at Aristippou st.). Up in the hill there are the 19th century Chapel of St. George, a theatre, and a restaurant.

Close By
•Museums and galleries also abound in Kolonaki. The Benaki Museum, inside a preserved neoclassical manor house, and the Goulandris Museum

Hello,

After years of travelling myself, from San Francisco to Lombok and from Ushuaia to Heimaey, I decided I wanted to host people myself.

Theo

name: Andreas Studio
description: Sunny and comfortable apartment on 3rd floor in the center of Exarcheia, a colorful and lively neighborhood of Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
Exarcheia is one of the most exciting areas of Athens. Very lively and multicultural, the neighborhood offers you an active day and an intense night.
There are many kiosks int Exarcheia square and a pharmacy is just at the corner.
About ten minutes walk to the Archaeological Museum, ten minutes to Omonia Metro station, about fifteen minutes to Panepistimio and twenty minutes to Syntagma.
There are plenty of cafes, bars, live music stages, traditional and modern taverns and restaurants. Many traditional groceries, bakeries, small book stores, printing houses and some traditional music instrument makers.
You can also experience a live exhibition of graffiti by walking in the streets of Exarcheia.

name: 3-Storey Family Home, City View & Private Parking!
description: Welcome to our 3-story palace in the heart of Athens! Our 120m2 abode boasts large balconies on each floor with breathtaking views of the city, including the iconic Lycabettus hill. You'll have your very own private parking spot. Cozy up by the fireplace in the spacious living room or whip up a delicious meal in our fully equipped kitchen, complete with all the bells and whistles like a dishwasher, microwave, & kettle. Perfect for groups, families, or medical tourism with many hospitals nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Our lovely home is situated in one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in the city, providing the perfect combination of a peaceful and quiet setting while still being in close proximity to all the excitement that Athens has to offer.

Athens is a city steeped in history, and there are numerous historical sites and landmarks to explore. The most famous of these is the Acropolis, which is a must-visit for anyone interested in ancient history. The Acropolis is a UNESCO World Heritage site and is home to the famous Parthenon, as well as several other ancient temples and structures.

In addition to the historical sites, Athens is also known for its vibrant nightlife, delicious food and friendly locals. You can experience the city's vibrant culture by visiting one of the many tavernas and cafes in the area, where you can sample local cuisine and interact with the locals.

For those looking for a more active adventure, there are numerous parks and green space
host_about: Ahoy there, traveler! Allow us to introduce ourselves - we are The Homis, Homer and Isabella, a fun-loving duo ready to show you the time of your life in Athens and beyond! We're the masterminds behind several top-notch listings in our stunning city and on some lush islands, and we're here to make sure your adventure is nothing short of epic. Whether you need insider tips on hidden gems or a little extra pampering, just give us a holler. We're all about going the extra mile to give you an unforgettable stay. So, what are you waiting for? Let's make some memories together! - The Homis

description: ***please before you book, ask us for special prices/offers*Ideally located in the heart and soul of Athens city center and especially in the heart of "neighborhood of the Gods" as it was well known in the past! It has a queen size bed (160*200cm), is full furnished and equipped in order to offer you a full-pleasant stay!3rd floor apt,  a/c, free 50mbps wifi, smart TV&netflix, and nice views from the cute balcony. What else someone needs in order to have a full pleasant vacation?
neighborhood_overview: When someone walks around Plaka, feels like being in a fairytale! plaka is one of the most attractive districts of Athens. Under the slopes of the Acropolis Plaka attracts all the visitors of Athens with its neoclassical mansions and houses with roofs from red tiles, its small winding roads with their steps, balconies with bougainvilleas ,geraniums and jasmines. Plaka is called many times in the Greek literature as the neighbourhood of the Gods and that because over Plaka dominates the sacred rock of the Acropolis "the sacred rock of the gods"  who made the modern Athenians with the same humour like their Ancient ancestors, to  personalise the Olympian gods having fun like them in Plaka with lots of Retsina wine and Dance. Sometimes being romantic on a sunny day you feel  that  the Greek goddess Athena  looks down to Plaka with a smile in her divine face as the modern Athenians enjoy the sunshine in the street cafes at Adrianou street overlooking Thission the Ancient Agora and the rock
host_about: We are from Athens-Greece. we love traveling, meeting new people, making friends and discover new way of thinking and behaviour. We became parents some years ago,  and for this reason, we aren't able to travel (easily) as much as we used to... So being a host make us "feel" like traveling...! Our motto is “We travel not to escape life, but life not to escape us “ ! And when you decide to travel, we feel honored to be a part of your experience!

name: Spacious with big Patio | Next to Acropolis
description: Experience Athens' vibrant culture from this stylish and spacious apartment in a trendy neighborhood. Perfect for families with its huge sofa and cozy beds. Stay connected with reliable WiFi, work from the designated workspace, or enjoy the sun on the patio. The apartment is a short walk to historic landmarks, stocked with toys and games for kids. Make unforgettable memories exploring the city on foot and enjoy meals at the formal dining table. Discover Athens from your home away from home!
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is in the neighborhood of Thission, between the historical center of Athens and the lively nightlife neighborhood of Keramikos-Gazi. The area balances being an urban neighborhood and an old Athenian one. The ancient Agora and the edge of historical center is minutes away, from where on you can start visiting all important landmarks on foot. The Acropolis, the Parthenon, the Acropolis museum and the scenic neighborhood of Plaka are all withing walking distance.

The Pedestrianisation of the historical centre that is surrounded from the triangle between Plaka, Dionysiou Areopagitou street and Keramikos includes almost all the magnificent sights of Athens. Thissio area is a great option in order to take a tour in the historical centre and wander up to the Acropolis hill. If you follow Dimofontos str. you will find one of the main streets of Thissio.

Athens' Landmarks:
-The renowned Benaki Museum, with its outstanding collections. (900m)
-Nati
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

name: Gazi Apartment
description: Lovly appartment  80m² on a pedestrian street, in Gazi
neighborhood_overview:
My flat is very well situated in a safe area. It’s a third floor flat in a quiet pedestrian lane, just a five minute walk away from a busy, vibrant area that is close to the old city gas works.
The gas works have been converted into a museum/cultural center and there is a great night life with many restaurants, coffee shops, bars and theatres and so much to see and do just meters away from home.
The Acropolis museum is a half an hour walk away from home or alternatively a ten minute trip using the metro line that goes to the airport. You change lines in Syntagma and take the line towards Elleniko, getting off at the Acropolis stop. Monastiraki, Syntagma and Thissio are also within walking distance.
The Ancient Agora, Marble staduim, Athens national gardens, Theater of Herodeon, , National arceological museum, Benaki museum,
Myseum of Cylathic art, Folk art museum and Mount Lykavittos are all very close.
host_about: Photography is my passion. I enjoy travelling and experiencing new places, cultures and local cuisine. I love introducing people to Greece and sharing my knowledge and love of my country with visitors.

name: Unique Acropolis view house
description:
Perhaps the last forgotten paradise in Athens, located on the Agios Ioannis hilltop , you will find the house of Giannis which is waiting to welcome you as our guests.
The house is situated very close to the following metro stations Neos Kosmos (5minutes walkdistance but steep hill unfortunately) , Agios Ioannis metro and Tram(10 min walkdistance ) a little bit of a climb towards the top of hill but well worth the stunning view you will encounter upon arrival which will take your breath away.
neighborhood_overview:
The surrounding area is reminiscent of an old 1960s Athens neighborhood , gravel pavements, dirt paths , ceramic plant pots overflowing with greenery and grandmothers sitting in the streets, all coming together to create a magical ambience.

The tranquility and panoramic view (from Perama to the Northern suburbs), the distant sounds of the city in combination with a light breeze and unique view of the Acropolis are the ideal way to begin or end your day of exploring magical Athens.

Relish the spectacular views and vitality of this house which will leave you with an unforgettable experience.

Welcome to our stunning apartment in the heart of Athens, located in the vibrant neighborhood of Thissio. This exceptional residence offers a breathtaking view of the magnificent Acropolis, ensuring an unforgettable stay.

name: Industrial semi-basement studio in Athens
description:
Welcome to our brand new, calm, semi-basement studio in Athens!
With a spacious kitchen and a queen size bed, it provides a wonderful setting for unwinding and enjoy yourself!
It is located in the boarders of a classic Athenian neighbourhood, Gyzi, only 19-min walk from Ampelokipi station of blue metro line (M3), next to the "Paidion tou Areos" park and near Lycabettus Hill.
Also check its neighbor 1-dedroom apartment accomendating 4 guests, located next to it: https://nocarz[dot]com/h/kalliga2
neighborhood_overview:
The area of Gyzi is a typical Athenian residential area. It is located in the center of Athens while at the same time maintaining the elements of the neighborhood and this is the main contrast that characterizes it. It is one of the areas that when you walk through its streets you look up. Not so much because apartment buildings have some special beauty, but because there is "life" there. Behind the colored awnings, in the conversations that can be heard from the open windows, in the spread clothes that add extra color to the balconies. It has several squares and gathering places that gives it vitality.

It is close to the Athens University of Economics and Business and is bordered by Pedion Areos, which is the largest public park in Athens with the Alsos theatre within. The Pedion tou Areos, meaning Field of Ares, was designed in 1934 and its purpose was to honor the heroes of the Greek Revolution of 1821, 21 of whom are depicted in marble busts standing in the park. name: No18-5 Theo Homeybee Exarcheia
description:
Welcome Homey!

Modern and spacious 7th-floor private room in 10 rooms apartment in Exarchia, one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for individual travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion Areos Park are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

name: No5 Theo Homeybee Nea Kipseli
description:
Hello Homey!

Delightful small penthouse with a big terrace offering a great view of the athenian landscape, located in the beautiful neighbourhood of Kypseli, close to the center of Athens. Ideal for loving couples, the apartment is close to public transport (buses and trolleybuses) with easy access to the historic center of Athens and a variety of must-see places and exquisite cultural monuments.
neighborhood_overview:
The most charming and colorful neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
“Kypseli” in Greek means hive, and the reasons behind its naming can be easily justified through a short walk along its colorful and charming streets, populated by people from countries and nationalities all around the world. Multicultural and boheme in its own special way, Kypseli is a lovely area to explore, with a variety of cafés, restaurants and cultural meeting points. Pedion Areos Park near the apartment and Fokionos Negri’s pedestrian road are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!

Enjoy the lush Athenian lifestyle in the heart of the city's coolest area.

His apartment is located in a pre-war building completely renovated in 2023 on a quiet street in the iconic Exarchia area. Still circumventing the main tourist city map, this area claims one of the most important parts of Athens' modern history and culture. The humble neighborhood of the mid-19th century evolved into an area favored by the new emerging middle class of the time and, for more than 150 years, has been the melting pot of cultural, artistic and political ideas, with an innovative urban lifestyle. neighborhood_overview: Millennial Athens is perfectly situated in the center of Athens, within walking distance from Kolonaki district (600 m) that features some of the best bars, restaurants, and shops in the city, Exarcheia (500 m) - an area of a particular aesthetic and home to prominent artists and writers, Syntagma (1000 m) - where the Parliament and the National Gardens are located, and Monastiraki/Plaka (1000 m) - best known for the Ancient Agora and the antiquities in the surrounding area. The city’s shopping districts, including Kolonaki, Stadiou st, Ermou st, are also within 10-15’ walking distance. The two closest metro stations (Panepistimio and Omonoia) are a short 5’ walk on opposite sides. Acropolis is just 2 metro stops away. As we are locals, we can always assist you with recommendations if needed - just ask us!

neighborhood_overview: Psirri is one of Athens' most vibrant and eclectic neighborhoods, offering a delightful blend of old-world charm and modern energy. Located just a stone's throw from the Acropolis, this lively area is renowned for its colorful street art, trendy bars, cozy cafes, and an array of unique shops. name: No12 Theo Homeybee Exarcheia
description:
Welcome Homey!

Fully equipped and convenient five bedroom 4th-floor apartment in Exarchia (hosts 5 people), one of the most prominent urban neighbourhoods in the heart of Athens. Being close to public transport stations (metro, bus, railway), yet in walking-distance from a variety of historic landmarks and must-see places in the city, it offers an ideal accommodation for families, loving couples and traveling groups.
neighborhood_overview:
The Neighbourhood: A truly boheme neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
Historic urban neighbourhood, one of the last authentic and unspoiled in Europe. Famous for its artistic essence and boheme aura, it is mostly inhabited and frequented by artists, musicians, writers, actors and creative minds. Low-paced daily routine, yet with plenty of nightlife choices, the neighbourhood will make you fall in love with the youthful urban lifestyle, from relaxing cafeterias and lively art spaces to alternative bars and picturesque restaurants. Pedion A(hidden) Park and Lycabettus Hill are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

Koukaki is a great mix in that it is a traditional Greek neighborhood but just steps away from the tourist and historical sites. One of the best bakeries in Athens is just a 3 minute walk from the apartment (Takis Bakery at 14 Misaraliotou st.).

Other restaurants/bars within walking distance to check out include: --Σκουμπρί (Skoubri) Fish Taverna at Drakou 12: 1 minute walk
--Ρίζα Ρίζα (Riza Riza) Bar at Drakou 19: 1 minute walk
--Brettos in Plaka at Kidathineon 41 (this is the second oldest distillery in Europe and a cool stop with its colorful bottles as a backdrop): 8 minute walk --the Wine Point at Porinou 2 in Acropolis: 7 minute walk
-- Georgiou olimpiou square has many restaurants and bars 2 min walk from the apartment

A nice first full day from the apartment might be: •Go to Takis Bakery (except Sunday, they are closed) to get something for breakfast, go across the street to Coffee Dive for your coffee and then take a leisurely walk up

description: Τhis fully renovated one-bedroom studio apartment in Eos Residence sits in a quiet residential area within walking distance to the hill of Filopappou and the Acropolis, as well as most landmarks and attractions. neighborhood_overview:
Close to Thiseio and the Acropolis but safely removed from their tourist traps, Petralona blends old-school charm, artistic vibes and boho haunts. Like many parts of the downtown, this too, seems kind of disorganized and chaotic, with a haphazard mix of different architectural styles and lots of graffiti. But then again this is where its allure lays – in true Athenian style. Amid the whole scruffy setting there are alternative-chic joints – from traditional taverns with a twist, to experimental places featuring theater and gigs, Thai and French restaurants and trend-setting bars.

Launched by a swarm of young creatives who’ve recently relocated in the area, these eye-catching spots are responsible for the area’s renaissance - Petralona is often dubbed the “New Gazi”. It still retains though a distinctly local character and feel, without being over-commercialized or pretentious like its fabled neighbor. Petralona is also conveniently positioned for exploring the city on foot

name: Agora | Plaka and Acropolis area
description:
Embrace Athens in our elegant 80 sqm apartment, just steps away from the Acropolis, in the heart of old town Plaka.
Ideal for a family, this ground-level haven blends historical elegance with modern comforts. From its traditional wooden floors and stylish mosaic hallway to the fully-equipped kitchen and air-conditioned rooms, every detail ensures a stay of unparalleled comfort.
Explore ancient wonders, dine in vibrant cafes, and immerse in the city's culture—all from your doorstep.
host_about:
Kalimera, I’m Alex, and welcome to Athens! At Gaia, we encourage our guests to enjoy what the real Greece has to offer and we want to show you that the local way is the only way!

Being Greek, family and hospitality is deeply rooted within our culture, and is at the heart of everything we do here at Gaia. We want our guests to feel right at home in our wonderful city, and however long your stay, we promise to make it a truly enjoyable authentic Greek experience; come and discover what it means to live the local way!

Guests’ safety and comfort is at the top of our list, and we strive to make sure your stay at Gaia meets all your needs as a home from home - we are proud this summer to offer our guests newly renovated rooms, with optimum comfort in mind. I learnt from a young age the value of hospitality and I understand how important it is to feel at home, more than ever when you are away. Growing up with and working in hospitality, I was inspired by my love of meeting new people, making connections, and most of all, helping these people get the most out of their experiences - so much so, that I have formed a career around the business of making this happen! We want to make sure guests don’t just have a place to stay, but gain as much as they can from their visit to Athens! People come from all parts of the world to visit our amazing city as their chosen holiday destination - it’s my job (and my pleasure!) to help make their experience the best it can possibly be!

Athens to me is home; the people, the kindness shown within the community and to strangers alike - we have an amazing atmosphere here, and it’s one you won’t find anywhere else in the world. Here in Athens we like to have fun, we delight in the old and embrace the new - which you’ll see wherever you walk within the city - the beautiful meeting of Modern and Ancient Greece. A city that has it all, everything for everyone - and so much more than a visit to the Acropolis! I want to share this special connection I have with the city with others, and encourage visitors, both Greek and international, to explore the place I’m proud to call home. Let me show you my Athens! 

Psirri in particular, is the buzzing neighbourhood where you’ll find us (along with the best hangouts and eateries in Athens!) - the Gaia family is proud to be part of a community that represents the very soul of the city. Experience real Greece here; eat what the locals do, drink with us, explore our streets you haven’t read about yet, take a walk through our history, modern and ancient - and live the local way!

Since my family and I began constructing Gaia in 2016, we have worked hard to expand, and are now able to offer more options for our guests seeking independent accommodation within the heart of the city. With our guests’ needs in mind, we’re now managing premium apartments, in the perfect location, which capture the authenticity and spirit of Psyri; you’ll be able to experience the real Athens like a local, with all the amenities you need to feel at home.
 
Gaia was created by family for family - since we started out as a small hotel with only a few rooms open, people have loved staying with us because of our incredible culture of going above and beyond when it comes to hospitality - my family has always lived by this principle, and we welcome all of our guests as we do our own family - we’ll make sure you won’t leave Athens without a full stomach, a story to tell and a promise to come back and visit! We look forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Athens Luxury Apartments - Rodos.
description: Stay in the heart of Athens, just steps above Megaro Mousikis Metro Station. This spacious apartment offers a large balcony, queen bed, and fast Wi-Fi—perfect for couples or business travelers. Enjoy easy access to the city’s highlights and relax in comfort with a fully equipped kitchen and serene ambiance. Ideal for exploring or working in style!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in one of the most central districts of Athens, just across the Athens Concert Hall (Megaro Moussikis). There are many coffee shops, luxurious restaurants - especially in the area around Hilton Hotel - and dry cleaners. Close to the apartment, you can find the prominent museums of Athens, such as the Acropolis Museum, the Byzantine Museum, the Benaki Museum, the National Museum of Contemporary Art, the War Museum, and the Museum of Cycladic Art. In the broader area of the neighbourhood, you can find the primary hospitals of Athens: ‘Ippokrateio’ General Hospital, ‘Evgenidio’ Hospital, ‘Aiginitio’ University Hospital, ‘Bioiatriki’, ‘Laiko’ General Hospital, ‘Alexandra’ General Hospital, ‘Aretaieio’ Hospital, General Children’s Hospital, 417 General Military Hospital ‘NIMTS’, etc.
Also, access to the most famous Athens’ districts, such as Kolonaki, Ermou Street, Omonoia Square, Plaka, Thissio, Monastiraki, etc. is straightforward.
host_about:
Γεννήθηκα στα Χανιά στην Κρήτη, η καταγωγή μου είναι το Ρέθυμνο αλλά μόνιμη κατοικία έχω στην Αθήνα.

Έχω τελειώσει ΤΕΙ Διοίκηση επιχειρήσεων με μεταπτυχιακό στο Marketing ( Πανεπιστήμιο Μακεδονίας ) , εργάζομαι στον Τουρισμό απο το 1988 ενώ τα τελευταία χρόνια παράλληλα έχω ιδρύσει και μια εταιρεία Facilities Management με κύρια ασχολία τον Επαγγελματικό καθαρισμό σε Ξενοδοχειακά κτίρια και μεγάλες επιχειρήσεις !

Μου αρέσουν πολύ τα ταξίδια και ο Αθλητισμός ενώ αγαπάω πάρα πολύ την Κρήτη και την Ρόδο.

host_about:
Ελληνικά:

Γεια σας! Είμαι ο Ιωάννης. Είμαι 29 χρονών και ζω στους πρόποδες της Πάρνηθας.  Μου αρέσει να βγαίνω έξω με τους φίλους μου, είτε για clubbing ή απλά για χαλάρωση με ένα ωραίο ζεστό φλιτζάνι καφέ. Εδώ και λίγα χρόνια εργάζομαι ως διοργανωτής εκδηλώσεων σε ένα νυχτερινό μαγαζί. Είμαι πολύ επικοινωνιακός  και ευγενικός όπως λένε οι φίλοι μου! Ελπίζω πραγματικά να κάνω τη διαμονή σας στην Αθήνα αξέχαστη. 

English:

Hi! I am Ioannis. I am 29 years old and  I live in a suburb of Athens at the foot  of mountain Parnitha.  I love going out with my friends either going clubbing or just chilling with a nice hot cup of coffee. I am currently working as an event manager for a night club. I am communicative and well-mannered as my friends say!! I really hope to make your stay in Athens unforgettable .

name: Spacious & Airy Votanikos Apt.- 500m to metro st.
description:
Spacious apartment for groups & families very close to the vibrant, artistic area of Gazi. This lively neighbourhood offers a wide selection of cafes, bars, clubs & trendy restaurants.

7 min walk to Keramikos station at the Blue metro line connecting International Athens airport to the center of Athens and 20 min walk to the Ancient Agora of Athens in Thissio.

Recommended for those who want to enjoy everything Athens has to offer (culture & entertainment).
neighborhood_overview:
You can experience a classic Athenian neighbourhood. The house is across the Garden of the Agricultural University of Athens and a playground is at 2 minutes walk (170m).

While you are very near to the vibrant area of Gazi, where many clubs, restaurants and cafes exist, the location of the house is at the "quiet" side of the neighbourhood.

You can find a bakery/espresso bar across the street and super-markets in walking distance (350m - 600m).

Free parking is allowed in the nearby streets.

name: Fantastic 1BR Suite in the Heart of Athens
description: This incredible 1BR Suite has its own unique style where you will immerse yourself in an atmosphere of elegance and relaxation. Let yourself be carried away by the beauty of the atmosphere and the privileged location in this historic Mediterranean city with a delicious American Buffet Breakfast at The  Great Hotel.
neighborhood_overview:
The cutting-edge hotel enjoys a privileged and ideal location in the historic heart of the city, next to Athens City Hall, within walking distance of the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum, the ancient city of Plaka and most of the attractions and sights of Athens.

Let yourself be seduced and let your curiosity lead you to important moments in history in this ancient place, such as:

The Acropolis: The Athenians always considered the Acropolis hill as a holly place. It has been inhabited since Mycenaean times, and increasingly majestic temples were built on it, ending with the great constructions pioneered by Pericles.

The Parthenon: The star of the Acropolis of Athens is undoubtedly the Parthenon. Despite having been sacked to the ground and being in a permanent state of rehabilitation, its imposing silhouette continues to dominate the Greek capital from the top.

Ancient Greece: Ancient Greece is considered the foundation of European culture.

name: Explore History from a Chic Central Apartment
description: This 80m2 contemporary sun-haven could not be closer to all historic attractions. Walk to the Acropolis in less than 15 min! Enjoy two large sunny balconies at this modern corner apartment with perfect locale! Explore fashionable local Koukaki neighborhood from a contemporary & comfortable nest. Queen bedroom with hardwood floors & renovated bathroom! 2nd bedroom great for families with two full sized beds. Air conditioning in all rooms! Best of all, Syggrou Fix metro is just 7 min by foot.
neighborhood_overview:
*See the city by walking! (Acropolis and Plaka within 10 min walk)
Koukaki is a top residential area in Athens because of its proximity to the Acropolis,
nightlife, neighborhood eateries, and bars. It is both casual and stimulating.
Bakeries, late night food options, pedestrian streets and museums are all close!
Koukaki sits at the foot of Filopapou Hill, a natural park in the middle of the city,
offering ample walking paths and memorable views. Take a walk where locals go to
walk their dogs and watch the sunset.
*Close to pharmacies, Bio shops, grocery stores, cáfes, & restaurants
*There is an amazing farmers market every friday in the area with local produce.
* Koukaki has been voted in the top5 best area's for nocarz.

name: Hadrians Den in Heart of Plaka by Jj Hospitality
description: A classic 2-bedroom Athenian apartment in the heart of Plaka. This property sleeps up to 5 people in comfort on the most famous street in Plaka, Adrianou St., very close to the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum, all the main ancient sites, and central Syntagma Square. Enjoy the historic decor, beautiful street views and large airy spaces, and enjoy your stay with JJ Hospitality.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the centre of Plaka on a popular pedestrian street, just feet away from some of the most famous sites in Plaka. For example the Acropolis museum is about 3 minutes walk away, and the entrance to the site itself is about 12 minutes walk. Aso nearby are the Temple of Zeus, Ancient Agora and Tower of the Winds. There are some lovely nearby restaurants (Daphne's is a classic choice) and bars (don't miss the famous Vrettos bar!). You can easily explore the nearby neighborhoods around Syntagma, Monastiraki, Kolonaki and Makrigianni - the house is in the between them all!
host_about:
Hello there! We are JJ Hospitality, a vacation rental company started by a couple of guys who are passionate about travelling in this beautiful country. We do our best to ensure you have a delightful, exciting and trouble free vacation when visiting Greece.
A few words about us: John C is an architect turned hotelier, and Ioannis (Greek name for John) is a finance guru who also has prior experience in the high-end tourism sector. Together we make JJ Hospitality, purveyors of exclusive holiday rentals! Check us out on jjhospitality.net for more info.
Happy travels:)

name: AthINN Residence #102 -Premium Suite King Size Bed
description:
In a unique historic building, 3 minutes from Monastiraki, this chic decorated eclectic residence, is the perfect place for your stay in the hub of Athens!
Strol through the intense and authentic character of the area, in Agias Irinis Square, in the heart of the Historic Center, in Plaka and enjoy the best that Athens has to offer!
With great experience in the field of hospitality, we invite you to enjoy our services, and live your dream vacations!
neighborhood_overview:
The historic building is located in the heart of Athens' historical centre, Monastiraki.

This eclectic residence is situated on a vibrant pedestrian alley. From here you can explore the most popular and historical neighborhoods of Athens: Plaka, Acropolis, Syntagma, Monastiraki, by walking around.

Just a few minutes from your doorstep you will also find the city’s largest commercial shopping avenue, Ermou street with fashion shops and shopping centers promoting most international brands.
It is in the top five most expensive shopping streets in Europe, and the tenth most expensive retail street in the world!

Plaka Athens: Following Ermou Street, the most famous shopping hub of Athens and going down south, you will arrive in the neighbourhood of Plaka. The area is found between Syntagma and Monastriraki and is easily accessed on foot from the centre of Athens.
Plaka is one of the oldest neighbourhoods of Athens, located right below the Acropolis

name: High End,Elegant-Chic flat-8´ to Historical Center
description: Luxurious, fully equipped apt at Petralona (“A tranquil beautiful hideout in the West of the city, great to lose yourself in and have conversations with locals, dine like a Greek for HOURS and have bohemian café meetups”). 1 stop away from Thissio metro station, where the heart of the historical center starts. A few min away from major touristic attractions and metro(6min). Super market, pharmacy, restaurants,cafés and bars are next to you. A guidebook and myself 24/7 will make your life easier!
neighborhood_overview:
The area of Petralona couldn’t have been described better than TRAVEL+LEISURE did in one of its articles…
”I followed ancient stone pathways to the western edge, clambered down a dirt trail, and emerged in Petralona, a neighborhood that felt like it was in an entirely different city. It had bougainvillea, jasmine, cats, funky 1960s apartment buildings. Everyone was on their terraces, on the street. I had that pleasant sensation, unique to urban travel, when you find your neighborhood, relax your shoulders, and think, I could live here. I sat down at a sidewalk café and asked for an ouzo. "No, we drink raki," the waiter said with a smile, "because we are from Crete." An icy pitcher arrived. The sharp, anise-flavored liqueur went down smoothly with what I had ordered: sausage marinated in vinegar, tomatoes sprinkled with oregano, olives, cheese.
Soon it was dark. I was pleasantly drunk, wandering again. Every restaurant was flung open, the interiors empty, the tables and chair

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is located north of the historical centre of Athens, between Kolonos to the east and Kerameikos to the west, and north of Gazi. Metaxourgeio is frequently described as a transition neighbourhood. After a long period of abandonment in the late 20th century, the area is acquiring a reputation as an artistic and fashionable neighbourhood due to the opening of many art galleries, museums, and trendy restaurants and cafes. Moreover, local efforts to beautify and invigorate the neighbourhood have reinforced a budding sense of community and artistic expression. Anonymous art pieces containing quotes and sayings in both English and Ancient Greek have begun springing up throughout the neighbourhood, containing statements such as "Art for art's sake" (Τεχνη τεχνης χαριν). Guerrilla gardening has also helped to beautify this area, taking advantage of the ample sunshine in Greece. The heart of the neighborhood is Avdi Square, which draws residents and visitors with its open space

neighborhood_overview:
Mets is without doubt one of Athens’ most picturesque neighborhoods! Situated less than 10min from Syntagma Square, is characterized by a balanced mix of neoclassical mansions, a touch of Bauhaus architecture and modern details.

*Within a short walking distance from the ancient Panathenaic Stadium, also known as Kallimarmaro, where the first modern Olympic Games were held. The views over the city and the Acropolis from the top benches are simply breathtaking. This will also give you the opportunity to explore the next-door park, where you can rest under the shades of trees for a quick break.

*Discover the quiet, yet upbeat district, taking a peaceful walk through the narrow streets, admiring the elegance of the old houses and discovering small glimpses of art around every corner, without missing the chance to enjoy a beverage or lunch at the various small cafes that have turned the neighborhood into a small European corner, with a view to the Acropolis.
host_about:
TopHouzzing’s story is simple yet exciting! We are Maria & Alex, the founders, both engineers. So we were already working together in the design & construction sector, so we  dealt with properties all the time. We are both into details, both love doing something right from scratch.

While we were traveling to new places and meeting old friends / making new ones, we felt what a rental should feel like, what it should offer guests like ourselves. Lots were missing, especially the simple little things that makes a visitor feel right at home -away from home. We then decided to start a rentals & real estate management company. It was July 2015 and we named it TopHouzzing Properties - the mission was simply to offer truly top accommodation to our guests. Starting then with a couple of our own properties, refurbished completely, we embarked on a great journey. 

Today the company manages close to 100 properties and growing steadily, mostly in Athens but also in mainland Greece and islands, flats, villas and so on. TopHouzzing  also offers consulting & real estate, design & construction and other professional services in its portfolio.

Hard work and our passion paid off. Our success is clearly stated not only in the many owners that trust us with their properties but even more in the hundreds 5-star reviews from guests from all over the world,  leading us to have a record of 14 consecutive quarters-since the company’s inception- SuperHost status on nocarz!

We take very good care of our guests and so do we with owners. You see, we both think as guests & owners ourselves. We are waiting anxiously to host you or to manage your property, in both cases you are in good hands with us.

neighborhood_overview:
Ilisia is a charming neighborhood located in the heart of Athens, Greece. It is situated just a few kilometres northeast of the city centre (15 minutes by bus), making it an attractive residential area for both locals and visitors. Here are some key features and points of interest about the neighborhood:

Green Spaces: Ilisia is known for its abundant green spaces, providing a refreshing escape from the bustling city. The most prominent park in the neighborhood is Alsos Ilision, a large park with trees, walking paths, and recreational facilities. It's a popular spot for locals to relax, exercise, and enjoy picnics.
Residential Area: Ilisia is primarily a residential neighborhood, characterized by its quiet streets, apartment buildings, and a mix of traditional and modern architecture. The area offers a peaceful and pleasant living environment while still being within easy reach of Athens' main attractions.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Neos Kosmos area.
Neos Kosmos literally translates into the New World. In modern history, it was inhabited by immigrants arriving from the Middle East who settled in the area and created their “New World”. Walking through the streets you can still see buildings, remnants of that era.
Its history though extends much further back in time though as it hosted one of the third largest gyms of ancient Athens. It was also crossed by the river Ilyssos which is referenced in multiple scriptures dating from the 5th century BC. In ancient times it was considered to be a sacred river, the home of the 7 Muses, and was a favorite visiting place for the ancient philosophers Socrates and Lysias.
Nowadays it is part of the heart of Athens, within walking distance from the old city of Athens, the Acropolis, Plaka and all Athens popular tourist attractions. The house is in the heart of the local market area which consists restaurants, bars, nightclubs, coffee s

neighborhood_overview:
Ampelokipoi/Panormou is a hip neighborhood, consisting of both residential and commercial properties. Thus, every morning, you can meet a plethora of different personalities, from college students and residents, to traders and young professionals.

Ampelokipoi, an old established neighborhood, in the first half of 1900’s used to have in its premises small vineyards, but this utterly changed with the industrialization of Greece. Now, it has been transformed to a vibrant area full of stylish bars, traditional cafes and restaurants.

Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka, Monastiraki flea market, as well as Syntagma square and all the upbeat Athens neighborhoods are in the immediate vicinity.

Upon arrival, we provide you with tailor-made recommendations. Enjoy “Athens by night” while being minutes from home ;)

Acropolis Stylish Living is intentionally designed in the safest area of Athens, which offers you the chance to explore Athens by foot.
neighborhood_overview: Acropolis Stylish Living is located in Koukaki, Athina, Greece. The residence is located at 24-26 Falirou Str. which is just a stone throw distance away from all the major historical sights. The Sygrou Fix metro station is 50 meters away and the Acropolis metro Station is 250 meters away and other public transportation stops are within 50 meters away. Acropolis historical monument is 500 meters away and The New Acropolis Museum is 250 meters away as well as the Herodion venue and ancient Theatre of Dionysus. Really close to the apartment you can find the Ancient Agora, Temple of Zeus and other historical and cultural monuments. All shops such as bakery, super market, grocery store, and variety of small tipical greek taverns and cosy cafes are in a walking distance. Within walking distance from the apartment are other major landmarks such as Syntagma square, Plaka area , Monastiraki market as well as the major city’s shopping hotspots.

Exploring Psirri, Athens: A Vibrant Neighborhood for Tourists

Psirri, located in the heart of Athens, is a lively and eclectic neighborhood known for its vibrant atmosphere, street art, and a mix of traditional and modern influences. Here’s a guide to help you make the most of your visit:

Overview
Psirri is a bustling area filled with narrow streets and alleys, lined with neoclassical buildings and adorned with colorful street art. It’s a popular destination for both locals and tourists, offering a unique blend of old-world charm and contemporary culture. The area comes alive in the evening, making it a perfect spot for nightlife enthusiasts.

1. Little Kook:

- Address: Karaiskaki 17, Psirri

ANO PETRALONA, featured in Monocle’s video "Athens Favourite Neighbourhoods" attracts travellers & professionals living the local culture. Ideally located for downtown convenience, only steps from Metro PETRALONA. Easy walk downtown & historic Athens; 7 min. to Filopappou Hill of Muses
neighborhood_overview:
ANO PETRALONA, recently featured in Monocle magazine’s video "Athens Favourite Neighbourhoods", is an excellent location for those who wish to live centrally, in a typically local neighborhood away from the tourist crowds.

The upcoming gentrification of historic hubs in central Athens (zone 1) particularly ANO PETRALONA, seemed the perfect location for seekers of a true urban experience. The area caters to locals, and lately we see an influx of young urbanites as well.

Despite elements of the occasional pothole and graffiti, ANO PETRALONA’s spirit of a bygone era with its traditional establishments and old-stone houses and pastel colors, is being revived by young creatives, global nomads, and travelers, who enjoy authentic culture. This is a friendly neighborhood, with all amenities nearby (supermarkets, organic store, hairdressers, dry-clean, baker, restaurants, etc.).

ANO Petralona is popular for its summer open-art cinema, unique tavernas and quaint

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is situated in the charming and traditional neighborhood of Ano Petralona, part of Athens' historic center. This area beautifully blends the nostalgic charm of old Athens with the vibrancy of modern urban life.

Within close proximity, you’ll find a wide variety of restaurants, cafes, shops, including supermarkets ,pharmacies, banks and an open-air cinema. The area is a favorite among locals for its excellent dining options, offering many delightful choices for the discerning traveler.

Petralona is one of the most picturesque neighborhoods in the city, evoking the charm of old Athens. With its retro and nostalgic atmosphere, you can enjoy delicious meze and flavorful dishes of Greek cuisine at venues with outdoor seating. Traditional tavernas, modern eateries, and meze restaurants invite you to a delightful and memorable culinary experience.

Exarcheia area has an edgy alternative vibe, its streets decorated with politically charged murals and lined with bookshops and stores selling rare vinyl and vintage guitars. Bars and clubs host live music, including rembetika (Greek blues), jazz and punk acts.

Enjoy the street art with graffitis and classic movies in open air cinemas. Exarcheia is one of the most vibrant, colourful and exciting neighbourhoods in Athens.

name: Stylish living by Acropolis (Monastiraki 5)
description: 'Monastiraki5'is a minimal flat on the third floor at the historical center of Athens, right under Acropolis. The Monastiraki metro station  is 2 minutes walking distance (150m) from this new, modern, urban-industrial flat in the most picturesque neighborhood of Athens with its narrow streets, the famous flea market, street vendors, antique shops and many taverns and cafes with the most stunning view of the ancient sites and Acropolis .
neighborhood_overview: Monastiraki is suitable for long walks in the narrow streets full of countless small stores where on Sunday there is an open market right next to the remains of the Roman Agora and under the Acropolis. From the other hand there is Psiri, one of the liveliest districts with endless choices of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops. In addition, only a few meters away the famous 150 years old Municipal Varvakios fish Market and Evripidou Street the so called 'traditional market area' full of spices, herbs, meat, cold cuts and dairy products from small artisan producers all over Greece.

name: Modern 70m2 suite near Kolonaki Square
description: This elegant apartment is located in the best and safest area of Athens, the famous Kolonaki. In the heart of the city and within walking distance of Syntagma Square, the Parliament, the Benaki Museum, the Museum of Cycladic Art, the National Gallery, the Byzantine & Christian Museum, embassies, ministries and antique shops. It is the ideal pied-à-terre for a morning walk in Lycabettus Hill or a coffee in Kolonaki square shopping in City Link and lunch in the countless restaurants in the centre.
neighborhood_overview: Kolonaki is the most elegant and stately neighborhood in central Athens, with neoclassical and modernist buildings and numerous trendy restaurants and boutiques. It stretches out from Syntagma Square to the foot of Lycabettus hill, the highest point of Athens. Kolonaki is full of parks and gardens and is defined by its classical and modernist buildings which make it one of the most exquisite neighborhoods in Athens. This is a charming district to discover by foot and a great place to enjoy a beverage or a bite to eat in any of its modern terraces and restaurants. It is also renowned for its shopping streets packed with high-end boutiques, fashionable clothing stores, and where the top Greek designers sell their products. Last but not least, Kolonaki is home to the Presidential Palace, the Maximos Mansion, the Parliament, many Embassies and Ministries and is the safest disctrict in Athens.

neighborhood_overview:
Psellion apartment is in the liveliest location of athenian historical triangle but in a noticeably quiet building. The most important sights and monuments are only few minutes away. The apartment is between the two busier metro Stations on Syntagma and Monastiraki Squares, only 350 – 450 meters on foot (3 – 4 minutes away). The most crowded city streets with plenty of shops, supermarkets, restaurants, fast food, coffee shops, bars, etc. are only few meters away. More specifically, the apartment is located less than fifty meters from the famous Karytsi Square, famous for its nightlife. Black Duck bistrot, Barley Cargo, Blink, Gin Joint, La vie en rock, Pairi daeza, Priza, The Bank Job, The Seven Jokers, Toy Cafe bar, Shakespeare bar are some of the most famous bars.

neighborhood_overview:
The cutting-edge hotel enjoys a privileged and ideal location in the historic heart of the city, next to Athens City Hall, within walking distance of the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum, the ancient city of Plaka and most of the attractions and sights of Athens.

Let yourself be seduced and let your curiosity lead you to important moments in history in this ancient place, such as:

The Acropolis: The Athenians always considered the Acropolis hill as a holly place. It has been inhabited since Mycenaean times, and increasingly majestic temples were built on it, ending with the great constructions pioneered by Pericles.

The Parthenon: The star of the Acropolis of Athens is undoubtedly the Parthenon. Despite having been sacked to the ground and being in a permanent state of rehabilitation, its imposing silhouette continues to dominate the Greek capital from the top.

Ancient Greece: Ancient Greece is considered the foundation of European culture.

name: La suite Margaux
description:
This is a sunny, fully refurbished 60 ㎡apartment in the centre of the most elegant Athenian neighbourhood, Kolonaki.
It is on the fifth floor of a beautiful block of flats.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is conveniently situated in a walking distance (7 minutes) from Syntagma Square, and therefore the 3 underground lines, the tram, and most of the bus lines including the one that connect the city centre to the airport. It is also in a walking distance from most of the historical sights of Athens and most of the museums.
One minute walking distance from Kolonaki Square, the most well known and elegance neighborhood in Athens. Three minutes from Dexameni Square, at the basis of Lycabettus hill.

neighborhood_overview: Koukaki is a quiet urban area at the center Athens municipality, close to Acropolis and tourist attractions. The neighborhood has many restaurants and wine or beer bars, but we are located just far way from the noise and only 5 minutes walk from them.The nearby Metro Syngrou-Fix station, will provide you with easy access for the airport or other areas of Athens. A few minutes ride away from Piraeus Port and Alimos Marina and cruises port, the Contemporary Arts museum and the Niarchos and Onassis cultural centers. from the main Athens Avenue of Syngrou one can have easy access to the Athens Riviera and the nearby sea sides for swimming.
host_about: Part of the Modernism movement and Art Nouveau, The Koukaki Residence abounds in breath taking design elements that will definitely conquer your heart! From the monumental entrance, to the signature stairway which is a work of art of its own, all reflect the nobility of the Greek Bourgeois family who lived in this building at the beginning of the century. All the above encircle the Secret Garden in the middle, which is the Koukaki Residence's best kept secret.

neighborhood_overview: Exarcheia is a vibrant neighborhood known for its numerous neoclassical mansions, publishing houses, bookshops, music and art venues, theaters, cinemas, restaurants, bars, and cafes. It holds significant importance in Greek history. Conveniently located just 10 minutes from Athens Central Market, Exarcheia is easily accessible by public transport, including the Omonoia metro station. The Red Line provides direct connections to the Acropolis, Syntagma, the airport, and the National Museum of Modern Art, while the Green Line leads to the port of Piraeus. Many of the city's main attractions are also within walking distance.
